loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 21-year-old mother from the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She volunters as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching leadership skills to secondary school students. 

In addition, Diana earns an income operating a poultry business. Over the past year, she has grown her business to its current capacity which produced about 50 broiler birds every six weeks.  She sells them to the local residents. 

Diana started the business because she wanted to be financially independent. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. With the success of her business, she hopes to remain financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase  broiler chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.pt: A Senhora Verónica é viúva vive apenas com a filha.  Ela é técnica de Administração Pública. Com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir material de construção tais como cimento, varões, pedras para reabilitar a casa onde vive. Tem  sonho de se tornar mestre em administração pública, e terminar a sua casa dos”sonhos” no zona de Belo-Horizonte.
texts.en: Veronica is a widow and lives with her daughter only. She's a public administration technician. With the current loan she wishes to purchase construction supplies such as cement, rods and rocks so that she can repair the house she lives in. Her dream is to get a master's degree in public administration and finish her "dream" house in the Belo-Horizonte area.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as cement, rods and rocks so she can repair her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods (cassava, palm, and soft drinks) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy onions, washing soap, tomatoes and vita.

loans.name: Nelsy  Yenibeth

texts.es:
El mundo está lleno de oportunidades y Nelsy siempre trata de aprovechar cada una de ellas. Es una mujer amable y trabajadora, quien hace cinco años al no encontrar un trabajo estable, decidió afiliarse a una empresa de cosméticos y comercializarlos, de manera que pudiese progresar. Día a día, con mucho entusiasmo sale a ofrecer los productos por toda la comunidad, sus clientes están contentos por la calidad de atención que les brinda. Tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 7 y 3 años. Recibe el apoyo de su familia, las remesas de su padre y sus hermanos son un pilar importante en la economía familiar. 
Así como los ingresos son de mucha importancia para la familia, también lo es la salud, razón principal por la que Nelsy solicita el crédito, puesto que desea mejorar la infraestructura del servicio higiénico de su casa de habitación, de manera que puedan realizar las necesidades fisiológicas en un lugar seguro. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento para cumplir dicho objetivo. Otra de sus metas es culminar sus estudios universitarios, los que había pospuesto al tener su primer hijo y así obtener mejores propuestas laborales, para brindarles a sus hijos un futuro prospero.
texts.en:
The world is full of opportunities, and Nelsy is always trying to seize each one of them. She is a kind and hardworking woman. Five years ago, unable to find a steady job, she decided to join a cosmetics company and sell cosmetics, so she could move forward. Every day, with great enthusiasm, she offers her products throughout the community. Her customers are very happy because of the quality of service she provides. 

She is 25 years old, married, and has two children (ages seven and three). She gets support from her family. Her father’s remittance and her siblings are an important pillar to the household economy.  

Just as income is very important to the family, so too is health. This is the main reason why Nelsy is requesting the loan. She wishes to improve the infrastructure of the bathroom in her home, so they can have a safe place that meets their needs. She relies on the loan to fulfill that goal.

Her other goal is to finish her university studies—which she had to postpone when she had her first child—so she can have better job opportunities to give her children a prosperous future.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of the bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  buy fish, pigs feet, and rice to sell.

loans.name: La'azarus Babalas

texts.en: La'azaru Babalas is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. La'azaru Babalas joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Rhoda, Deborah,  and  Yosi. La'azaru Babalas is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, La'azaru Babalas will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would  be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, La'azaru Babalas can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, La'azaru Babalas said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family.” La'azaru Babalas is not thinking about just this year; he said, “in 5 years, I want to become the  most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Halunah

texts.en:
Hallunah has previously borrowed from UGAFODE. He is a 39-year-old married man with 5 children.

He applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to improve his agriculture business. He will use the loan to buy improved seeds and manure. He earns a small  income from his farm and therefore wants to increase his family's income by transforming his banana plantation.  He wants to take his children to better schools  and provide more food for them. 

He wants to earn a larger income so that he can  look after his  family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds and organic manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase eggs, bologna, soft drinks, beverages and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sunday Laro

texts.en: Sunday Laro remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Sunday Laro, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Sunday Laro is ambitious and is aiming to reap 50 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, expressed  Sunday Laro. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coconuts and red oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers and blouses.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Sunday, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Sunday is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty”, expressed Sunday. With this loan, Sunday is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Preach

texts.en: Preach is a young businesswoman from the Binga District of Zimbabwe. She has been selling clothes at her local shopping center for the past year. In addition to running the business, she also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide and stresses the importance of education to students. With the Kiva loan, she would like to purchase clothes in bulk to resell and increase sales and profits. With the additional profits, Preach would like to pay her siblings’ school fees.

loans.use: to increase her stock by purchasing clothes in bulk

loans.name: Rutendo

texts.en:
Rutendo is a 24-year-old businesswoman from the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. Rutendo teaches young students life skills as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide. 

As an entrepreneur, Rutendo's poultry business produces about 50 broiler birds every six weeks and she sells them to local residents. Rutendo requests a Kiva loan to purchase  broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production and expand her business. 

She intends to use the profits to remain financially independent and pursue her education.

loans.use: to purchase broiler chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
O senhor  José  é segurança tem 31 anos de idade casado e pai de um filho um filho para além da sua esposa e seu filho sustenta a sua mãe uma irmã e sobrinho enviando.
Com o financiamento pretende comprar farinha de trigo, cervejas, refrescos, arroz para reforçar o volume do seu negocio.
O seu sonho é ter uma ferragem para vender  material de consttrução visto que sua zona ainda está em expansão há muitas obras e para adiquirir o material precisam percorrer grandes distâncias.
Desafios dificuldades financeiras, insuficiência de fundos. Alem de trabalhar como seguranca tambem tem uma mini mercearia na sua casa. Irá solicitar mais empréstimos com vista a concretizar este plano.
texts.en:
José is a security guard. He's 31 years old and married, and he has a son. Aside from his wife and son he supports his mother, a sister and a nephew.
With the loan he intends to purchase wheat flour, beer, refreshments, and rice in order to increase turnover in his business.
His dream is to own a hardware store in order to sell construction supplies. This is due to the fact that his neighborhood is expanding and there's a lot of construction work being done, and people need to travel long distances to buy the supplies.
His challenges are financial hardships and lack of funds. Aside from working as a security guard he also owns a small grocery store in his house. He will request more loans so as to achieve his plan.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, beer, refreshments, and rice.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 40-year-old married man with 4 children between the ages of 1 and 10. Two children attend school. 

He is a banana trader in the  Lwabanda and Ddwaniro trading centers and works for 2 days a week and 10 hours per day. He is motivated by the fact that this is his area of expertise.

He also grows maize, beans, tomatoes and cabbage to earn an additional income to support his family. He hopes to use the loan to buy bananas and open  another market stall to better serve his customers.

He hopes to expand his business with his savings. He is an honest and hard working business man who appreciates the lenders.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy frozen chicken and fish to sell.

loans.name: María Petronila

texts.es:
María de 42 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado en su comunidad, no pudo continuar con sus estudios debido a los problemas que afrontó el país en esa época, se acompaño hace quince años y su pareja está en USA, es madre de cuatro hijos, tres de los cuales estudian en el nivel básico en la comunidad y uno trabaja en un taller de carpintería que tiene su cuñado.


María se dedica a la siembra de cultivos de maíz y frijoles, actualmente tiene una hectárea de maíz y media hectárea de frijoles, ella debe estar pendiente de sus cultivos todos los días de la semana, por las tardes la acompaña su hijo y su hija mayor, anteriormente María trabajó por siete años en una tienda que estaba en la hacienda donde cultivaban café.


Ella solicita este crédito para comprar una novilla y el resto lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
Así cumplirá uno de sus sueños de trabajar en la ganadería, pues siempre le ha llamado la atención, además pretende obtener muy buenas cosechas que le permitan asegurar la alimentación para sus hijos.


María sueña con que sus hijos sigan estudiando y seguir trabajando con ganado.
texts.en:
Maria, 42, got a 3rd grade education in her community, but was not able to continue with her studies due to problems faced by the country at the time.  She's had a partner for 15 years, and her partner is now in the USA.  She is the mother of 4 children, 3 of whom attend elementary school in the community. Her other child works in her brother-in-law's carpentry workshop.

Maria has a business cultivating corn and beans.  She currently has one hectare of corn and a half-hectare of beans.  She has to watch over her crops every day of the week.  In the evenings she's accompanied by her son and older daughter.  Previously Maria worked for 7 years in a store that was located on a coffee farm. 

Maria is requesting this loan to buy a bull, and also to buy fertilizers for her crops.  This way, she will accomplish one of her dreams: to work with livestock, as this has always been an interest of hers.  In addition, she plans to obtain very good harvests that will ensure that she will have food for her children.  

Maria dreams that her children will continue to study, and that she can continue to work with livestock.

loans.use: to buy a bull and to buy fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Haruna joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Ilkana, Yosi, and Phoebe. Haruna is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Haruna will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Haruna can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Haruna said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Haruna is not thinking about just this year; he said in 5 years, he wants to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
As a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe, Angella, a 21-year-old woman, teaches life skills to young students at the nearby school. 

Angella also runs her own business selling food items at a grocery stall. She is interested in obtaining a Kiva loan because she would like to purchase kapenta (dried sardines), cremora (non-dairy creamer), and soya mince (beef substitute) to sell to community members. Angella hopes that her business will prosper and she will be able to open her own store. If her business expands, it will be more stable and she will be able to provide for her family’s basic needs more easily.

loans.use: to purchase kapenta, cremora and soya mince.

loans.name: Filipe

texts.pt:
O senhor Filipe tem 44 anos de idade, é tractorista numa empresa do ramo Agrίcola, é casado, pai de 5 filhos dos quais apenas um estuda outros por falta de condições para ingressarem no ensino superior não estudam. 
Com o valor do crédito irá comprar areia, cimento, barrotes, e chapas de zinco para dar continuidade a sua obra tipo dois que esta na fase da cobertura.
Diz ser seu maior sonho conseguir mandar seus filhos para o ensino superior, mobilar a sua casa, como forma de melhorar suas condições de vida.
Compromete se a pagar pontualmente nas datas acordadas no contrato e que irá solicitatr mais empréstimo pois com esta ajuda irá dar um grande passo na sua obra.
texts.en:
Filipe is 44 years old. He's a tractor driver for an agricultural company. He's married and has five children, only one of whom studies. The others do not study because they couldn't afford to go to college.
With the amount of the loan he'll purchase sand, cement, beams, and zinc sheets so that he can continue building his two-bedroom house, which is currently being roofed.
He states that his biggest dream is to be able to send his children to college and furnish his house as a way of improving his living conditions.
He pledges to repay the loan in a timely fashion according to the scheduled dates. He will request more loans, because with this help he'll take a major step forward in his construction work.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, beams, and zinc sheets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy under wear and cream to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
A senhora Alice de 33 anos de idade, viúva, māe de 3 filhos dois dos quais estudam e outro ainda é menor vive na casa própria nāo sustenta mais ninguém alem dos filhos.
Quer comprar óleo, bebidas, refresco e produtos de 1ª necessidade para reforçar o seu negócio que é feito na sua casa.
Planos para o futuro quer terminar a construçāo de sua barraca  que está na fase da cobertura e passar a vender lá.
Diz que vai solicitar mais empréstimos pois o seu objectivo é satisfazer as necessidades de seus clientes epara isso precisa diversificar os produtos.
texts.en:
Alice is 33 years old and a widow. She has three children, two of whom study and the other is still below school age. She lives in a house that she owns and doesn't support anyone else other than her children.
She wishes to purchase cooking oil, beverages, refreshments and household staples in order to boost the business she runs in her home.
Her plan for the future is to finish building her booth which is currently being roofed and then conduct her sales from there.
She states that she'll request more loans, because her goal is to meet her customers' needs and for that she needs to diversify her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, beverages, refreshments and household staples.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more red oil and Argo to sell.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linnet is a young businesswoman from the Binga District of Zimbabwe. She sells clothes at a flea market and teaches life skills as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide. With the Kiva loan, she would like to purchase more and better quality clothes from wholesalers at lower costs. She would then resell them at competitive prices and attract more customers. With a thriving business, Linnet will be able to support her siblings in their educational endeavors.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Dantine

texts.en: Dantine is a Babban Gona farmer from Kunda. Dantine expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Dantine to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Dantine can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Dantine, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 40 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Dantine will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family”. With this loan, Dantine will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods fish to sell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a 24-year-old entrepreneur from the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. As a Camfed Learner Guide, she volunteers at a secondary school every week to teach life skills to students. Additionally, Sandra rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Sandra will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will allow her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.pt:
A senhora Adélia de 30 anos de idade, casada mãe de 6 filhos dos quais um ainda é menores e os restantes cinco estudam.
Com o valor do emprestimo vai comprar cimento, ferro, blocos, areia, pedra para dar continuidade a construção de sua casa.
Tem como planos para o futuro concluir a construção da sua casa, adiquirir bens e ter um negócio fixo uma vez que ela e vendedeira ambulante.
Diz que para concretizar seus planos irá pagar pontualmente de acordo com o contrato estabelecido e continuar a trabalhar com a hluvuku solicitando mais empréstimo.
texts.en:
Adélia is 30 years old and married. She has six children, one of whom is still below school age and the other ones study.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase cement, iron, bricks, and sand so that she can continue building her house.
Her plans for the future are to finish building her house, acquire goods, and own a fixed business, since she's currently a street vendor.
She states that in order to achieve her plans she'll repay the loan in a timely fashion, in accordance with the schedule. She'll also continue to work with Hluvuku and apply for more loans.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, bricks, sand, and rocks.

loans.name: Abulamo

texts.pt:
Abulamo de 63 anos, é pensionista e faz também negócio, casado pai de 6 filhos já maiores de idade vive na casa própria além dos filhos sustenta 1 neto que vive com ele. 
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar bolachas, doces, refrescos, sumos e bebidas para a sua loja que se encontra na sua antiga casa que neste momento está a rrendada.
Seu sonho é crescer no negócio satisfazendo as necessidades dos seus clientes, fazer aviários para a criação de frangos para revender.
Diz que compromete se a pagar nas datas concedidas no contrato e que voltará a solicitar mais empréstimos na hluvuku.
texts.en:
Abulamo is 63 years old. He's a pensioner and also a business owner. He's married and has six adult children. He lives in a house that he owns and aside from his children he also supports a grandson who lives with him.
He states that with the amount of the loan he'll purchase crackers, candy, refreshments, juice and beverages for his store. His store is located in his old house which is currenty being rented.
His dream is to make his business grow by meeting his customers' needs and to build coops in order to raise chickens for selling.
He states that he pledges to make the repayments in the scheduled dates and that he'll apply for more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase crackers, candy, refreshments, juice and beverages.

loans.name: Idris

texts.en: Idris is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Idris joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: . Idris is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Idris will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Idris can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Idris is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 37-year-old married woman from the village of Satemo. She has 3 little sons and a husband, whose income is the only significant source of income for the family. He is military personnel and gets a fixed salary. Tea has a small agricultural activity and has a great desire to increase her income. 

She requested a loan and was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the start-up program that gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. Tea plans to start a trading business with perfumes, purchasing and then selling in her community at increased prices. This will give her a chance to become financially independent and make better living conditions for her sons. She awaits your support and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: To start a trading business with perfumes and get an additional source of income.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 29-year-old businesswoman and mother from the Binga District of Zimbabwe. She sells clothes at a stall at the local flea market. Irene also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide as a life skills educator. With the Kiva loan, she intends to make bulk purchases of clothes to increase her sales and profits. With additional profits, Irene hopes to expand her business, create employment opportunities in her community and provide for her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as onions, pepper, tomatoes, rice, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples (meat, chicken, disposable products, rice, onions, tomatoes and other items) in order to increase turnover in her business.

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
A Sra. Marta de 46 anos de idade, mae de 5 filhos dos quais 2 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario e 3 sao maior de idade e independentes, sustenta sua familia com ajuda do seus filhos. Ela è negociante informal, sua mercadoria vende a porta da sua casa e por encomenda.
Com o presente  emprestimo sera usado para comprar (capulana e tecidos) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
Para o futuro espera reabilitar a casa, comprar mobiliar para sua casa e tem como grande desafio ter mais financiamento na Hluvuku-Adsema para garantir a sua reforma
texts.en:
Marta is 46 years. She has five children, two of whom attend primary and secondary school and three are independent adults. She supports her family with the help of her children. She's an informal trader and she sells her merchandise from home and on request.
The current loan will be used to purchase traditional skirt-type garments and fabric in order to increase turnover in her business.
In the future she hopes to repair her house and buy furniture for it. Her biggest challenge is getting more loans from Hluvuku-Adsema so that she can do the repair work.

loans.use: to purchase traditional skirt-type garments and fabric in order to increase turnover in her business.

loans.name: Shallon

texts.en:
Shallon is a long time client at the Ugafode branch. She is a single mother with two children who attend school. She operates an eating place as her major source of income. Her major challenges are competition and limited capital. 

She joined Ugafode and took a new loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy foodstuffs to cook in the restaurant, so that she can supplement her capital and be able to compete in the market. 

Shallon thanks Ugafode for their financial assistance which has enabled her to educate her children and sustain her business. She also thanks Ugafode for improving peoples' standards of living.

loans.use: To buy rice, posho, bananas and beans for the restaurant.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Adamu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Kerin and Ketrin. Adamu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Adamu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Adamu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Adamu said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland. Adamu is not thinking about just this year; he said in 5 years he wants to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
La señora María Josefina de 53 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene dos  hijos que dependen de ella, se dedica desde hace 16 años al negocio de compra venta de ropa nueva y usada, costura, venta de tortillas y frescos.
Doña María Josefina su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, también sale a vender ropa de forma ambulante, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña María Josefina está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de blusas, vestidos, camisas, faldas, calzonetas, maíz, cal, leña, etc. para invertir en sus negocios,  con el apoyo del crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Doña María Josefina su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del 2014.
texts.en:
Maria Josefina, 53 years old, is a single mother with two children who depend on her support.  She has earned her living for more than 16 years by selling new and used clothing, selling tortillas and soft drinks, and sewing.   Her business location is her home.  She also goes out to sell clothing on the street.  

Maria Josefina is a hard-working woman who wants to get ahead in life.  She is seeking a loan to buy blouses, dresses, shirts, skirts, footwear, corn, lime, firework, etc., to stock her business.  With the help of this loan she wants to increase her income and have a better standard of life.  Her dream is to improve her business and her house.

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, shirts, skirts, footwear, corn, lime, firewood, etc., for her business

loans.name: Silvino

texts.pt:
O Sr. Silvino de 25 anos de idade casado, sustenta  seu irmão. Ele è empacotador de banana na empresa s de producao de banana.
Com o presente emprestimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento e mao-de-obra) para  dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Silvino is 25 years old and married, and he supports his brother. He's a banana packer for a banana company.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (bricks and cement) and to pay for labor so that he can continue building his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (bricks and cement) and to pay for labor so that he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Manuel  tem  31 anos de idade e pedreiro por conta própria, casado pai de 2 filhos  1 a estudar outro ainda menor de idade vive na casa própria sustenta também  um sobrinho que vive com ele.
Com este valor  vai comprar areia, cimento, pedra, para dar continuidade a sua obra tipo 2 para arrendar.
Projectos para o futuro pretende fazer uma loja na sua casa para venda de produtos reforcando assim a sua  renda familiar, fazer mais dependencias para arendar.
Diz que gostaria de voltar a solicitar mais creditos para concretizar este sonho e que ira pagar pontualmente.
texts.en:
Manuel is 31 years old and a self-employed bricklayer. He's married and has two children, one of whom studies and the other is still below school age. He also supports a nephew who lives with him.
With this loan he'll purchase sand, cement, and rocks so that he can continue building his two-bedroom house for renting out.
His project for the future is to set up a store in his house in order to sell merchandise, therefore increasing his family's income. He'll also build more rooms for renting out.
He states that he would like to apply for more loans so he can achieve his dream, and that he'll repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and rocks so he can continue building his two-bedroom house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amélia

texts.pt:
Amélia, solteira, mãe de um filho menor de idade e vive na casa própria. Para além do seu filho sustenta também seu irmão. 
É comerciante (dedica-se a compra e venda de vestuário, cobertores e roupas de cama) há mais de cinco anos. 
Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais fronhas, cortinas, cobertores e roupas de cama para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock a fim de garantir credibilidade nos seus clientes.
Tem como sonhos concluir a sua obra. O principal desafio é a falta de fundos para investir no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Amélia is single and has an underage son. She lives in a house that she owns. Aside from her son she also supports her brother.
She has been a vendor (she sells clothing, blankets and bed linens) for over five years.
With the current loan for 10,000mt she intends to purchase more pillowcases, curtains, blankets and bed linens. That way she'll meet the demand by stocking up so as to garner credibility with her customers.
Her dream is to finish her construction work. Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds for investing in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more pillowcases, curtains, blankets and bed linens.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.pt:
Carolina, solteira, mãe de 5 filhos, dos quais 3 é que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também seus irmãos que vivem com ela. 
É avicultora (dedica-se a compra de pintos para criação) há mais de sete anos. Também é Chefe de Rega na Açucareira de Xinavane.
Com o presente empréstimo de 20.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais pintos, sacos de ração e medicantos para aumentar o volume da mercadoria a fim de satisfazer a demanda.
Tem como sonhos melhorar seu negócio e construir uma casa condigna. Tem como principal desafio: a falta de fundos para investir no negócio.
texts.en:
Carolina is single and has five children, three of whom attend various levels of school. She lives in a house that she owns. Aside from her family she also supports her siblings who live with her.
She has been a poultry farmer (she buys chicks for raising) for over seven years. She's also in charge of watering for the Xinavane sugar company.
With the current loan for 20,000mt she intends to purchase more chicks, sacks of feed and medicine. That way she'll stock up on merchandise in order to meet the demand.
Her dreams are to improve her business and build a decent house. Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds for investing in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, sacks of feed and medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing, beds, appliances and blankets.

loans.name: Theresie

texts.en:
Theresie, aged 41 years, is married with two children, aged 6 and 12; both of them go to school. Her business is to sell foodstuffs, and she has also been selling animals such as cows, goats and sheep for the past three years. Her husband works as a motorcyclist. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more cows and goats for sale. The profits from the business will be used for building a house.

loans.use: to buy more goats, cows and sheep for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy basic grains like rice, beans, oil, beef, pork, carrots, ayote squash, beets, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para comprar galletas, dulces, agua, sodas, jugos, etc. al por mayor para seguir surtiendo a las tiendas de sus clientes y su chalet, espera que su situación económica siga mejorando y cancelar la nueva deuda.
Con ayuda del financiamiento tuvo un mejor inventario para distribuirlo entre las tienda, sus nuevas ganancias han sido utilizadas para cancelar sus deudas, mejorar el estilo de vida familiar y lograr abrir un chalet en el que ofrece diferentes productos a sus clientes, con ello tiene ingresos extras.
texts.en:
Victor decided to take a new loan to buy cookies, sweets, water, sodas, juices, etc, at wholesale so that he can continue to stock the stores of his customers and his own store.  He hopes that his own financial situation will keep improving so that he can pay off this new debt.

With the help of his prior loan he had more inventory to distribute to stores.  His new earnings were used to pay off his debts, improve his family's lifestyle, and open a store where he sells various products to his customers.  With this store he generates some additional income.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale to distribute and to stock his store

loans.name: Maxima Rosa

texts.es:
Por las calles de un municipio de Estelí, se escucha todas las mañanas las voz de una señora de 63 años gritar “rosquillas, lleve sus riquísimas rosquillas”, ella es Máxima, mejor conocida por sus vecinos como doña Mancha. Madre soltera de cinco hijos entre las edades de 42 a 21 años, una de sus hijas vive con ella junto con su nieto. Desde hace 26 años es comerciante ambulante de rosquillas, puesto que le gusta desde los 16 años, cuando lo aprendió de su mamá, quien también se dedicaba a lo mismo. A medida que pasaba el tiempo, miró que era una salida socioeconómica, por lo que para ella resultaba no solo un pasatiempo, sino que la manera de sustentar a sus hijos. Doña Mancha llegó hasta la secundaria, debido a problemas económicos, pero siempre les inculcó a sus hijos la importancia de la educación. 
El apoyo de sus hijos ha sido indispensable para ella, pues considera a su familia como lo más importante. Por esta razón, quiere mejorar las condiciones higiénicas en su hogar. Necesita de un préstamo para construir un baño, ya que las condiciones del que actualmente tiene son pésimas, no tiene ducha, usa barriles donde almacena el agua, parte de las paredes son de zinc, el suelo es de cemento y no tiene más luz que la que entra por el techo. Con el baño mejorado, podrá gozar ella, su hija y principalmente su nieto, de un mejor servicio higiénico.  Entre sus metas está seguir creciendo profesionalmente, para ir invirtiendo poco a poco en su casa.
texts.en:
On the streets of the city of Esteli, every morning the voice of a 63 year old woman is heard, calling "rosquillas, buy your delicious rosquillas" (donuts)
This is  Máxima, better known to her neighbors as Mancha.  She is single, and the mother of five children between the ages of 21 and 42.  One of her daughters lives with her as does a grandson.  For 26 years Máxima has been a street vendor of rosquillas, work she has enjoyed since learning how from her mother at age 16.  Her mother also sold donuts.  As time passed, Máxima saw  this as a socioeconomic opportunity, so that for her donut sales became not just a pastime, but a way to support her children.  

Máxima only studied till high school, due to financial needs, but always taught her children the importance of education.  Helping her children has been essential for her, because Máxima thinks of her family as the most important thing.  For this reason she wants to improve the hygienic conditions in her home.  She needs a loan to build a bathroom, since the state of the current one is dreadful.  The bathroom lacks a shower and has only barrels for water storage. The walls are partially made of metal sheets; the floor is cement, and the only light comes through the roof.  With the bathroom improved, Máxima, her daughter and especially her grandson can enjoy better sanitary service.  Among her goals is to keep growing professionally, in order to little by little invest in home improvements.

loans.use: to build a bathroom

loans.name: Zakaria Lawal

texts.en: Zakaria Lawal is a Babban Gona farmer from Kunda. Zakaria Lawal expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Zakaria Lawal to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Zakaria Lawal can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Zakaria Lawal is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Zakaria Lawal will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family”. With this loan, Zakaria Lawal will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en:
Janviere is 26 years old, with one child of 8 months. She works together with her husband, and their business for the past seven years has been to sell spare parts. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more spare parts for the bicycles and a few for motorbikes. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jose Saturnino

texts.es:
José, es un agricultor en pequeño que se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijol, también cultiva hortalizas especialmente pepino, ejotes y pipián, el oficio se lo enseño su padre, trabaja desde muy joven a tiempo completo. Don José tiene 61 años de edad y su esposa tiene 55 años de edad, ella le apoya en su trabajo.
El préstamo que requiere lo utilizara para comprar de media manzana  de terreno para ampliar el área de cultivo de hortalizas, con lo que pretende aumentar la productividad y generar mayores ingresos que le servirán para mejorar las circunstancias familiares y cancelar sus deudas.
Su sueño es mantenerse trabajando para lograr  adquirir más terrenos en el que pueda cultivar y dejar de pagar arrendamiento.
texts.en:
José is a small farmer who grows basic grains such as corn and beans. He also grows vegetables, especially cucumbers, string beans, and squash.  His father taught him how to do this work, and he has been working full-time since he was very young. Don José is 61 years old, and his wife is 55. She helps him with his work.

He will use the loan to purchase a 0.868 acre plot of land, in order to expand the area in which he grows vegetables.  By doing this, he hopes to increase productivity and generate more income that will help him to improve his family’s circumstances and pay off his debts.

His dream is to keep working in order to be able to purchase more plots of land that he can cultivate, and stop leasing.

loans.use: to purchase a 0.868 acre plot of land in order to expand the area in which he grows vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy locks, nails, paint brushes to sell.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a 23-year-old businesswoman from the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe. She devotes her time to assisting the elderly in her community who do not have anyone to care for them. She is also a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school, where she teaches life skills and cooperative learning to students. 

To support her family, Cynthia operates a stall at a local flea market and sells shirts, t-shirts, trousers, skirts, shoes, slippers, baby clothes, and jewelry. She intends to use the Kiva loan to purchase her products in bulk so she can meet the demand of her customers. 

Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store one day. With a more stable business, Cynthia will find it easier to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, t-shirts, trousers, skirts, shoes, slippers, baby clothes, and jewelry in bulk.

loans.name: Gean

texts.en:
Gean is a young businesswoman from the Mt Darwin District of Zimbabwe. She devotes her time to assisting the elderly in her community who do not have anyone to care for them. 

When she is not volunteering in the community, Gean spends her time at her stall at a local flea market where she sells products such as shirts, t-shirts, trousers, skirts, baby clothes, and lingerie. 

Gean will use the Kiva loan to increase her stock to improve sales. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to further her education as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To increase her stock to improve sales.

loans.name: Xhevahire

texts.en:
Xhevahire is a 53-year-old villager and a married mother of a 16-year-old who does agriculture/livestock for living and is requesting this loan to buy a dairy cow. 

She lives in a village situated in a field area in the district of Korca, known for the large quantity of planting and selling wheat, beans and Lima beans, red onions, and apples. They also produce other grains such as oats, barley, corn and rye.  

Xhevahire plants mostly wheat and has got a cow with a calf and earns a living from both activities. Kindly note that she plants/produces large quantities of wheat. Her husband receives a disability income, yet he helps with the physical work demands of agriculture.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase the raw milk she sells; this will bring in more money

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy goods such as oil, seasoning cubes, pepper, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as fish, meat, cassava, plantain.

loans.name: María Reina

texts.es:
María de 37 años de edad, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, carpintería y además es fontanero, tiene un hijo que estudia en la escuela de la comunidad, María estudió hasta tercer grado, sus padres ya no pudieron apoyarla debido a las condiciones económicas y a la guerra que sufrió el país en esa época.


María se dedica a los oficios domésticos, además trabaja de lunes a viernes con su esposo en los trabajos agrícolas, actualmente han sembrado dos hectáreas de maíz y media hectárea de frijoles en las colinas de la comunidad y necesitan estar pendientes del cuido y manejo de los cultivos, para llegar al lugar tiene que caminar media hora por veredas en los cerros para llegar a los cultivos.


Ella solicita este crédito para invertir en la reparación de una maquina de trabajo de su esposo, el resto del dinero lo necesita para invertir en los cultivos de maíz y frijoles, además pagará el alquiler de la tierra donde actualmente está preparando para la milpa. 


Ella sueña con que su hijo se prepare profesionalmente, además pretende con su esposo ampliar su taller de carpintería para incrementar la elaboración de muebles y ofrecer a sus clientes mejores y mas productos.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old and married, and her husband makes a living in agriculture and carpentry and is also a plumber. They have a son who is studying in the community school. María studied up to the third grade; her parents couldn't support her beyond that due to the financial conditions and the war that the country suffered at that time.

María dedicates herself to domestic work and also works with her husband from Monday to Friday in agricultural work. They have currently planted two hectares of corn and half a hectare of beans in the hills of the community and they need to be focused on caring for and managing the crops. They have to walk half an hour on trails in the hills to reach their fields.

She is asking for this loan to invest in the repair of a machine that her husband uses for work, and she needs the rest of the money to invest in the corn and bean crops. She will also pay the rent for the land she is currently preparing for corn.

She dreams that her son will study to be a professional. She also intends, with her husband, to expand his carpentry shop to increase the production of furniture and to offer his customers better and more products.

loans.use: to invest in the repair of a machine that her husband uses for work and to invest in the corn and bean crops. She will also pay the rent for the land she is currently preparing for corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods, slippers, used clothes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cream, roll-on, sprays to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline, aged 31years, is married with two children, aged 4 and 6. Both go to school. 

She works together with her husband. Their business has been selling spare parts of motorcycles and bicycles for the past ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more spare parts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is an old client to the organization.  He is married with three children.

He applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000. He runs an animal drug shop at Kinyasaano, Rukungiri district as his major source of income which he has operated for six years; however, his major challenge is insufficient capital which affects his sales and profit. The purpose of the loan is to buy more drugs so that he can compete favorably in the market and get profits and raise money for his family's financial needs, like paying school fees for his siblings, and sustain his business. 

Alex is an honest and hardworking man but is always limited by capital. His dream is to expand his business and earn more profits. With this loan from UGAFODE, Alex is hopeful that the situation will improve gradually.

loans.use: To buy drugs to sell in a pharmacy

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
Erica is a 21-year-old woman from the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe. She is a source of inspiration to young people in her community because she is determined to succeed. Erica often volunteers at the local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills to young students. 

When Erica is not volunteering, she operates a grocery shop at her local business center. She sells sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, and snacks to community members. Erica will use the Kiva loan to purchase cartons of sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, and soft drinks to boost sales. Erica hopes to expand her business into a larger store, if profits allow.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, and soft drinks to boost sales.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.pt:
Zaida, viúva, mãe de 4 filhos, dos quais 2 é que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também 3 irmãos que vivem com ela. 
É comerciante (dedica-se a compra e venda de produtos alimentares) há mais de dez anos e também é Activista.
Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais sacos de feijão manteiga, de amendoim, de cebola, de açúcar e caixas de tomate para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonhos melhorar seu negócio, construir uma casa condigna e financiar os estudos dos seus filhos. Tem como principais desafios: a falta de fundos para investir no negócio, na habitação e para o apoio dos familiares.
texts.en:
Zaida is a widow and has four children, two of whom attend different levels of school. She lives in a house that she owns. Aside from her family she also supports three siblings who live with her.
She has been a vendor (she buys and sells foodtuffs) for over ten years, and she's also an activist.
With the current loan for 10,000mt she intends to purchase more bags of wax beans, peanuts, onions and sugar, and boxes of tomatoes. That way she'll meet the demand by stocking up.
Her dreams are to improve her business, build a decent house and pay for her children's studies. Her main challenge is the lack of funds for investing in her business and in her living conditions as well as for supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of wax beans, peanuts, onions and sugar, and boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Netsai

texts.en:
Netsai is a 27-year-old mother of two from the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe. Netsai is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide in her community, teaching leadership skills to secondary students. 

When she is not teaching young students, Netsai has been supporting her family with her grocery business for the past year. With her family’s assistance, Netsai sells sugar, rice, tea, stationery, sanitary products, cooking oil, and potato chips. 

Netsai is requesting a Kiva loan to buy her products in bulk. She will be able to reduce costs and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, tea, stationery, sanitary products, cooking oil, and potato chips in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough good charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Media

texts.en: Media is a young business lady living with her grandparents in Kwekwe district in Zimbabwe. She has been running a grocery store for the past two months now. She sells products such as sugar, salt, cooking oil and washing soap.  She also volunteers with CAMFED as a learner guide teaching student’s life skills education at the local school. With the requested loan, she intends to make bulk purchases of the groceries so as to boost her sales volumes and profits. With additional profits she intends to pay school fees for her siblings.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food items such as sardines, rice, and cookies to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods (charcoal) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy goods such as milk, sardines and luncheon-meat, etc, to resell.

loans.name: Markus Slowly

texts.en: Markus Slowly is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Markus Slowly joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Jibrin,Yahuza, and Dina. Markus Slowly is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Markus Slowly will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Markus Slowly can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Markus Slowly is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora María de los Ángeles de 39  años de edad es casada, tiene dos  hijos que dependen de ella, se dedica desde hace 12 años al negocio de compra venta de abarrotería es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
 Doña María de los Ángeles está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de abarrotería en general  como: maíz,  jabón,  pollo,  pescado, leche para hacer cuajada, frijoles, aceite, agua, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos, es su cuarto crédito que  solicita y está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Doña María de los Ángeles espera que esta inversión le ayude a seguir adelante con su negocio, en los prestamos anteriores a podido cumplir sus metas y esta vez espera que también las pueda lograr, su sueño es mejorar su casa y su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del 2014.
texts.en:
Maria de los Ángeles, 39 years old, is married and has two children who depend on her for support.  She has earned a living for 12 years by selling grocery store items.  She is a hard-working woman who wants to get ahead in life.

Maria de los Ángeles is asking for a loan to buy grocery sales items in general such as corn, soap, chicken, fish, milk to make cuajada cheese, beans, oil, water, etc.   With the help of this loan she wants to increase her earnings.  This is the fourth loan she has sought and she is happy to keep working with Prisma. Maria de los Ángeles hopes this investment will help her go forward with her business.  With the previous loans she has been able to fulfill her purposes and this time she also hopes to succeed.  Her dream is to improve her house and business.

loans.use: to buy corn, soap, chicken, fish, milk to make cuajada cheese, beans, oil, water, etc., for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Elizabeth joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children Lucia, Zilfa, and Jesy. Elizabeth is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Elizabeth will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she, would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Elizabeth can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Elizabeth said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Elizabeth is not thinking about just this year; she said in 5 years, she wants to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: Mathew is a 30-year-old farmer from Anguwan Kunda.  As a Babban Gona member, Mathew, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Mathew can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Mathew is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Mathew said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Amos, Susan, and Paul, and in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Wendy Marily

texts.es:
Wendy de 28 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, ya no siguió debido a problemas económicos que tenían sus padres, es madre de dos hijos de 1 y seis años de edad, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y ganadería, y de Wendy solo dependen sus hijos.


Wendy actualmente se dedica a la venta de pan y de tamales, los elabora de tres a cuatro veces a la semana, su madre le ayuda con el cuido de sus hijos, mientras su esposo trabaja en el cultivo de maíz y el cuido del ganado que tienen como familia. Anteriormente Wendy trabajó como sirvienta en una casa en la ciudad, y estas son las únicas actividades productos que ella realiza.


Ella solicita el crédito para comprar maíz, harina, azúcar, levadura y sal para producir pan y también hacer tamales, pues en el periodo de las vacaciones de agosto sus productos son bastantes vendidos debido a la demanda que hay por la visita de las personas a la comunidad.
Además invertirá en el cultivo de maíz y frijoles que está trabajando con su esposo.


El sueño Wendy es llegar a tener casa propia ya que actualmente vive en casa de su suegra y ella siempre ha querido darle a sus hijos mejores condiciones como tener su propio hogar.
texts.en:
Wendy, 28. studied until sixth grade. She didn't continue due to economic problems that her parents had. She is the mother of two children of 1 and six years of age. Her husband works in agriculture and animal raising, and only her children depend on Wendy.

Currently, Wendy works selling bread and tamales. She makes them three to four times a week. Her mother helps her with the care of her children, while her husband works growing corn and caring for the cattle that they have as a family. Previously, Wendy worked as a servant in a house in the city, and these are the only production activities that she does.

She is applying for the loan to buy corn, flour, sugar, yeast and salt to make bread and tamales too. In the period of August vacations her products are significantly sold due to the demand that there is because of this visit of people to the community. Additionally, she will invest in the cultivation of corn and beans that she is working on with her husband.

Wendy's dream is to come to have her own house since currently, she lives in the house of her stepmother. She has always wanted to give her children better conditions like having their own home.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour, sugar, yeast and salt to make bread and tamales too. Additionally, she will invest in the cultivation of corn and beans.

loans.name: Jose Dimas

texts.es:
José,  se siente agradecido por el apoyo que le brinda Kiva a través de Padecomsm, ya que los créditos le han permitido ir mejorando su negocio, las circunstancias familiares y se encuentra cancelando su deuda muy puntual.
Nuevamente requiere de más capital para comprar ganado y concentrado para alimentarlo,  con lo que aumentara sus ventas y ganancias que utilizara para alimentar mejor a su familia y poder cumplir con sus diferentes compromisos.
texts.en:
Jose is grateful for the help Kiva has provided him by means of Padecomsm.  The loans have allowed him to keep improving his business and his family's living conditions.  Jose has paid off his debts right on time.
He again needs more capital to buy cattle and to buy animal food concentrates, with which he will increase his sales and profits.   Jose will use those to feed his family better and be able to meet all his obligations.

loans.use: to buy cattle and animal food concentrates, with which he will increase his sales and profits

loans.name: Eduardo Jose

texts.es:
Las ganas de superación y el amor al trabajo han permitido que la pequeña pulpería de don Eduardo incremente poco a poco sus productos y sus ganancias. Un ambiente tranquilo con productos ordenados y de excelente calidad es lo que reciben los clientes al realizar sus compras diarias, todos manifiestan estar agradecidos. Tiene 52 años, está soltero y tiene dos hijos, ambos mayores e independientes. Hace cinco años decidió iniciar su negocio, empezó vendiendo golosinas y refrescos, ha incrementado su mercadería con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Eduardo solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar granos básicos como arroz y frijoles, también condimentos, refrescos, gaseosas, golosinas, productos de aseo personal entre otros. Su meta es seguir prosperando en el negocio, razón  por la que deposita su confianza en el financiamiento. Su meta es tener un amplio inventario que satisfaga las necesidades de sus clientes. Uno de sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar y acondicionar su pulpería. Trabajara mucho hasta cumplir sus objetivos, así como el de convertir en miscelánea su pequeña pulpería.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 52 years old. He is single and has two children, both of which are grown up and independent. Five years ago, Eduardo decided to start his business by selling candies and beverages, and due to his effort and dedication, he has increased his merchandise. His enthusiasm for self-improvement and love for working has allowed Eduardo's small grocery store to grow little by little in products and earnings. A tranquil environment with organized products of excellent quality are what clients experience as they make their daily purchases, and they say they are grateful for it. 

Eduardo is requesting a loan to increase the capital required to purchase staple foods such as rice and beans, as well as condiments, beverages, sodas, candies, and personal hygiene products among others. His goal is that his business will keep thriving, which is why he trusts this method of finance. Eduardo's other goal is to have a large inventory that satisfies the needs of his clients. One of his future plans is to improve the infrastructure of his home and remodel his shop. 

Eduardo will work until he meets his goals, so that he can transform his small grocery store.

loans.use: buy staple grains like rice and beans, as well as condiments, beverages, sodas, candies, and personal hygiene products among others.

loans.name: Philibus Namama

texts.en: Philibus Namama is a Babban Gona farmer from Anguwan Kunda. Philibus Namama is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Philibus Namama to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Philibus Namama can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Philibus Namama is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Philibus Namama is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family.  Ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Philibus Namama will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Las Brisas Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario las brisas es integrado por tres socias exitosas en su vida laboral y coordinado por la señora Ana de 35 años de edad y acompañada, se dedica  a la hecha y venta de tortilla en su domicilio, desde hace quince años y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de marca de leña, quintal de maíz, cal, bolsas, etc., la socia con los créditos anteriores ha invertido en su negocio, por ende ha aumentado las ganancias, lo que le permitió realizar un cuarto y reparo una pared. Otra de las socias es la señora Rosa de 23 años de edad, comerciante de sandias en el mercado de la municipalidad y la señora Rebeca de 46 años de edad y comercializa cajetas en las calles de la capital.
texts.en:
The village bank "Las Brisas" is made up of three members who are successful in their working lives. It is coordinated by Ana, 35 years old and married. She has been working making and selling tortillas in her home for the last fifteen years. She is applying for the loan for the purchase of firewood, 100kg of corn, lime, bags, etc. With the prior loans, the member has invested in her business, therefore she has increased her revenue, which has allowed her to make a room and repair a wall.

Another member is Rosa, 23, trader of watermelons in the market of the municipality and Rebeca, 46, who sells sweets in the streets of the capital.

loans.use: to buy firewood, 100kg of corn, lime, bags, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shovels, trowels, a chisel, leveling line, etc.

loans.name: Hauwa Samaila

texts.en: Hauwa Samaila is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Hauwa Samaila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her  children: Borno,Rauben, and Biliya. Hauwa Samaila is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Hauwa Samaila will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Hauwa Samaila can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, her said, “I plan to use the money  to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Hauwa Samaila is not thinking about this year alone; she expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: La'azarus

texts.en: La'azarus is a 30-year-old farmer from Kunda.  As a Babban Gona member, La'azarus is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, La'azarus can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, La'azarus is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Yowel,Rauben, and Rita. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Luz De Fe Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Luz de Fe, está integrado por tres socias emprendedoras y es coordinado por la señora Isabel de 36 años de edad y acompañada, quien se dedica a la comercializar frutas en el mercado de la municipalidad, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de mamón y nancite, para luego comercializarlos al por mayor y al detalle, con los créditos anteriores la socia ha logrado diversificar los productos ofrecidos en su negocio. Las otras socias son las señoras Alba de 38 años de edad, quien se ha dedicado por veinte años a la elaboración de delantales, comercializándolos principalmente en el mercado más populoso de la capital y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de tela, encajes, zipper, etc., y la señora Yovanelia de 22 años de edad, quien comercializa ropa en su comunidad y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de camisetas, jean para damas, jean para caballeros, trajes para niños, etc.
texts.en: The supportive group "Light of Faith" is composed of three women entrepreneurs and is coordinated by Isabel who is 36 years old and married who dedicates herself to the sale of fruits in the municipal market. She is seeking this loan for the purchase of a harvest of papaya and golden spoon to later sell via wholesale and retail. With her earlier loans this member completed the diversification of the products she offers through her business. The other members include Alba who is 38 years old and who has dedicated herself to the creation of aprons for twenty years which she sells primarily in the most popular market in the capital. She is seeking the loan to purchase fabric, lace, zippers, etc. Yovanelia is the other member who is 22 years old and who sells clothing in her community. She is seeking the loan to purchase shirts, women's jeans, men's jeans, outfits for children, etc.

loans.use: to purchase a harvest of papaya and golden spoon.

loans.name: Dialabaton  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DIALABATON II est constitué de 8 femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans et 5 enfants. La plupart d’entre eux vivent dans des familles polygamiques à Kobli un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Les femmes du groupe DIALABATON II collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso à fin de mieux organisé leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres (mil, arachide, sésame, haricot etc.) 
Elles sont à leur neuvième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, Madame TATA, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des debout, compte payer ses frais de labour, de sarclage, acheter de la semence, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide et autre petit équipement pour entretenir son champ d’environ 1 hectare de sorgho.
A la fin de la campagne, les productions sont vendues en espèce à Fana.
Elle envisage réalise un bénéfice moyen de 90 000F CFA par campagne qui sera investi dans le commerce.
Les femmes du groupe DIALABATON II se disent satisfaites de leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et portent toute leur confiance pour une agriculture durable et fructueuse.
texts.en: The Dialabaton II Group consists of 8 married women with an average age of 47 and five children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kobli, one of the villages in Dioila prefecture, in Koulikoro, the second largest administrative region in the republic of Mali. The women of Dialabaton II Group work with Soro Yiriwaso to better carry out their farming business. Their crops include, among others, millet, groundnuts, sesame, beans, etc. They are on their ninth loan with the micro-finance institution. With this loan, Ms. Tata, the second person standing from left to right of the photo, plans to pay for labor costs and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and other small equipment for maintaining her 1 hectare of sorghum. At the end of the season, the harvest is sold for cash in Fana. She plans to earn an average profit of 90,000 FCFA per season which will be invested in her business. The women of Dialabaton II Group are satisfied with their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso and confident in their successful and sustainable agriculture.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weedkiller, and small equipment.

loans.name: Dialabaton Iii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DIALABATON III est constitué de 8 femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 4 enfants. La plupart d’entre eux vivent dans des familles polygamiques à Kobli un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Les femmes du groupe DIALABATON III collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso à fin de mieux organisé leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres (mil, arachide, sésame, haricot etc.) 
Elles sont à leur neuvième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, Madame HAWA, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des assises, compte payer ses frais de labour, de sarclage, acheter de la semence, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide et autre petit équipement pour entretenir son champ d’environ 1 hectare de d’arachide.
A la fin de la campagne, les productions sont vendues en espèce à Fana.
Elle envisage réalise un bénéfice moyen de 80 000F CFA par campagne qui sera investi dans le commerce.
Les femmes du groupe DIALABATON III se disent satisfaites de leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et portent toute leur confiance pour une agriculture durable et fructueuse.
texts.en: The Dialabaton III Group consists of 8 married women with an average age of 41 and four children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kobli, one of the villages in Dioila prefecture, in Koulikoro, the second largest administrative region in the republic of Mali. The women of Dialabaton III Group work with Soro Yiriwaso to better carry out their farming business. Their crops include, among others, millet, groundnuts, sesame, beans, etc. They are on their ninth loan with the micro-finance institution. With this loan, Ms. Hawa, the second person sitting from left to right of the photo, plans to pay for labor costs and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and other small equipment for maintaining her 1 hectare of groundnuts. At the end of the season, the harvest is sold for cash in Fana. She plans to earn an average profit of 80,000 FCFA per season which will be invested in her business. The women of Dialabaton III Group are satisfied with their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso and confident in their successful and sustainable agriculture.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weedkiller, and small equipment.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer de 61 años de edad casada, tiene una hija y se dedica a la elaboración de queso y al comercio de papa, tunta y chuño (papa deshidratada).
Ella es una persona decidida, fuerte, luchadora, emprendedora y muy trabajadora, sus negocios los desarrolla en el municipio de Batallas situado a 53 kilómetros de la ciudad de ‘El Alto’, en la región del altiplano norte lacustre a 3860 metros sobre el nivel del mar, limita al oeste con el lago Titicaca.
Isabel es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, viste de manera tradicional (manta y pollera), su negocio es la elaboración de queso y comercio de papa, tunta y chuño (papa deshidratada); sus mayores problemas son la época fría del lugar, vientos, rayos, heladas, granizadas, sequías e inundaciones que afectan en gran medida su producción.
Ella desea tener y producir mayor cantidad de quesos para poder pagar los estudios superiores de su hija, para lograr su  meta necesita mejorar su producción realizando la compra de vacas lecheras.
