Es por esos motivos que Isabel solicita un préstamo para la compra de vacas lecheras, mejorar su producción y con los beneficios pagar la educación superior de su hija.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 61 year old married woman with one daughter.  She is engaged in cheese-making and selling potatoes, tuntas” [white dried potatoes], and “chuños” [freeze-dried potatoes].  

Isabel is a very hardworking, strong, determined, enterprising go-getter.  She carries out her businesses in the town of Batalles, situated 53 kilometers from El Alto, in the high Andean plateau north lake region, 3860 meters above sea level, bounded on the west by Lake Tititaca.  

Isabel is average height, and has a dark complexion and long black braided hair.  She is wearing traditional dress (a poncho and skirt).  Her business involves cheese-making and selling tuntas” [a white dried potatoes], and “chuños” [a freeze-dried potatoes].  Her biggest problems are the area’s cold season, in which winds, lightning, frost, hail, drought, and floods greatly affect her production.

She wishes to have and produce a greater amount of cheese to pay for her daughter’s higher education.  To achieve her goal, she needs to improve her production through the purchase of dairy cows.  For these reasons, Isabel is requesting a loan to purchase dairy cows, which will enable her to improve production, and use the profits to pay for her daughter’s higher education.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows, improve her production, and use the profits to pay for her daughter’s higher education.

loans.name: Playa Azul Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por cuatro socias laboriosas, y es coordinado por la señora Heizel de 31 años de edad y acompañada, propietaria de un taller de zapatería en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace cuatro años, con ayuda de su compañero de vida, quien trabaja en esta rama, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de materia prima como es pega amarilla, pega blanca, hilo, hebilla, cuero, brazil, etc., con el crédito anterior logro aumentar las ventas debido a que invirtió en más materiales, lo que le ha permitido cubrir parte de la demanda que tiene de este por parte de la población. Otra socia es la señora Tatiana de 26 años de edad, comerciante de frutas en uno de los barrios de la capital, la señora Aleyda de 54 años de edad comerciante de ropa interior desde hace veinte años en su domicilio y la señora María Lourdes de 26 años de edad, quien vende productos de consumos como es jabón, aceite, caramelos, etc., en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace cinco años.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is formed by four hardworking members, and it is coordinated by Heizel who is 31 years old. Heizel is the owner of a shoe store, which is in her home, and she started the business four years ago with the help of her life partner who works in this field. She is requesting the loan to purchase raw materials such as yellow glue, white glue, thread, buckles, leather, Brazilian leather, etc. With the previous loan, Heizel managed to increase sales because she invested in more materials, and this has allowed her to cover part of the city's demand for shoes. 

The other members include Tatiana, who is 26 years old and sells fruit in one of the neighborhoods of the capital city; Aleyda, who is 54 years old and has been selling undergarments for 20 years from her home; and, María Lourdes, who is 26 years old and sells goods such as soap, cooking oil, candies, etc., in the municipality's market for five years.

loans.use: buy raw materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Gema De Los Angeles

texts.es:
El emprendimiento y la fuerza de voluntad le han permitido a Gema de los Ángeles tener éxito en su negocio, una tienda de ropa. Productos en orden y de buena calidad es lo que reciben los clientes al ser atendidos, razón por la que siempre regresan para realizar sus compras. Ella tiene 27 años de edad, está en unión libre y tiene un hijo. Inicio su negocio con  la ayuda de sus ahorros y con la liquidación de su último trabajo, espera seguir brindándole una buena administración para que este pueda seguir creciendo.
Gema solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su negocio, requiere comprar ropa tanto para niños como para adultos, al mismo tiempo joyería, bolsos, maquillaje, productos de belleza, entre otros. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que su meta es triunfar en su negocio, ampliarlo para que este cumpla con la demanda de la clientela y así pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Su motivación para trabajar lo es su hijo, anhela brindarle salud y educación de calidad, junto a su compañero de vida luchara hasta lograrlo. En sus planes futuros esta abrir una tienda de ropa en otro departamento, cercano a la capital
texts.en:
The initiative and force of will that Gema de los Ángeles devoted her clothing store have made it a success. Upon entering the store, customers find well-organized displays and high-quality products, which always motivate them to return for another visit. 

Gema is 27 years old, married, and the mother of a son. She opened her store with the money she'd saved from a settlement she received when her last job ended. Gema hopes to continue managing the store effectively so that it will continue to grow. 

Gema is applying for a loan so that she can increase sales at the store. She needs to purchase children's and adult clothing, as well as jewelry, handbags, makeup, beauty products, and other merchandise. Gema is confident that this financing will help her achieve her goal of making the store more successful, expanding her inventory so that she can meet customer demand, boost sales, and earn higher income. 

Gema's son is her greatest motivation for her work; she wants to ensure his good health and provide for his education. She and her husband devote their lives to their son's welfare. Gema plans to one day open a second store in another department, near the capital.

loans.use: to purchase children's and adult's clothing, as well as jewelry, handbags, makeup, beauty products, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Jorge Eduardo

texts.es:
El joven Jorge Eduardo es un comerciante del municipio de condega, soltero y sin hijos, tiene más de 28 años de vivir en esta ciudad siendo una persona muy conocida por los vecinos como  trabajador y emprendedor.
Este joven tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa de habitación que consiste en venta de carne fresca variada como es de cerdo, pollo, chorizo, Siendo esta su principal fuente de ingreso, el atiende de lunes a domingo todo el día.
él solicita en las oficina de ceprodel un crédito con el fin de comprar mayor cantidad de carne para aumentar el inventario de su negocio para  poder satisfacer la demanda y por ende mejorar sus ingresos y ganancia.
El espera que el financiamiento que solicita por primera vez en ceprodel le sea aprobado y así poder mejorar su negocio y tener los ingresos suficiente para poder seguir costeando sus estudios superiores y así mejorar su nivel académico.
texts.en:
Jorge Eduardo is a vendor in the municipality of Condega. He is single, has no children and has been living in this city for more than 28 years. He is a person very well-known by his neighbors for being a hard-working and enterprising young man.

This young man has a small business in his home, which consists of selling a variety of fresh meat such as pork, chicken and sausages. As this is his main source of income, he serves customers from Monday to Sunday everyday.

He is requesting a loan at the Ceprodel office with the aim of buying a greater quantity of meat so that he can increase the inventory of his business, in order to meet the demand and therefore improve his income and earnings.

He hopes that the loan he is requesting for the first time from Ceprodel will be approved , so that he will be able to improve his business and have sufficient income to continue affording his higher education, and in this way improve his level of education.

loans.use: To buy fresh pork and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Zoila Gloria

texts.es:
Zoila, ha logrado mejorar su negocio de venta de artículos para el hogar con ayuda del préstamo anterior, hoy en día vive junto a su familia en un mejor estilo de vida, tiene más clientes y mejores ingresos, con los que ha podido cancelar el préstamo.
Nuevamente solicita más capital para comprar licuadoras, planchas, DVS, batidoras y equipos de sonido, de esta manera responderá a la demanda de sus clientes, espera tener los buenos resultados del crédito anterior.
texts.en: Zoila has managed to improve her business of selling household goods with the help of a previous loan. Today, she lives with her family in a better lifestyle. Zoila has more clients and better income, which has enabled her to pay back her loan. Once again, she is requesting more capital to purchase blenders, irons, DVS, electric mixers, and sound systems, in order to respond to her clients' demands. Zoila hopes to have good results as with the previous loan.

loans.use: purchase blenders, irons, DVS, electric mixers, and stereo systems to meet her clients' demands.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Joshua joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Haruna, Biliya and Samaila. Joshua is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Joshua will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Joshua can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Joshua said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Joshua is not thinking about just this year; he said in 5 years, he wants to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough slippers to sell.

loans.name: Rossa Armelia

texts.es:
La señora rosa es una comerciante que vive en la ciudad de condega, desde hace aproximadamente unos 45 años, está felizmente casada, tiene 4 hijos los que son independientes. Ella es una señora muy conocida por el tipo negocio que tiene.
la señora roza es dueña de una sala de belleza que tiene en su casa de habitación, ella tiene más de 36 años de ser estilista, corta cabellos, hace tintes de cabellos, aplicas ion de tratamientos, etc.. Manteniendo una buena clientela y exclusiva. Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes.
Ella se presentó a las oficinas de ceprodel con el fin de solicitar su cuarto crédito para comprar cosmético como tintes, cremas alisadoras de cabello, tratamientos, etc. y tener un amplio inventario de producto para ofrecer y de esta manera mejorar más su negocio y por ende sus ventas.
Ella espera que el crédito le sea aprobado ya que anteriormente ella había obtenido tres financiamientos los que le beneficiaron positivamente a mejorar su negocio por lo que ella se muestra agradecida.
texts.en:
Rossa is a businesswoman who has been living in the city of Condega for about 45 years. She is happily married and has 4 children who are independent.  She is very well know for the type of business she has.  She is the owner of a beauty salon that she has in her home.  She has more than 36 years as a stylist -  cutting hair, dying hair, and doing hair treatments.  She maintains a good and exclusive clientèle and works from Monday to Friday. 

She approached the CEPRODEL office with the aim of asking for a loan to buy cosmetics such as hair dyes, straightening creams, and treatments, etc. to have enough inventory of products to offer and in this manner improve her business and it's sales.  

She hopes that the credit will be granted because she has obtained 3 loans already that benefited her positively to improve her business and for which she is grateful.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as hair dyes and treatments, and creams.

loans.name: María  Del Carmen

texts.es:
Los niños en Sololá tienen un contexto cultural muy rico en costumbres y tradiciones que al mismo tiempo se transmite desde la niñez.  No hay niño en el pueblo que no le guste los trajes típicos y que  están interesados en cómo se elaboran y sus padres les enseñan para que ya como adultos puedan aprender el oficio de la elaboración y colocar su propio negocio.

Es el caso de María de 40 años quien tiene un negocio de venta  a la elaboración de ropa típica desde hace 5 años pero el oficio le ha encantado de su niñez.

Además de ser un negocio para una buena fuente de ingresos debido al turismo en la ciudad.   Es por eso que María ha solicitado un préstamo porque está interesada en la compra de una máquina bordadora y así mejorar sus ingresos para su familia de 4 hijos quienes están estudiando.
texts.en: The children of  Sololá live in a cultural context that is very rich in customs and traditions that are passed on from childhood. There is not one child in the town who does not like the traditional costumes and the children are interested in how they are made. Their parents teach them how they are made so that as adults they can learn the craft and start their own business. This was the case for María who is 40 years old and who has owned a business selling handmade traditional clothing for 5 years, but who has been enchanted by the craft since she was a child. In addition, it is a business with a good source of income because of the tourism in the city. It is because of this that María has sought a loan. She is interested in purchasing an embroidery machine so that she can increase her earnings for her family of 4 children who are in school.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Micah

texts.en: Micah is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Micah joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: . Micah is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Micah will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Micah can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Micah is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock and to improve sales and profits.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a 22-year-old single woman who lives in the Mt Darwin District of Zimbabwe with her mother. She volunteers as a guidance counselor to young people facing challenges in her community. She is also a vibrant entrepreneur operating a general dealership shop from her home where she sells food items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, cornmeal, biscuits, clothing, and household materials. Rosemary inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur. She has been running her business for a year and she is very pleased with how far she has come. With the requested loan, she intends to increase her stocks to improve sales and increase profits. An increase in profits would mean that she will be in a better position to provide for her family.

loans.use: to increase her stocks to improve sales and increase profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Chipo

texts.en: Chipo is a 21-year-old businesswoman from the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She is a committed volunteer in her community. Chipo is a Camfed Learner Guide and aims to keep children in school through life skills education. Additionally, Chipo has been operating a poultry business for the past year after finishing school. Her business is a way for her to maintain a stable source of income and Chipo also finds that the poultry business is a lucrative trade. The Kiva loan will assist her in purchasing chick feed and broiler chicks to increase production and boost her business sales. An improvement in the business will drastically improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase chick feed and broiler chicks to increase production and boost her business sales.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en: Agness is an 18-year-old woman from the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. Agness voluntarily teaches life skills to students at the local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide. She also has been running a grocery business for the past year. Agness is requesting a Kiva loan in order to purchase more stock, which should raise her sales and profits. With the additional profits she will earn, Agnes would like to take nursing courses and financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Elder

texts.en:
Elder is 25 years old. She lives in Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe where she has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment.
 
To earn a living, she is a door-to-door retailer who has been selling clothes for the past 10 months. She employs one person to help her. With the Kiva loan she is requesting, Elder shall purchase different clothes, shoes and blankets. She intends to use the profits to further her education.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tiles, chisels, a level, shovels, trowels and other tools used to complete his work.

loans.name: Sid Zabda Yaoba Group

texts.fr:
Mme AWA JULIENNE est responsable du groupe SID ZABDA YAOBA. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 23ans  et le moins âgé  a  12ans   . Les 02 vont à l’école et elle a 05personnes en charge.
Mme vend des habits prêt à porter et des pagnes depuis  12ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de son secteur.
Elle veut s’acheter  15complets pagnes et 02douzaines d’habits.
Mme veut épargne une partie de ses bénéfices et s’occuper des charges de la maison avec le reste. Elle ambitionne construire une grande boutique et la remplir de pagnes de différente qualité et aussi du bazin.
texts.en: Ms. Awa Julienne is the representative of the Sid Zabda Yaoba Group.  She is married and mother of two children; the oldest is 23 years old and the youngest is 12 years old. The two attend school and she has five dependents.  Ms. Awa Julienne has been selling ready-to-wear garments and "pagne" cloth for 12 years.  She buys her supplies in the markets in her region.  She wants to buy 15 complete "pagne" cloths and two dozen garments. She wants to save a portion of her profits and to pay for household expenses with the rest.  She aims to build a large store and fill it with different quality "pagne" cloth and also with "bazin".

loans.use: to buy 15 complete "pagne" cloths and 2 dozen garments.

loans.name: Mika

texts.en: Mika remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Mika, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Mika  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Mika   With this loan, Mika is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia works as an entrepreneur, growing tobacco and potatoes in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. She is 25 and lives with her husband and children. 

To give back to her community, she volunteers as a Learner Guide, teaching life skills education to students in local schools. 

With the Kiva loan, she intends to purchase more fertilizer, seeds, and insecticide. With the profit from the loan, she will pay school fees and further her education.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer, seeds, and insecticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on clothes, shoes and bags that her customers will appreciate.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough water and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more biscuits, candy, mayonnaise, and creamy wheat to sell.

loans.name: Walter Oswaldo

texts.es:
Walter tiene 22 años de edad, está soltero, logró estudiar hasta bachillerato, luego empezó a estudiar en la universidad pero por los escasos recursos económicos de sus padres ya no pudo continuar, él vive con sus padres y ayuda en los gastos del hogar.

Walter se dedica a trabajar como empleado en el proyecto de agua de la comunidad, él distribuye recibos de pago, esta oportunidad se la ofrecieron hace 3 años después que dejó de estudiar, trabaja de lunes a sábado y tiene que trasladarse a todos los puntos de la comunidad, además él ayuda a su padre en el cultivo de una hectárea de maíz.


Él necesita este crédito para comprar una novilla para repasto.

Su sueño para un futuro es comprar mucho ganado ya que tienen donde poder alimentarlos.
texts.en:
Walter, 22, is single and managed to study up to higher secondary school.  Then he began to study at the university, but because of the scarce economic resources of his parents, he couldn't continue.  He lives with his parents and helps with the household expenses.
Walter makes a living as an employee of the community water project.  He distributes the bills for payment.  This opportunity became available three years ago after he left his studies.  He works from Monday to Saturday and he has to get to all points of the community.  In addition, he helps his father with the cultivation of one hectare of corn.
He needs this loan to buy a young bull for additional food.
HIs dream for the future is to buy lots of cattle now that they have a place to feed them.

loans.use: to buy a young bull for additional food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a watering pump, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 54-year-old man. He is married with eight children, with five still attending school. John lives in a rural area in Mabungo, Rukungiri district. 

He does goat fattening as his major business, which he has done for a period of fifteen years. However, he is challenged with limited capital, which affects his production. Therefore, John joined UGAFODE to get financial assistance to buy farm inputs, such as drugs to treat his animals, maintain his farm by fencing, and buy more goats so as to increase his production. 

John intends to make his farm a modern one in the area and to become a model farmer. He thinks that with the assistance from UGAFODE, he will be able to attain his objectives.

loans.use: to buy veterinary drugs and more goats.

loans.name: Nyarai

texts.en: Nyarai lives with her husband and her two children in Hurungwe District in Zimbabwe. She is 23 years old and is volunteering as a Learner Guide in her community where she teaches students life skills. To support herself, she farms tobacco, which she has been doing for a while now. With the requested loan, she intends to purchase more fertilizers and seeds to improve production. She will use the proceeds from the business to further her education.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
Leona is a 19-year-old living in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. She is volunteering as a Learner Guide at the local secondary school within her community teaching students life and study skills. Leona is also a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network that helps other young women in her community to create their own economic independence.  To support herself financially, Leona is running a business selling kapenta (dried sardines) in her community. She has been running this business for six months now and it has enabled her to support her family.

With the requested Kiva loan, she intends to make bulk purchases of fish, kapenta and clothes to boost her profits. She is hoping to expand her business and to support her family members and needy children in her community.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of fish, kapenta (dried sardines) and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various fruits.

loans.name: Tauvaga

texts.en: Tauvaga is 38 years old and married with five children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. Tauvaga has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter

loans.name: Mujeres En Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres en progreso está en su 14º  ciclo  del programa de comités, son mujeres que buscan el progreso en cada uno de los emprendimientos que llevan a cabo para ayudar a sus familias, además se encuentran haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza como un medio de ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Norma integra este grupo, quien por medio de la venta de joyas variadas y de todo tipo, está luchando por poder salir adelante. Ella es una mujer que está luchando y creciendo, para que a su familia no les falte nada, con ese esfuerzo que viene haciendo quiere seguir creciendo. Pide este préstamo para la compra de joyas variadas para la venta, de manera a poder seguir con su esfuerzo y sacrificio.
texts.en:
The Mujeres En Progreso group is in its 14th cycle of the women’s committee program.  They are women who are seeking progress in each of the endeavors they are engaged in so that they can help their families.  They are also taking the poverty elimination survey as a means of improving their living conditions.

Norma is a member of this group.  By selling all types of various jewelry she is struggling to be able to get ahead.  She is a woman who is struggling and growing so that her family will not need anything.  With this effort that she is making she wants to continue growing.

She is requesting this loan to buy varied jewelry to sell.  This way she will be able to continue with her effort and her sacrifice.

loans.use: to buy varied jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su sexto ciclo del programa de comités, también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza que les permitirá poder seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Catalina, quien es una persona que se sacrifica mucho para poder ayudar a su familia, es ama de casa, a lo que se dedica de tiempo completo, pero vio la necesidad de aumentar los ingresos de su familia, es por eso que está queriendo implementar la venta de comidas, y es por eso que pide este préstamo, para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, hortalizas, carne, pollo y demás insumos para poder implementar este nuevo trabajo para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is in its sixth cycle of the committee program.  They are also taking the poverty elimination survey, which allows them to be able to continue improving their living conditions and those of their families.

Catalina is one of the members.  She is a person who sacrifices a lot in order to be able to help her family.  She is a full time housewife.  However, due to the need to increase her family’s income, she wants to set up food sales.  That is why she is requesting this loan to be able to buy vegetables, greens, meat, chicken, and other supplies.  She will do this to be able to set up this new work to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to be able to buy vegetables, greens, meat, chicken, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Idoneas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Idoneas se llama este grupo, vienen trabajando de forma unida, se ayudan las unas a las otras y por medio de ese esfuerzo quieren mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias. Están además en el programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con el cual podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Norma, ella  es peluquera, una muy buena trabajadora, donde sus clientes siempre quedan muy conformes con el trabajo que ella hace, ya que hace de todo. Es una persona muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos y sus familias.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en insumos varios para su despensa, como tinte, shampoo, enjuagues, crema, tijeras, peines, y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajando, y dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is named Mujeres Idoneas.  They are working in a united way, and they help each other.  Through these efforts they want to improve their families’ living conditions.  They are also in the elimination of poverty program with which they will be able to know the living situation of each one of them.

Norma is one of the members, and she is a hairdresser.  She is a good, hard-worker, and her customers are always very pleased with the work she does because she does everything.  She is a very tenacious person who wants to get ahead in order to be able to help her loved ones and their families.

She is requesting the loan to buy various supplies for her shop.  She will buy things like dyes, shampoos, rinses, creams, scissors, combs, and the rest.  This way she will be able to continue working and providing her customers with good service.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoos, rinses, creams, scissors, combs, and the rest.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Triunfadoras se llama este grupo, es nuevo, se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras, son mujeres jefas de familia muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.
Rosalba una de ellas, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos variados, que ella sale a vender de manera ambulante, ella tiene ya muy buena clientela que se formo con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos variados para la venta, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones económicas, y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is named Mujeres Triunfadoras.  It is new, and they got together in order to be able to help each other.  They are women who are the head of their families, and they are hard-working and tenacious.

Rosalba is one of them.  She sells various cosmetics in an itinerant many.  She has very good clientele, which she got through great sacrifice and effort.  Her goal is to be able to continue working and struggling in order to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy various cosmetics to sell.  This way she will be able to continue with her sales, continue struggling to improve her financial situation, and continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy various cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural products to help her coffee harvest.

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Анна замужем. У нее двое детей. Она проживает в доме вместе со своей семьей. Анна работает медсестрой в больнице на протяжении 10 лет. Ей нравится ее работа.  Анна заботливая мать и ответственный работник. 

Анна просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 5000 гривен на ремонт одной из комнат в ее доме. Анна хочет заменить электропроводку, поштукатурить стены и установить гипсокартон на потолок. В будущем Анна хочет сделать ремонт в остальных комнатах.
texts.en: Anna is married, has two children, and lives with her family in their house in Vinogradovo.  She works as a nurse in a local hospital, and has done so for more than 10 years.  She enjoys her work, and is not only a responsible worker, but a caring mother as well.  Anna is seeking a loan of 5000 hryvnia to renovate one of the bedrooms in her house; eventually, she would like to renovate the rest of her house as well, but for now, she'd like to focus on this one room, which needs new electrical wiring, plaster for the walls, and drywall for the ceiling.

loans.use: renovate one of the rooms in her house

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 36 years old and married with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Ana needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gumboots, a machete, gloves and a spade. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Ana will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gumboots, a machete, gloves and a spade

loans.name: Oasis Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Oasis con 15 integrantes, están en el 7mo ciclo, todas las mujeres de este grupo son muy emprendedoras. La mayoría de ellas se dedica a la cría de animales ya que sus condiciones rurales lo permiten, ya que son de zonas muy alejadas de la capital del país.
La Sra. Viviana gracias a la ayuda de la Fundación Paraguaya, y por medio de los otros ciclos, ahora cuenta con gran número de animales que cría, faena, o vende, y así tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. 
Pide este préstamo para la compra de animales como chancho, gallinas, balanceados para los animales, etc.
texts.en:
The Oasis communal bank is comprised of 15 members.  They are in their seventh cycle.  All of the women of this group are very enterprising.  Most of them raise animals because their rural conditions allow them to.  They are from areas that are very far from the capital of the country.

Viviana, thanks to the help from the Fulndación Paraguaya and through the other loan cycles, now has a great number of animals to raise, to work with, or to sell.  This way she has the means to be able to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy animals like pigs and chickens and balanced feed for the animals, etc.

loans.use: to buy animals like pigs and chickens and balanced feed for the animals, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité kuña Katupyry se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, una zona aun en crecimiento que está luchando por poder crecer.
Todas ellas se dedican a la actividad rural de cría y venta de animales de corral, que con mucho esfuerzo hace para poder ganarse el sustento de su día a día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lorena, quien cría animales de corral, y pide este préstamo para la compra de balanceados para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupyry communal bank was formed by the union of various neighbors from the city of Santaní.  It is an area that is growing, and it is struggling in order to be able to do so.

All of them engage in the rural business activity of raising and selling barnyard animals.  They put forth great effort to be able to earn their sustenance from day to day.

Lorena is one of the members who raises barnyard animals.  She is requesting this loan to buy balanced feed in order to be able to continue with her work as she has been doing.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting in order to be able to grow and to improve.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for animals.

loans.name: Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fatima está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.

La Sra. Margarita es una de las integrantes, ella tiene su pequeño negocio de  Despensa, donde vende todo tipo de productos, y con lo cual lucha para poder seguir dando a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener, y que no tenga que pasar por necesidades.
Margarita está luchando por mejorar, y es por eso que pide este préstamo, para poder comprar insumos varios para poder surtir su despensa, como verduras, frutas, enlatados, leche, panificados y otros productos varios. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo de mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
The Fatima group is in its first cycle of the women’s committee program.  It is in the city of Curuguaty, an area a bit far from the central zone.  It is still growing, and it is an area with difficult access.  Therefore, the members of this groups want to struggle to keep growing and to give the area where they live a better atmosphere.  They want it to continue to grow slowly.

Margarita is one of the members.  She has a small business, a store where she sells all types of products.  With the business she struggles to be able to continue giving her family everything that that she was not able to have so that they do not have to experience need.

Margarita is struggling to improve.  That is why she is requesting this loan to be able to buy various supplies to stock her store.  She will buy things like vegetables, fruit, canned goods, milk, baked goods, and various other products.  She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving in order to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, canned goods, milk, baked goods, and various other products.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sagrada Familia está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una de ellas quieren dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener, se están esforzando por poder capacitarse y crecer en lo que cada una hace.
Dorotea vende comidas variadas que ella misma hace y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante, por medio de su trabajo lucha para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que no pudieron tener.
Dorotea pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carnes, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, ya que este es el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
The Sagrada Familia group is in its first cycle with the women’s committee program.  Each one of them wants to give their families everything that they were not able to have.  They are putting forth great effort in order to be able train and grow in what each one of them does.

Dorotea sells various food that she makes herself.  She then goes out to sell the food in an itinerant manner.  Through her work she struggles to be able to give her loved ones everything that she was not able to have.

Dorotea is requesting this loan to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, greens, baked good, and the rest.  This way she will be able to continue with her work as she has been doing.  This is because this is her family’s sustenance.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, greens, baked good, and the rest.

loans.name: Ake

texts.en: Ake is a 61-year-old widow with four children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Ake has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material

loans.name: Alofagia

texts.en: Alofagia is 25 years old and single with two children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Alofagia needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gumboots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Alofagia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gumboots and a spade

loans.name: Leata

texts.en: Leata is a 31-year-old unwed woman with four children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Leata needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Leata has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 54-year-old woman who is married with nine children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has two years of experience with this business. Mary needs a loan to buy new tyres, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil and petrol. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Mary joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tyres, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil and petrol

loans.name: Taimane

texts.en: Taimane is 31 years old and married with two children. She owns and operates a small store selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for one year. Taimane needs a loan to buy a new display refrigerator, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, sack of onions and potatoes. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display refrigerator, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, sack of onions and potatoes

loans.name: Fe Jocylyn

texts.en:
Fe Jocylyn is 52 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, groceries, etc. 

Fe Jocylyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional  income from catering services.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap and groceries

loans.name: Tamala

texts.en: Tamala is a 43-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Tamala needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tamala just joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 49 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of tobacco business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of tobacco to sell.

Luz has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of tobacco business for 32 years and earns additional income from the buy and sell of dried fish.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell

loans.name: Osea

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Osea works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of veterinary supplies business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Osea is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of veterinary products to sell for her buy and sell of veterinary supplies business.

Osea has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of veterinary products to sell

loans.name: Mariella Lissette

texts.es:
Mariella, es acompañada, vive con su compañero de vida y una niña de un año de edad, su fuente de ingreso es un negocio de car wash, venta de celulares y variedad de bebidas, ya tiene tres años de experiencia, su horario es de ocho de la mañana seis de la tarde, ella aprendió estas actividades dentro de su grupo familiar, por el momento no representa dificultades en su negocio.
Comprará vitrinas en las que mostrara los modelos y accesorios de celulares, lo que le permitirá dar una mejor vistosidad a sus clientes de la mercadería que ofrece, espera atraer nuevos clientes, aumentar sus ventas e ingresos, así tendrá recursos económicos para salir adelante con su familia.
Su sueño es continuar creciendo en su negocio para ofrecer a su familia mejores circunstancias de vida y resarcir sus deudas.
texts.en:
Mariella has a partner, she lives with her life partner and a daughter of eight years old. Her source of income is a car wash business, selling cellphones and a variety of drinks. She already has three years experience. Her workday is from eight in the morning to six at night, she learnt this business within her family group, for the moment she doesn't have any difficulties with her business.

She will buy showcases in which she will display models and accessories for cellphones, which will allow her to better show the goods she offers to her customers. She hopes to attract new customers, increase her sales and income, and thereby have the financial resources to pull her family through.

Her dream is to continue growing her business to offer her family better living circumstances and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy showcases to display cellphone handsets and accessories.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Al llegar a la pulpería de María, encontramos a un niño comprando caramelos, ella lo atiende con una sonrisa amable y lo despide con un “Dios me lo bendiga hijo”. Inmediatamente la mirada angelical se dirigió ante nosotros para darnos la bienvenida, sin duda, los vecinos no se habían equivocado de la amabilidad de esta madre soltera, de cuatro hijos ya independientes. Con 51 años y a pesar de solo haber estudiado la primaria, siempre ha visto el trabajo como lo más gratificante para salir adelante con su familia. Trabajó en la organización del ejército de Nicaragua, hasta que decidió retirarse y empezar su propio negocio con la liquidación, vendiendo ropa interior. Poco a poco ha ido creciendo hasta establecer una pulpería con la combinación de venta de ropa, que ahora ya tiene 4 años. 
María cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, pero no tiene otros ingresos, por lo que necesita de tu apoyo para comprar más mercadería como ropa interior, granos básicos, cosméticos, entre otros. Estos son productos que constantemente están solicitando sus clientes, de manera que con este préstamo podrá brindar un mejor servicio. Entre sus planes está mejorar el local de su pulpería, pues sueña con superarse aún más, para esto sabe que deberá trabajar fuerte en su negocio.
texts.en:
Upon entering María’s general store, we find a child buying candy. She waits on him with a kind smile and sends him off with a “God bless you, son", and immediately her angelic gaze is directed our way, in order to welcome us. The neighbors had not been mistaken about the kindness of this single mother of four children, who are now independent.  At 51, and despite having only studied in primary school, she has always seen work as the most gratifying way to move forward with her family.

She worked for the Nicaraguan Army until she decided to retire and start her own underwear sales business with her retirement payout.  Little by little it grew, until she established the general store in combination with selling clothing. She has had it for four years now.

María has her children’s support, but she has no other income. That is why she needs your support in order to purchase more merchandise, such as underwear, basic grains, and cosmetics, along with other items. These are the products that her customers request constantly, so with this loan, she will be able to provide better service. 

Her future plans include improving her store’s premises, as she dreams of doing even better. For this, she knows that she will have to work hard in her business

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise, such as underwear, basic grains, and cosmetics, along with other items.

loans.name: Kuata

texts.en:
Kuata is a 29-year-old married woman with two children. She makes and sells barbequed food in her community to earn a living. Kuata has had one year's experience with this business. 

Kuata needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Kuata has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce, onions and paper plates

loans.name: Johanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Johanna, ha sido muy beneficiada con la inversión del crédito anterior en su venta de verduras y frutas, cuenta con nuevos clientes, un inventario más surtido y mejores ingresos lo que le ha facilitado la comprar algunos muebles para su hogar y cancelar su deuda.
Con el propósito de mantener la continuidad de su buen desarrollo se decidió por solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar ejotes, tomates, cebollas, repollos, chiles, lechugas, etc., para ofrecer a sus clientes productos frescos.
texts.en: Johanna has benefited a lot from her last loan in her fruit and vegetable sales. She has new clients, a better stocked inventory and more income. This has facilitated the purchase of some new furniture for her house and she paid off the loan. With the aim of continuing the development of her business she has decided to request a new loan to buy beans, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, chilies, lettuce etc to offer her clients fresh produce.

loans.use: to buy beans, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, chilies, lettuce etc to offer to her clients.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Amparo works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Amparo is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Amparo has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is 45 years old and unmarried with three children. She has owned and operated a small store, selling a variety of items, for the past year. 

Hana needs a loan to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, sacks of rice and salt. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Hana became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, sacks of rice and salt

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 37 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. Rosemarie has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 11 years and also earns an income from selling lumber.

Rosemarie has previously borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF. She has now requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like crackers, candies, powdered drinks, etc. to sell.

Rosemarie aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy crackers, candies, powdered drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mirian Del Socorro

texts.es: Mirian es una señora de 50 años de edad, en el tiempo que le queda de su trabajo  se dedica  a la venta de ropa, Mirian trabaja en una panadería y vive ahí mismo ya que su patrón le presta un cuarto para que viva, ella es madre soltera y tiene un hijo que ya es mayor de edad y es independiente, Mirian aspira mejorar su negocio y  seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Mirian is a 50 year old woman. In the spare time that her work affords her she works selling clothing. Mirian works in a bakery and also lives there as the owner has lent her a room to live in . She is a single mother and has a son who is grown now and independent. Mirian hopes to improve her business and continue working.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 41 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. Jona has run a general store in the Philippines for the past seven years. 

Jona has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
La disciplina es la parte más importante del éxito y de ello está consciente doña Reyna,  una mujer amable y trabajadora que día a día se levanta con mucha energía a supervisar sus cafetales para confirmar que todo vaya en orden con la plantación y así poder brindarle a sus clientes productos de calidad. Tiene 41 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos. Hace tres años su esposo le otorgó cuatro manzanas de tierras y es cuando inicia en el negocio de la agricultura, aprovechó la oportunidad y poco a poco fue obteniendo ingresos mediante la recolección y comercialización del café. Agradece a su esposo el apoyo, anhela que juntos logren mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 
Reyna solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar abonos, productos foliares, insecticidas y fungicidas para el control de plagas y enfermedades, de igual manera tiene que pagar el mantenimiento del cafetal. Espera seguir prosperando en su negocio, razón por la que deposita su confianza en el financiamiento. A parte de vender su producto a pequeñas empresas acopiadoras de café, desea ubicarse en el área de los supermercados para ganar más clientes y lograr obtener mejores ingresos. Entre sus planes futuros esta mejorar su vivienda y ampliar el área de siembra del cafetal.
texts.en:
Discipline is the most important part of success and Reyna is conscious of this. She is a kind and hardworking woman who gets up from day to day with a lot of energy to take care of her coffee plantation to check that everything is in order on the plantation and thus be able to offer her customers a quality product. 

She is 41 years old, married with 4 children. Three years ago her husband was awarded four blocks of land and that is when they started in agriculture. They took advantage of the opportunity and bit by bit started earning income by harvesting and selling coffee. She is thankful to her husband for the support and hope that together they will be able to achieve better living conditions.

Reyna is requesting a loan to increase the production of her capital, she needs to buy fertilizer, foliar feeding products, insecticide and fungicide to control insects and diseases, she also has to pay for the upkeep of the plantation. She hopes to continue thriving with her business, which is why she places her trust in this loan. 

Apart from selling her product to small coffee buyers, she would like to get her product into supermarkets to get more customers and better earnings. Among her future plans are improving her home and increasing the area of her coffee plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, foliar feeding products, insecticides, fungicides to control insects and diseases.

loans.name: Kreshimire

texts.en:
Kreshimire is 33 years old, married and has children to support. He provides motorcycle transportation services as his source of income. 

Kreshimire wants to continue to provide safe travel to his passengers so he is now requesting additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline and pay for maintenance for his motorcycle. This will give him a good income in return. Someday, he hopes to become a successful entrepreneur for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and pay for maintenance for his motorcycle

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 39 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Jonah has run a general store in the Philippines for four years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Jonah has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, milk, etc. to sell.

Jonah aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Joset

texts.en:
Joset is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a fishing business in the Philippines for the past four years.

Joset has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 34 years old and married with four children. For the past five years she has earned a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from rice retailing.

Annabelle is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to pay laborers to prepare her fields for sowing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to grow her income so as to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers to prepare her fields for sowing.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael tiene 68 años de edad, no tiene ningún nivel académico ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos, actualmente está casado y tiene un hijo que ya formó su propio hogar.


Ismael trabaja en la agricultura, sus padres le enseñaron el trabajo desde muy pequeño, además Ismael se dedica a la crianza de ganado desde hace 3 años y lo aprendió de un tío.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar tres bovinos de repasto y luego los venderá para obtener ganancias.


Sus planes son comprar tres bovinos mas y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en: Ismael is 68 years old. He has no formal education as his parents had meager economic resources. He is married and has a son who now has his own family. Ismael works in agriculture, which his parents taught him when he was quite young. He has also been raising cattle for the past three years something he learned from his uncle. He needs the loan to buy three cows which he will sell for a profit. His plan is to buy three more cows and finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy three cows which he will sell at a later time for profit.

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en:
Joanne is 34 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Joanne is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for seven years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Uno de los oficios más interesantes en Suchitepequez es la venta de ropa típica, no solamente por los ingresos que proporciona sino porque es parte de la costumbre de sus habitantes que usen este tipo de ropa para identificarles en ésta región. 

Es la vistosidad que posee este tipo de indumentaria y para cultural de la atracción turística de ésta ciudad.  Es por eso que muchas personas se han dedicado a la venta como lo es Isabel de 55 años  quien se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace cinco años.

Este negocio le ha proporcionado una buena fuente de ingreso y esto le ha animado a hace un préstamo para invertir más en su negocio de venta de ropa típica y así su ciudad no perder esa vistosidad turística que le caracteriza.
texts.en:
One of the most interesting occupations in Suchitepequez is selling tradition clothing, not only for the income it brings, but because it is part of the custom of the inhabitants who wear this type of clothing to identify themselves as coming from the region.

This type of clothing is striking and is a cultural attraction for tourists coming to this city. This is why many people have dedicated themselves to selling it, like Isabel of 55 years old who has been in this business for five years.

This business has become a good source of income and has motivated her to request a loan to invest more in her business selling traditional clothing and thus her city will not lose this striking feature which characterizes it.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 46 years old and married with five children. For the past nine years she has worked hard buying and selling charcoal to make a living. She also earns an income from her sari sari, or general store.

Delia has borrowed and successfully paid off 23 loans through NWTF before this new request. She is now applying for 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Delia aspires to build her business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 33 years old, married,  and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ligaya would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz, aged 57, is married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Luz has had a fish vending business in the Philippines for 20 years. 

Luz has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Percila

texts.en:
Percila is 48 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. For the past 20 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines.

Percila has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a fruit vending business in the Philippines for the past six years.

Virginia has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of fruits to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits to sell

loans.name: Florentín

texts.es:
Florentín es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable de 66 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta quinto grado en la escuela de su cantón, actualmente está acompañado y tiene una hija que ha formado su propia familia.


Florentín tiene 10 años de trabajar en una bomba de agua lo cual su labor es hacer llegar el agua a toda la comunidad, esta trabajo lo obtuvo mediante el apoyo de una adesco de la comunidad, además se dedica al cultivo de jícama y lo aprendió de su padre.


El crédito lo necesita para pagar el alquiler del terreno donde va a sembrar jícama y para comprar  abono.
 

Los propósitos de Florentín son trabajar sus cultivos, vender la cosecha y reunir un dinero para el pago de una operación de la vista de su pareja.
texts.en:
Florentin is a very hardworking and responsible person of 66 years old. He studied up to fifth grade in the school in his canton, currently he is married and has a daughter who has her own family.

Florentin has been working in a potable water well for 10 years, where his job is to connect the whole community to the water, he got this job through the help of the community ADESCO [Community Development Association], furthermore he works growing jicama [Mexican turnip] which he learnt from his father.
 
He needs the loan to pay the rent on the land where he will sow the jicama and to purchase fertilizer.

Florentin's aims are to work his fields, sell the harvest and save the money to pay for the an operation on his partner's eyesight.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the land where he will sow jícama and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 36 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for eight years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 50 years old and widowed with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Lourdes has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pig fattening. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a dry goods vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Josephine is borrowing PHP 5,500 through NWTF to buy additional dry goods like mirrors, accessories, wallets, threads, etc., to sell for her dry goods business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dry goods like mirrors, accessories, wallets, threads, etc., to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Rosie is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing nets and other materials for her fishing business.

Rosie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing nets and other materials.

loans.name: Gladis Esperanza

texts.es:
Gladis es una mujer que se dedica a los oficios domésticos, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, sus hijos ya no viven en casa porque han formado sus propios hogares.


Gladis es comerciante, hace 12 años tenía un puesto de venta de verduras en el mercado pero sufrió una enfermedad que le impidió viajar hasta su trabajo, es por eso  que decidió poner una tienda en su casa la cual le ha dado buenos resultados ya que de dicha actividad tiene buenos ingresos que le sirven para ayudar a pagar algunos gastos de la casa.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar estantes para colocar los diversos productos que hay en la tienda, además comprará productos como azúcar, jabón y otros.


El sueño de Gladis es que en su tienda haya todo tipo de productos principalmente de la canasta básica.
texts.en: Gladis is a woman who works doing the housework. She is married and her husband is a farmer. Her children no longer live with her as they have their own homes. Gladis is a businessperson. For twelve years she had a stand selling vegetables in the market but she got sick and she couldn't travel to her work. So she decided to open a store in her house. It has produced quite good results as it makes good income which helps her pay some of the household expenses. She needs a loan to buy shelving to display the various products that she has in the store. Plus she will buy products like sugar, soap and others. Gladis' dream is to have a store with every kind of product, principally basic food items.

loans.use: to buy shelves to display her products in her store and to buy products like sugar, soap and others.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina runs her sari sari, or general store, while her husband fishes to earn a living. She is a GDMPC client who with their help has seen her business improve. She took out a previous loan which was successfully repaid through her generated revenue.

Valentina has taken a new 10,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries to add to her stock. She plans to make her sari sari a full merchandise store in the future in order to create a bigger source of income and a more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to add to her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar, corn, beans, coffee, water, oil, rice, milk, etc. for her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan operates a general store and at the same time helps her husband work on their own farm for a living. With her generated income, the previous loan she took out for her store was successfully repaid.  Improving her business becomes easier with her access to GDMPC.  
To improve her store, she recently took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell.  She always wants to improve her business and she plans to use her earnings for her children's future education.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling pre-paid mobile loads.  Teresita is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting an additional loan to further build her business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 47 years old and married with three children. For the past five years she has worked hard running her sari sari, or general store, and farming rice.

Marina has borrowed and through her profits successfully paid back fourteen loans through NWTF. She is now applying for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk and sugar. She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 39 years old and married with three children. For the past ten years she has worked hard running her sari sari, or general store, and being a food vendor.

Josephine has borrowed and through her profits successfully paid back 23 prior loans through NWTF. She is now applying for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy stock for her store, such as soap, shampoo, sugar and coffee. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 39 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Flora has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maira Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra es una señorita de 21 años de edad,  ella vive con su madre y con su hermano que está estudiando, ella ayuda a su madre en el trabajo, ya sea sirviendo cafés a los clientes o lavando la vajilla, también se dedica a vender ropa a sus amigas y ofreciendo a mas clientes, Alejandra va a utilizar el crédito en la compra de ropa,  ella terminó sus estudios secundarios y aspira mejorar su negocio para obtener el dinero necesario para ingresar a la universidad.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a young lady of 21 years of age. She lives with her mother and her brother who goes to school. She helps her mother with her work, whether it be serving coffee to the customers or washing the dishes. She also works selling clothing to her friends and providing to more customers. 

Alejandra is going to use the loan to buy clothing. She finished her secondary school studies and hopes to improve her business to get the money necessary to enter university.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Marvin Alexander

texts.es:
Marvin, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres; se dedica a la comercialización de ganado y al cultivo de granos básicos, trabaja de lleno en realizar dichas actividades, trabaja de manera independiente desde hace ya 7 años, su papá le enseño este oficio, por el momento no representa problemas.
Comprará una vaquilla y profilácticos (vitaminas y desparasitante) para fortalecer su negocio y evitar que sus animales se enfermen y tener pérdidas, espera cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar su situación económica.
Su visión es continuar trabajando, apoyar a sus padres económicamente y resarcir su deuda.
texts.en:
Marvin his single, he lives at home with his parents; he works selling cattle and growing staple grains, he works fully in the aforementioned jobs, he has worked independently for 7 years now, his father taught him this profession, for the moment he doesn't have any problems.
 
He will buy a heifer and prophylactics (vitamins and dewormers) to strengthen his business and prevent his animals getting sick and having losses, he hopes to meet his customer's demands and improve his economic situation.

His vision is to continue working, support his parents financially and repay his loan.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and prophylactics (vitamins and dewormers) to strengthen his business.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like gasoline, fishing net, etc for her fishing business.

Mira has been in this business for 20 years. Mira earns more income from buying and selling fish.

Mira has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like gasoline, fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Flor Del Carmen

texts.es:
Flor, con el financiamiento anterior compro de manera inmediata todos los materiales necesario para elaborar la venta de comida y pupusas, el impacto en su negocio ha sido positivo porque tiene nuevos clientes, ofrece un mejor servicio y ha recuperado lo invertido con buenas ganancias, que le han servido en mejorar el estilo de vida, hacer la apertura una pequeña tienda de artículos de primera necesidad  y mantener una buena calificación crediticia.
En esta oportunidad requiere de más capital para invertir en la tienda y temporalmente venderá sandías para tener ingresos extras, comprara jugos, gaseosas, agua, boquitas, dulces, aceite y sandías, con lo que se mantendrá trabajando y teniendo los ingresos que necesita para cumplir con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
With the previous loan, Flor immediately bought all the materials necessary to make pupusas and the other food that she sells. The impact on her business has been positive, because she has new customers, she offers better service, and she has recouped what she invested with good earnings, which have served her to improve her style of life, open a little store with products of basic needs, and maintain a good credit rating.

At this time she needs more capital to invest in the store, and she will temporarily sell watermelons to have extra income. She will buy juices, soft drinks, water, snacks, sweets, oil, and watermelons, with which she will keep working and having the income that she needs to meet her obligations.

loans.use: to buy juices, soft drinks, water, snacks, sweets, oil, and watermelons for her store, so that she can continue working

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 32 years old and married with three children. For the past two years she has worked hard running a sari sari, or general store. She also makes money raising livestock.

Susana has borrowed and with her profits successfully repaid two prior loans through NWTF. She is now applying for an 8,000 PHP loan to buy more stock for her store such as detergent, soap, shampoo, seasonings, coffee and eggs. She is working to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Regina Florentina
