texts.es:
Regina de 27 años con una preciosa niña de 2 años, se ha dedicado a comprar y a vender ropa típica en Sololá, actividad muy atractiva tanto en aspectos económico como cultural.

Es un negocio que ella emplea para poder sostener a su hijita y enseñarle unos de los oficios más especiales en la región.  

Para mejorar su situación económica con mejores ingresos y proporcionarle un mejor futuro a su hija, ha solicitado un préstamo para poder ampliar su negocio y buscar más mercado en otros lugares con el producto que compra y vende.
texts.en:
Regina is 27 years old with a precious daughter of 2 years old, she works buying and selling traditional clothing in Solola, a very attractive job both economically and culturally.

It is a business which she works to be able to sustain her little daughter and teach her one of the most special professions in the region.

To improve her economic situation with a better income and provide her daughter with a better future, she has requested a loan to be able to expand her business and seek more market in other places with the product she buys and sells.

loans.use: to invest in her clothing business.

loans.name: Tepalua

texts.en: Tepalua is a 51 year old divorcee with seven children. She runs a plantation and Ava business, selling to the members of the public and delivering them to near by village shops and towns. She has been a member of the SPBD program for more than five years. With this money Tepalua is looking at purchasing mashing stones, bush knives, blade sharpeners, a mist-blower, and chemicals for the improvement of her business. She hopes to continue to work well on her business so that she would continue to provide a better living for her large family.

loans.use: to purchase mashing stones, bush knives, blade sharpeners, a mist blower, and chemicals.

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette has been operating a general store in her village, selling a variety of grocery goods. She was able to sustain their living and had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business with her generated revenue. Improving her business is easier with her access to microfinance services from GDMPC. 

She took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell.  She always finds ways to augment her business and improve her quality of living. She wants to ensure a better income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Consolada Jacqueline

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Consolada Jacqueline works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling jewelry. 

Consolada Jacqueline is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Consolada Jacqueline has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jorgea

texts.en:
Jorgea is 52 years old and married with four children.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.  Jorgea has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jorgea aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
Alcides tiene 43 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado en la escuela debido a que solamente él vivía con sus padres y tenía que trabajar para poder aportar a su casa, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a la panadería artesanal, tiene 3 hijos que estudian en la universidad.  

Alcides es zapatero en una empresa de zapatos,  tiene ya 8 años de dedicarse a este trabajo, fue por unos amigos suyos que él se introdujo en esta actividad, para llegar al trabajo tiene que recorrer 2 kilómetros y medio en autobús, el horario es de 7:00 am a 3:30 pm.


El crédito lo necesita para cancelar algunas deudas que ha adquirido debido a que tuvo que hacer algunas reparaciones en su casa.

Alcides planea para un futuro poner una mini empresa de zapatos y distribuirlos a otras tienda, también desea ayudar a sus hijos a terminar sus carreras.
texts.en:
Alcides is 43 years old. He went to school through sixth grade, due to the fact that only he was living with his parents and he had to work to be able to support the household. He has a partner, who works in an artisanal bakery. He has three children who are studying at the university.

Alcides is a shoemaker in a shoe business. He has already been doing this work for 8 years. It was through some of his friends that he was introduced to this activity. To get to work, he has to travel two and a half kilometers by bus. The schedule is from 7:00 am to 3:30 pm.

He needs the loan to pay off some debts that he has acquired due to the fact that he had to make some repairs on his house.

For the future, Alcides plans to set up a mini shoe business and distribute them to other stores. He also wants to help his children to finish their courses of study.

loans.use: to pay off some debts that he has acquired due to the fact that he had to make some repairs on his house.

loans.name: Pologa

texts.en:
Pologa is a 61-year-old married woman with eight children. She runs an Ava plantation (a traditional plant that produces a juice popular in traditional ceremonies), selling them to the public in town and delivering them to the nearby shops. She also has a taxi driven by her husband, and her children also help out in the business through packing and delivering. She had joined the SPBD program to gain access to financial assistance.  

Pologa will use this money to purchase mashing stones, plastic bags, laborers for her Ava business. Pologa hopes to save a lot of her profit so she would continue not only to maintain the operation of her business, but also to improve her large family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase mashing stones, plastic bags, and labourers

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is 69 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

Domingo has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell nipa roofing business for eight years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and a buy and sell charcoal business.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her business for her fishing business.

Margarita has been in this business for 10 years; she earns more income from buying and selling fish.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Basilides

texts.en:
Christal is 16 years old and is the 1st of two children in the family. Her grandmother Basilides is a member of NWTF, and she supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Christal is studying for her Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and is currently on her 1st of this 4-year course.

Basilides, Christal's grandmother, is borrowing 9,000 PHP to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2014-2015.  When she graduates, Christal plans to be gainfully employed so she can help to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her granddaughter.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María de 40 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado, está casada y sus dos hijos estudian en el municipio, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, en una iglesia y en estructuras metálicas.


María se dedica a la venta de tamales y a los oficios domésticos, además se dedica a la sastrería, ella elabora pantalones, camisas, cortinas, y todo lo relacionado en la sastrería, lo aprendió gracias a un curso que impartieron en la comunidad.


El préstamo que María solicita  CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar dos novillas y además comprará tela para hacer pantalones y camisas los cuales venderá en el mercado de la ciudad.
De esta forma María apoyará económicamente a su esposo para juntos darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.


Ella planea seguir dándole el estudio a sus hijos para que se superen académicamente y puedan desarrollarse como profesionales.
texts.en:
María, aged 40, studied up to eighth grade and is married. Her two children study in the municipality, and her husband works in agriculture, at a church, and at a metal shop (welding and soldering).

María tends to her home and makes a living selling tamales. She is also a seamstress. She makes pants, shirts, curtains, and everything related to tailoring. She learned the trade thanks to a course that was given in the community.

María needs the loan that she is requesting through CrediCampo to buy two heifers and also to buy fabric to make pants and shirts, which she will sell at the town’s market. In this way, she will provide financial support to her husband, so that, together, they give their children a better quality of life.

She plans to keep on providing education to her children, so they achieve academic success and are able to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy two heifers and also to buy fabric to make pants and shirts, which she will sell at the town's market.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 54 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Luciana is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Luciana has been raising pigs for 10 years, and also earns additional income from farming peanuts.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: La Capillita Group

texts.es:
Desde la carretera de la comunidad se aprecian distintos paisajes, todos ellos constituidos por los cerros que rodean el lugar, de igual manera se tiene una vista agradable del pico de Orizaba, el volcán más alto de México, así como de los cerros que rodean la comunidad.

La Capillita es un grupo integrado por 10 personas las cuales radican en una localidad  100% cañera donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la producción, corte y demás actividades relacionadas con este producto. De igual manera las personas siembran y cultivan alimentos para  el consumo, de esta manera obtienen ingresos y satisfacen algunas necesidades. El nombre del grupo lo decidieron todos los integrantes debido a que frente a la casa donde se hacen las reuniones hay una capilla. Los integrantes y sus actividades son:

Noelia- Venta De Antojitos, María- Venta De Antojitos, María Del Carmen- Venta de Ropa, Jorge Alberto- Venta de Plata, Isabel- Venta de Comida, Proceso- Venta de Ropa, Flor- Venta de Plata, Jorge-Venta de Refrescos, Mayra- Venta de Dulces y Ángel- Venta de abarrotes.

"Gracias a VisionFund México" he emprendido mi propio negocio" comenta don Angel quien es un señor muy carismático y alegre, quien desde hace ya 2 años se ha dedicado a la venta productos básicos de consumo para lo cuál modificó parte de su casa. Su esposa lo apoya atendiendo la tienda debido a que recientemente don Ángel también comenzó a vender pescado. Explica que espera poder comprar el equipo necesario para criar mojarra él mismo y venderla, de esta manera sus ganancias incrementarían. Con el préstamo otorgado comprará: aceite, azúcar, arroz, frijoles,sopa, pan, galletas, atún, mayonesa, cloro, limpiador para pisos,chiles, huevos, jamón, queso, etc.
texts.en:
From the road of the community, different landscapes can be seen, all of them consist of the hills surrounding the place, you also have a nice view of the peak of Orizaba, the highest volcano in Mexico, as well as the hills surrounding the community.

La Capillita [The Little Chapel] is a group made up of 10 people who reside in the town. 100% is sugarcane where the majority of the residents work in the production, cutting and other aspects related to this product. Likewise people plant and grow food for consumption, in this way they earn income and meet certain needs. The name of the group was decided by the members because in front of the house where they have their meetings is a chapel. The members and their professions are:

Noelia- Traditional Food Sales, María- Traditional Food Sales, María Del Carmen- Clothing Sales, Jorge Alberto- Silver Sales, Isabel- Food Sales, Proceso- Clothing Sales, Flor- Silver Sales, Jorge- Drink Sales, Mayra- Sweet Sales y Ángel- Grocery Sales.

"Thanks to VisionFund México, I have launched my own business" comments Angel who is a very charismatic and happy gentleman, who has been selling staple products for consumption for two years, which helped him modify part of his house. His wife helps him by serving at the store, thanks to that Angel recently began selling fish. He explains that he hopes to purchase equipment needed to raise mojarra [a type of fish common in the area] and sell it, so their profits would increase.

With the approved loan he will buy: oil, sugar, rice, beans, soup, bread, cookies, tuna, mayonnaise, bleach, floor cleaner, chillies, eggs, ham, cheese, etc.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, rice, beans, soup, bread, cookies, tuna, mayonnaise, chlorine, floor cleaner, chillies, eggs, ham, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Alonzo

texts.es:
Alonzo tiene 27 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado en la escuela, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, por el momento no han procreado hijos y vive en casa de su padre.

  Alonzo trabaja en el destacamento militar, tiene alrededor de 11 meses en este trabajo, aprendió a brindar el servicio ya que cuando ingresó lo instruyeron para ver si era seleccionado, esta es su principal fuente de ingresos, antes trabajaba en una empresa de energía eléctrica. El lugar de trabajo le queda a unos 30 km de distancia de su casa y para llegar se transporta en autobús.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar parte de los materiales que necesitará para construir su casa, dentro de ellos están, hierro, arena, y bloque, el resto del material lo comprará con sus ahorros.


   El sueño de Alonzo es ver terminada su vivienda, luego poner un negocio de productos de la canasta básica y prestar un buen servicio a los habitantes de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Alonzo is 27 years old. He went to school through ninth grade. He has a partner, who does domestic work. For the moment, they have no children, and he lives in the house of his father.

Alonzo works in the military detachment. He has been doing this work for 11 months. He learned to offer the service since when he entered they taught it to him to see if he was selected. This is his principal source of income. Before, he worked in an electrical energy business. His place of work is some 30 km from his house, and to get there he goes by bus.

He needs the loan to buy part of the materials that he will need to construct his house, among which are iron, sand, and blocks. He will buy the rest of the materials with his savings.

Alonzo's dream is to see his house get finished, then to set up a business with basic household products and offer good service to the inhabitants of his community.

loans.use: to buy part of the materials that he will need to construct his house, among which are iron, sand, and blocks. He will buy the rest of the materials with his savings.

loans.name: Lailyn

texts.en:
Lailyn has been making savings for many days to make home improvements, but most of the savings are spent for household expenses. Now she wants to buy additional grocery goods to sell for her store to improve sales and revenue.

Therefore, Lailyn has requested a new loan so that she can buy additional grocery goods to sell and repair her house with the contribution of her savings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva is 57 years old and married with ten children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Melva is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Melva has been pig fattening for one year and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her poultry farm, buy 200 chickens, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish.


She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing net and gasoline for her fishing business.


She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Annaliza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and gasoline

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional dried coconut meat to sell for her buy and sell dried coconut meat business.

Yolanda has been in this business for 10 years. Yolanda earns more income from buying and selling ready-to-wear items.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business in the Philippines buying and selling bananas. She has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from raising livestock.

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell for her business buying and selling bananas.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 55 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Zenaida is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Zenaida has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, lotions, cosmetics, body creams etc.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Leonila works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Leonila is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers for her buy and sell banana business.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 47 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Merlita is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Merlita has been pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Hazel works hard to support her family. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising chickens and a tricycle transportation business. 

Hazel has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). She is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy more stock of vegetables to sell in her food stall. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to set up her sewing business. She will buy an overlock machine and a flatbed machine and will adapt a space in her home.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 39 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Leah works very hard to provide for them.

Leah runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Leah has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, feeds, canned goods, eggs, biscuits, detergent soap, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Leah would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Alicia Ilaria

texts.es:
Uno de los negocios característicos de Sololá es la crianza de animales de todo tipo.

Desde hace dos años, Alicia de 37 años, quien vive en Sololá, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, negocio que genera una satisfactoria ganancia.

Hace una solicitud de préstamo para la compra de más animales y los insumos como el concentrado que necesita para la crianza y la compra de un molino de nixtamal.

Son sus metas para generar más ingresos y el sostenimiento de su familia como es su hijita de 6 años.
texts.en:
One of the characteristic businesses of Sololá is raising animals of all types.

For two years, Alicia, who is 37 and lives in Solosá, has been raising pigs, a business that generates satisfactory earnings.

She is applying for a loan to purchase more animals, the supplies, such as the concentrate that they need for growth, and a mill for nixtamal (corn flour).

Her goals are to generate more income and sustain her family, which is her six-year-old daughter.

loans.use: to buy animals and supplies for them

loans.name: Ma. Lina

texts.en:
Ma. Lina is 42 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Ma. Lina has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from direct selling avon products.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 37 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Delia works hard to provide for her family, by running a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items, such as snack foods, canned goods and school supplies.

Delia has been running the general store for 13 years while also earning additional income from raising livestock. She aspires to save enough money send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods, canned goods and school supplies.

loans.name: Jacquilyn

texts.en:
Jacquilyn is a married 33-year-old woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. Jacquilyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed.

Jacquilyn has been fattening pigs for eight years and has borrowed from NWTF four times in the past. In the future, Jacquilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Carmenia

texts.en: Carmenia is 53 years old and married with one child in school.  Carmenia works very hard to provide for them, by selling Avon products in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.  Carmenia has been in this business for 30 years.  She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Emil

texts.en: Emil is 23 years old from Gerona, Tarlac. He is studying at St. Paul Colleges Foundation. His father works as an operator or driver. Emil requests a PHP 10,000 loan from Kiva for his tuition fee. His desire for a bright future is what drives him to study and finish college. He is very optimistic that lenders will approve his request, for this will help him achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Narankhuu

texts.en: Mr. Narankhuu, 57 years old, lives with his wife in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as an employee bus driver at a power station since 2010. His wife has retired from work and gets a state pension. Their son works at a mining company as an engineer. Their daughter has a position of senior designer at a building company. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as planks, cement, bricks and steel for his house renovation. Over the years, his house has deteriorated badly due to heavy rainfall and strong wind. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into the air. The borrower is very concerned about air pollution and he urges other households to renovate their houses and burn less coal as the state research department consider coal burning as the main air pollution contributor.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as planks, cement, bricks and steel for renovating his house.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Maura works hard to support her family.

She has a feed retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Maura is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of feed to offer for sale.

Maura has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty-one loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more feed to offer for sale.

loans.name: Joyal

texts.en: Joyal is married and works hard to support her family by running a pig fattening business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Joyal has been in this business for one year now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Elsie works hard to support her family. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She also earns additional income selling rice. Elsie is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help to attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
Las ganas de seguir prosperando es lo que le da energía a Silvia Elena, quién día a día trabaja con mucho ánimo y entusiasmo. Hace dos años inició su negocio de venta de ropa para fortalecer la economía familiar, aunque ha habido días difíciles, ha salido adelante.  Ella está muy agradecida con Kiva y MiCrédito por el apoyo que le han brindado a través del financiamiento anterior, con el cual ha visto grandes cambios. Su inventario ha aumentado así como su clientela, lo que le ha generado buenas ganancias y de esta manera ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida.
Es una mujer amable y emprendedora, con muchas metas y sueños que cumplir, razón por la que solicita un segundo crédito. Lo requiere para comprar ropa, tanto de niños como adultos; también quiere iniciar a vender joyería de acero. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento y en el apoyo incondicional de su madre, quien la motiva a cumplir todos sus objetivos. Uno de sus planes es alquilar un local amplio para establecer su tienda de ropa, de manera que logré captar más clientela y mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The will to continue prospering is what gives energy to Silvia Elena, who works day after day with much spirit and enthusiasm.  Two years ago she began her business of selling clothing to strengthen the family economy. Although she has had difficult days, she has made progress. She is very grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito for the support that they have offered her through the previous financing, with which she has seen great changes. Her inventory has increased as well as her clientele, which has generated good earnings for her and in this way has improved her living conditions.

She is a friendly and entrepreneurial woman, with many goals and dreams to accomplish. For this reason, she is applying for a second loan. She needs it to buy clothing for children as well as for adults. She also wants to begin selling steel jewelry. She places her confidence in the financing and in the unconditional support of her mother, who motivates her to accomplish all her goals. One of her plans is to rent an ample space to establish her clothing store, so that she can achieve more customers and better income.

loans.use: to buy clothing for children as well as adults. She also wants to begin selling steel jewelry

loans.name: Erjel

texts.en:
Erjel works hard to support her family. Erjel is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, sugar, etc.

Erjel has been in this business for six years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rochel

texts.en:
Rochel is 40 years old, married and has three children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rochel requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

Rochel has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Rochel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Lester Manuel

texts.es:
Lester de 30 años de edad, casado con un hijo menor de edad, es originario de Achuapa, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de salir adelante. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligado a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del  hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica una carpintería que consiste en la fabricación de mueble para el hogar como ropero, sillas, camas, jugueteras, cómodas, multiusos. El dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias fabricando los muebles.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio  para que un  futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  y se esa forma pueda llegar a cumplir sus sueños como es brindarles estudio s a sus hijos, y terminas su casa de habitación. Lester agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Lester is 30 years old, married with a young son, he is originally from Achuapa, a place located in the northern zone of the region. He is characterized by being hardworking and responsible with the desire to get ahead. Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources he could not pursue a career and was forced to work from an early age, to help with household expenses.

Thanks to his efforts and his will to get ahead, as a source of income he works as a carpenter which consists of making furniture for homes such as wardrobes, chairs, beds, toy shelves, chests of drawers and multipurpose furniture. He spends around twelve hours a day making the furniture. And thus he can achieve his dreams such as providing his children with an education, and finishing the house where they live. 

Lester is thankful to the Kiva lenders who provide people with scant resources and in poor countries like Nicaragua to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as wood, glue, varnish and paint.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cooler.

loans.name: Routhelia

texts.en:
Routhelia is 43 years old, married and has three children, who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Routhelia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and rice and corn barns.

Routhelia has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Routhelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and rice and corn barns.

loans.name: Koleti

texts.en: Koleti is a 50-year-old widow with two children. She runs a small elei printing and sewing business, selling to the members of her community and also to the public in town. She also has clients from other villages who come to her for her sewing services. She has just joined the SPBD program to gain access to financial assistance. With this money, Koleti plans to purchase fabric paint, design boards, fabric materials, and a new sewing machine for the better improvement of her business. Koleti hopes to make a lot of profit from her business so that she would be able to provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric paint, design boards, fabric materials, and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Gankhuyag

texts.en: Mr. Gankhuyag, 55 years old, lives with his wife and son in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been rendering a taxi service to local people for more than ten years. His wife works at a hospital as a doctor. Their son recently graduated from his university and now he is looking for a job. As a national holiday named Naadam festival is happening across Kherlen, he wants to open temporary cafe which will mainly sell khuushuur, a national food, to local people. So he is requesting a loan of 2,400,000 MNT to buy beef and flour as well as pay rent for a cafe. The festival will continue for two weeks and if his business succeeds, he can accumulate significant income for his family needs. The borrower wants to use this income for his house renovations as his old brick house has deteriorated over the years.

loans.use: to buy beef and flour as well as pay rent for a temporary cafe.

loans.name: Dolia

texts.en:
Dolia is 75 years old and married with fifteen children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Dolia has been in this business for 50 years.

In the future Dolia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ludis Maria

texts.es:
Ludis es una humilde campesina de 51 años de edad, muy trabajadora y luchadora que ha sabido que es ejercer el papel de madre y padre al mismo tiempo.

Madre de 2 hijos mayores de edad los cuales crió, alimento y les ofreció educación gracias al negocio de venta de pollos y cerdos que constituyo muchos años atrás.  

Solicita un crédito para realizar adecuaciones en sus corrales pues sus animales se le están muriendo por los cambios constantes de clima. También quiere comprar cerdos para mejorar sus establos pues hay mucha competencia en el sector. 

Para Ludis el crédito es de vital importancia pues de él depende que su negocio pueda seguir operando y pueda seguir viviendo como lo ha venido haciendo todo este tiempo.
texts.en:
Ludis is a humble farmer of 51 years of age, very hardworking and a real fighter who knowns what it is to play the role of both mother and father at the same time.

The mother of two older children who she brought up, fed and educated thanks to her business selling chickens and pigs which she started many years ago.

She is requesting a loan to make adaptions to her pens as her animals are dying due to constant changes in the climate. She also wants to buy pigs to improve her pens as there is a lot of competition in the sector.

For Ludis the loan is of vital importance as her business continuing to operate depends on it and she can continue to live as she has been doing all this time.

loans.use: to adapt her animal pens and buy pigs.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta is 59 years old, from Moncada, Tarlac. She is married with five children. Their source of income is from farming. What the family earns is not enough to send their children to school. To help them, Loreta wants to avail herself of a loan of PHP 10,000 from the Kiva lenders. It is to be used for their son Gilbert’s tuition fee. He is taking up computer programming. Despite the lack of money, Gilbert wants to finish college to help his family.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fee

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 61 years old, married and has seven children. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Vergie has been pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Blanca Isabel

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 45 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, en estos momentos está en proceso de divorcio con su esposo, tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos ya son profesionales y los otros dos se encuentran estudiando una carrera, con ella solo viven sus 4 hijos.

     
Blanca trabaja como empleada de oficios varios en un hospital, lleva 12 años de realizar esta actividad, por iniciativa propia decidió solicitar empleo en ese lugar, cuando la seleccionaron paso por un proceso de instrucción fue así como aprendió a realizar todos los oficios, antes trabajaba como alfabetizadora de adultos, el lugar de trabajo le queda a 30 km de su casa y se desplaza en bus para llegar, el horario es variable ya que a veces hace turnos de 24 horas y descansa tras 24 horas.



Ella necesita el crédito para comprar un terreno que le venden cerca de donde ella vive, el crédito cambiará su vida porque en un futuro podrá tener un lugar más amplio para vivir con sus hijos


Su sueño es ayudar con todo sacrificio a sus hijos para que puedan estudiar y que puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Blanca, 45, studied up until high school.  Now she is in the process of divorcing her husband.  She has four children, two who are already professionals and another two who are studying for their degrees.  She lives with the four of them.

Blanca is a general services employee at a hospital where she has been working for 12 years.  On her own initiative she applied for the position and, when she was hired, had to go through a training process to learn what she needed to know for all the work activities.  She used to work teaching adults to read and write.  Her workplace is 30 km from home so she takes a bus to get there.  Her schedule is variable and sometimes she has 24-hour work shifts, then is off work 24 hours.

She is in need of a loan to buy land that is on sale near where she lives.  The loan will change her life because in the future she will be able to enjoy more property to live with her children.

Her dream is to help her children, with all the sacrifice needed, to they can study and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy land near where she lives.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana, tiene 59 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y reside en una comunidad que pertenece a Yoro. Hace 14 años que estableció una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica como ser: manteca, café, arroz, embutidos, dulces, churros, azúcar, harina, huevos, refrescos etc. Ha solicitado el cuarto ciclo de préstamo con el actual que es por 15,000 lempiras para comprar productos básicos como azúcar, manteca, granos, embutidos, carnes y otros para surtir y vender más. Piensa seguir manteniendo su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para tener una vida mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is 59 years old, married, has 3 children and lives in a community which is part of Yoro.

14 years ago she established a grocery store where she sells basic necessities such as: butter, coffee, rice, sausage, sweets, churros, sugar, flour, eggs, soft drinks, etc. She has requested this quarter cycle loan of 15,000 lempiras to buy basic products such as sugar, butter, grains, sausages, meat etc. to stock up and sell more.

She plans to continue maintaining her business and get better earnings to have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy basic products such as sugar, butter, grains, sausage, meat, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Leticia

texts.es:
Blanca es en verdad una mujer de admirar pues a su 40 años de edad no se dejó de caer por una difícil situación que atravesó y es que se separó de su esposo dejándola sola con sus dos hijos de 15 y 16 años de edad.

Se dedica a la cría, engorde y distribución tanto de cerdos como de pollos, actividad que aprendió gracias a sus padres y con la que ha podido sostener a sus hijos desde que se separó de su esposo. 


Solicita un crédito para adecuar sus cocheras (lugar destinado para los cerdos), y también usara le crédito para la compra de cuido.

El crédito será de suma importancia para ella pues podrá seguir con su noble labor y le permitirá crecer como empresa lo cual es prioridad para ella ya que quiere brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar en universidad y para ello necesita  buenos ingresos para pagar las costosas matriculas

Su más grande sueño es ver a sus hijos convertidos en todos unos profesionales de lo que escojan estudiar.
texts.en:
Blanca is truly an admirable woman who, despite her 40 years, has not fallen behind because of the difficult situation she went through following the divorce from her husband, leaving her alone with two children, ages 15 and 16.

She raises and sells pigs and chickens, a trade her parents taught her which she has used to support her children since the divorce.

Blanca is requesting a loan to renovate her pig pens and to buy animal feed.  The loan is very important to her since she will be able to continue this noble activity and expand her business which is her priority.  She wants to give her children an opportunity to get a university education; so she will need a good income to pay the high tuition costs.

Her greatest goal is to see her children become professionals in any field they choose to study.

loans.use: To renovate and improve her pig pens and buy animal feed.

loans.name: Jorge De Jesús

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 29 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tienen un hijo que ya estudia en la escuela y nadie más depende de Jorge.


  Jorge se dedica a trabajar sembrando granos básicos como maíz, frijol, también trabaja cuidando ganado de ordeño, tiene 8 años que trabajar con ganado bovino, anteriormente trabajó en un centro de telas, pero no siguió porque no era suficiente para mantener a su familia. Su pareja es la única que se involucra en las actividades agrícolas que realiza.

   Él necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca lechera, le servirá de mucho ya que podrá aumentar la producción de leche.

Su sueño es comprar y vender más ganado con el cual pueda tener mayores ingresos económicos, luego con las ganancias hacer su propia vivienda para tener una mejor calidad de vida, más seguridad y más higiene.
texts.en:
Jorge, 29, has a high school education.  He lives with his common-law wife who is a homemaker and their school-aged son.  Jorge has no other dependents.

He grows basic grains such as corn and beans and also has dairy cattle.  He has worked with cattle for eight years but used to work at a fabric center.  He did not continue there because he did not earn enough to support the family.  His wife is the only one who helps with the farm work.

The loan he is requesting is to buy a dairy cow so he can increase milk production.  His dream is to buy and sell more cattle so he can increase his income.  He wants to use the profit to build his own house for a better quality of life, more safety and better hygiene.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Sotha

texts.en: Sotha is 22 years old, a student and a security guard. He lives in Battambang Province of Cambodia. He can earn approximately $3 per day. Because of the lack of financial support, he would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fee. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he wants to be a good credit officer.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 23 years old, single and works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Marjorie has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Marjorie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José, de 37 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 4 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Yoro. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura de granos básicos y hace 14 años decidió por vender mercadería como ser zapatos, ropa, sandalias y también venta de abarrotería en su casa como ser azúcar, manteca, carnes, granos básicos etc. Este negocio lo atiende su esposa y  el negocio de mercadería lo atiende Jose quien se moviliza en una motocicleta para vender en varios lugares. El préstamo que solicita es el noveno ciclo y es por 23,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar  mercadería como zapatos, sandalias, ropa y abarrotería como manteca, café, carnes y azúcar. Su plan es seguir trabajando con el negocio para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: José, who is 37 years old, lives in a common-law marriage with his wife, with whom he has 4 children. He resides in a small town in the municipality of Yoro. He used to work in basic grains agriculture. Fourteen years ago he decided to sell merchandise such as shoes, clothing, and sandals. He also sells grocery items from his house, such as sugar, shortening, meats, basic grains, etc. His wife helps tend this store; José tends the merchandise business. He uses his motorcycle to sell in various areas. The loan he is requesting is his ninth loan cycle and it is for 23,000 HNL (Honduran Lempiras). He will use it to buy merchandise such as shoes, sandals, clothing, and grocery items such as shortening, coffee, meats, and sugar. His plan is to continue working with his business in order to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shoes, sandals, clothing, and grocery items such as shortening, coffee, meats, and sugar.

loans.name: Altansukh

texts.en: Mr. Altansukh, 23 years old, lives with his father and brother in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been working as a security officer at a private firm since January 2014. His father is a teacher at a high school. His brother is currently unemployed and looking for job. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years. So he is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, planks and fiberglass. Using those materials, he, his father and brother will repair their house, making it energy efficient and burn less coal for heating. Reduction in coal burning will contribute to the clean air efforts as state research department considers coal as the main air polluter.

loans.use: to buy materials to renovate his house in order to make it energy efficient and reduce coal burning

loans.name: Vizmenda

texts.en:
Vizmenda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Vizmenda has been in this business for six years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 36 years old, married and has one child who is in school.  

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Melinda requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, rice barns and vitamins.

Melinda has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, rice barns and vitamins

loans.name: Evan Rey

texts.en:
Evan Rey is studying in the university to have a better education and be able to find a better job for his future. He helps his parents work in their motorcycle transportation business, and it helps the family sustain their needs. 

Recently, he needed financial assistance for his school fees, for his savings were not enough for his school expenses. Evan Rey borrowed a new loan from GDMPC Micro Finance to pay his tuition fees. He always wants to improve his family's living situation in the near future.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old and has six children. Elizabeth is married, and two of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Elizabeth has been raising livestock for six years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase addtiional livestock to raise

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 42 years old and has seven children. Lorna is married, and three of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorna has been in business for 24 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Leonila has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies and pay part of another current loan.

loans.name: Carlos Guillermo

texts.es:
Carlos es un carpintero de 53 años de edad lleno de aspiraciones de progreso junto a su familia, lleva 10 años operando y su intensidad horaria es de 10 a 14 horas diarias trabajando de lunes a sábado. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de madera para seguir operando pues tiene  buenos pedidos que representara una buena rentabilidad y una oportunidad de tener un cliente fijo a futuro. 

La importancia de este crédito es muy grande pues le representara a carlos un cliente parta el futuro por eso es indispensable para el atenderlo a tiempo, incluso entregar los trabajos antes de la fecha pactada.

Su gran sueño es progresar junto con su familia y construir una casa con sus propias manos y los materiales que salgan de la rentabilidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos, 53, is a carpinter who aspires to getting ahead together with his family.  He has been in business for ten years with an intense work schedule from 10:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m., Monday through Saturday.

He is requesting a loan to buy wood to continue working since he has several orders which represent good profitability and an opportunity to have a fixed clientele in the future.

The importance of this loan is significant since for Carlos it represents having customers in the future.  It is important for him to fill orders on time, even deliver orders before their deadline.

His greatest goal is to prosper with his family and build a house with his own hands from materials he is able to buy with the profits of his business.

loans.use: To buy wood for his business.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta, tiene 34 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 5 hijos y reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella cuanta con su propio negocio de pulpería, donde vende granos básicos, azúcar, harina, sal, pan, huevos, churros, refrescos, lácteos, productos enlatados y de aseo. Anteriormente trabajo en un maquila y luego de quedar sin empleo decidió poner este negocio. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para seguir manteniendo surtida la pulpería, con productos como granos básicos, harina, manteca, lácteos, refrescos, azúcar, pan, refrescos, huevos, churros y otros que necesite, para poder aumentar las ventas. Tiene como meta ampliar mas el negocio para surtirlo y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Marta, 34, lives with her common-law husband and their five children in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes.  She runs her own grocery store and sells staple grains, sugar, flour, salt, bread, eggs, doughnuts, soft drinks, dairy products, canned goods and personal hygiene products.

She previously worked in a factory but when she was laid off she decided to start this business. She has asked for a second loan of 15,000 Lempiras to stock her shop with such items as staple grains, flour, lard, dairy products, soft drinks, sugar, bread, eggs, doughnuts and other things she needs to increase her sales. Her goal is to expand her business, restock it and increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy staple grains, flour, lard, dairy products, soft drinks, sugar, bread, eggs, doughnuts and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Nietaa Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe  Nietaa   sont tous mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 6 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygamiques à Kokoungrou un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Les 6 membres du groupe Nietaa collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso à fin de mieux organisé leurs activités hivernales. Ils sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution et font exclusivement la production du maïs qui reste la culture dominante de la zone. 
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur N’DIO, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des assis, compte payer ses frais de labour, de sarclage, acheté de l’engrais, de l’herbicide et autre petit équipement pour entretenir son champ d’environ 1 hectare.
A la fin de la campagne, les productions sont vendues en espèce à Fana.
Il envisage réalise un bénéfice moyen de 150 000F CFA par campagne qui sera utilisé pour les besoin familiales.
Les  membres du groupe se disent satisfaites de leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et portent toute leur confiance pour une agriculture durable et fructueuse.
texts.en:
The six members of the Nietaa group are all married. On average they are 45 years old with six children and live in polygamous families in Kokoungrou, a village in the prefecture of Dioïla, which is part of the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

The six members of the Nietaa group work with Soro Yiriwaso to better organize their winter activities. They are on their first collaboration with the institution and are exclusively producers of maize, which remains the dominant crop in the area. 

Mr. N'Dio, the first person kneeling from right to left, will use the loan to pay for plowing and weeding, and buy fertilizer, herbicide and other small equipment to maintain his field of about 1 hectare (2.47 acres). 

At the end of the growing season, the harvested crop is sold for cash in Fana. He expects an average profit of 150,000 CFA francs per growing season that will be used to cover family needs.

The group members were satisfied with their collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, and are confident that their farming will be sustainable and successful.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment, and pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 34 años de edad soltera, madre de un bebé de siete meses y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortas, pasteles y panadería.
Ella es una persona amistosa, alegre, emprendedora, puntual y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘vino tinto’ de la ciudad de La Paz, un lugar que alberga a los trabajadores fabriles desde la década de los treinta que se asentaron cerca de sus fuentes de trabajo; es decir cerca de las fábricas del lugar.
María es de tez morena, cabello largo negro, estatura mediana, su rutina diaria comienza cerca a las seis de la mañana, se coloca su delantal blanco y comienza a mesclar harinas. Al comenzar todo está en su sitio, los pequeños objetos están en su lugar, según pasan las horas, salen los panecillos calientes al mismo tiempo que va pintando con huevo las masas antes de meterlas al horno. Para el pan, a pesar de todas las diferentes harinas, ingredientes y recetas que sigue, sólo hay una sal y un aceite, es simple y bonito.
María tiene necesidades en su negocio, por el tiempo que lleva trabajando su horno se ha deteriorado a tal punto de quedar casi obsoleto por lo que su producción se ha reducido afectando su economía y la de su familia. Ella desea que su negocio sea conocido por muchos clientes por la buena calidad y sabor de sus productos.
Es por esos motivos que María solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial nuevo y con los beneficios darle una vida mejor a su pequeño bebé.
texts.en:
Maria is a single woman of 34 years of age, mother of a baby of seven months old who works making and selling cakes, pastries and bread.

She is a friendly, happy, entrepreneurial, punctual and very hardworking person, her business is located in the 'red wine' district of the city of La Paz, a place that is home to factory workers from the thirties who settled near their places of employment; i.e. near the factories of that place.

Mary has a dark complexion, long black hair, medium build, her daily routine starts at six in the morning, she puts on her white apron and starts mixing flour. At the beginning everything is in its place, the small objects are in place, after the hours have passed, out come the hot bread rolls at the same time that she is glazing the dough with an egg before putting them into the oven. For the bread, despite all the different kinds of flour, ingredients and recipes there are, there is only one kind of salt and one kind of oil, it's simple and nice.

Maria has needs in the business, due to the amount of time that she has been working her oven has deteriorated to the point that it is almost obsolete, so her production has been reduced, affecting her finances and those of her family. She wants her business to be known by many customers for the good quality and flavor of her products.

It is for these motives that Maria is requesting a loan, for the purchase of a new industrial oven and with the benefits, give a better life to her small baby.

loans.use: to buy an new industrial oven and with the benefits give a better life to her small baby.

loans.name: Diamba

texts.fr:
Monsieur DIAMBA est né vers 1966 à Diawarala. Il réside dans le village de Diawarala chez lui même dans une famille traditionnelle, marié et père de trois enfants. Pour des raisons sociales, Monsieur DIAMBA n’a pas été à l’école. Il est actuellement vendeur de céréales. En vu de diversifier ses activités il s’élança dans le commerce d’intrant agricole depuis 5 ans à son propre compte. Il s’approvisionne en marchandises pratiquement chaque semaine auprès de ses fournisseurs à Koutiala. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché des villages environnants à une clientèle mixte. Ainsi pour mieux organiser son activité, Monsieur DIAMBA décida d’entrée en collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et est à son tout premier prêt. Monsieur DIAMBA se voit renforcer ses capacités ce qui lui permet d’envisager un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 160 000 FCFA, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Diamba was born around 1966 in Diawarala. He resides in the village of Diawarala in a traditional family home, and is married with three children. For social reasons, Mr. Diamba did not attend school.

He currently sells cereals. With a view to diversify his business he began trading agricultural inputs on his own five years ago. He resupplies almost every week from suppliers in Koutiala. Retail sales are conducted in the markets of surrounding villages to a mixed clientele.

To better organize his activities, Mr. Diamba decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso where he is on his very first loan. Mr. Diamba sees his capacities strengthened, and as a result he expects average monthly profits of 160,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Mario Fidel

texts.es: El señor Fidel es una persona joven, tranquilo y trabajador con la voluntad de superase en la vida, maneja sus actividad económicas con responsabilidad y tiene capacidad técnica para administrar su fuente de trabajo de donde genera sus ingresos, trabaja en un taller de mecánica junto con sus hermanos ubicado en la misma población de Tiraque del departamento de Cochabamba, de estado civil soltero sin dependientes económicos, no tiene casa propia, vive en la casa de su padre junto con sus hermanos, actualmente se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de herramientas y mejorar su taller de mecánica de esa manera podrá incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar  su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fidel is a young person, calm and hardworking with the will to better himself in life. He manages his financial activities responsibly and has the technical capacity to administer his sources of work where he generates income. He works in a repair shop with his brothers, which is located in the same town of Tiraque in the Cochabamba department.

His civil status is single without economic dependents. He doesn't have his own home, he lives in his father's house with his brothers. 

Currently he sees the need to request a loan to buy tools and improve his mechanical repair shop and thus he will be able to increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools for the mechanics repair shop he owns with his brothers

loans.name: Mamoudou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamoudou est né en Septembre 1978 à Konobougou cercle de Barouéli. Il réside dans la ville de Konobougou, chez son père dans une famille traditionnelle, célibataire sans enfant. Pour des raisons sociales, Monsieur Mamoudou abandonna trop tôt l’école pour mener des activités génératrices de revenue. En vu de diversifier ses activités il s’élança dans le commerce d’intrant agricole depuis 8 ans à son propre compte. Il s’approvisionne en marchandises pratiquement chaque semaine auprès de ses fournisseurs à Bamako. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce mais aussi à crédit au niveau des marchés environnants à une clientèle mixte. Ainsi pour mieux organiser son activité, Monsieur Mamoudou décida d’entrée en collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et est à son tout premier prêt. a. Monsieur Mamoudou se voit renforcer ses capacités ce qui lui permet d’envisager un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 110 000 Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamoudou was born in September 1978 in Konobougou, in the Barouéli Circle. He resides in Konobougou in his father's traditional family home, and is unmarried without children. For social reasons, Mr. Diamba left school at an early age to engage in revenue-generating activities.

Wanting to diversify his activities he began trading agricultural inputs on his own eight years ago. He resupplies almost every week from suppliers in Bamako. Retail sales are conducted for cash but also on credit, to a mixed clientele in the markets of surrounding villages, .

To better organize his activities, Mr. Mamoudou decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso where he is on his very first loan.

Mr. Mamoudou sees his capacities strengthened, and as a result he expects average monthly profits of 110,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Libardo Manuel

texts.es:
Trabajador y soñador, son dos palabras que describen perfectamente a Libardo, un hombre trabajador y de familia, que hace todo lo que este a su alcance para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa.

Se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos en el municipio de Planeta Rica.
Aprendió todo acerca de este oficio gracias a las enseñanzas y apoyo de sus padres.
El posee gran conocimiento en esta materia y considera que necesita un pequeño impulso para incrementar sus ventas y aumentar su negocio, es por esta razón que solicita un auxilio económico para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos y de concentrados.

Con este préstamo podrá continuar con su actividad que es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Apoyando a este emprendedor, estarás apoyando el empuje y trabajo de los campesinos Colombianos.
texts.en:
Hardworking and visionary, these are the words that describe Libardo perfectly, a hardworking family man, who does all that he can to manage to offer a better quality of life to his children and his wife.

He works raising and selling pigs in the Planeta Rica municipality. He learned everything about this job thanks to the instruction and support of his parents.

He has a great knowledge of this subject and thinks he needs a small impulse to increase his sales and grow his business, it is for this reason that he is requesting financial assistance to invest in buying pigs and feed.

With this loan he will be able to continue his work as this is the only source of income for the family.

Helping this entrepreneur, you will be supporting the drive and labor of rural Colombians.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Oumar est né vers 1973 à Konobougou. Il réside dans la ville de Konobougou chez lui même dans une famille traditionnelle, marié et père de huit enfants. Pour des raisons sociales, Monsieur Oumar abandonna trop tôt l’école pour se lancer dans des activités génératrices de revenue. Il est actuellement propriétaire d’un magasin d’aliment bétail. En vu de diversifier ses activités il s’élança dans le commerce d’intrant agricole depuis 9 ans à son propre compte. Il s’approvisionne en marchandises pratiquement chaque semaine auprès de ses fournisseurs à Ségou. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché des villages environnants à une clientèle mixte. Ainsi pour mieux organiser son activité, Monsieur Oumar décida d’entrée en collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et est à son tout premier prêt. Monsieur Oumar se voit renforcer ses capacités ce qui lui permet d’envisager un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 140 000 FCFA, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Oumar was born around 1973 in Konobougou. He resides in Konobougou in his traditional family home, and is the married father of eight children. For social reasons, Mr. Diamba left school at an early age to engage in revenue-generating activities.

He is currently the owner of a livestock feed store. Wanting to diversify his activities he began trading agricultural inputs on his own nine years ago. He resupplies almost every week from suppliers in Segou.

Retail sales are conducted for cash, to a mixed clientele in the markets of surrounding villages. To better organize his activities, Mr. Mamoudou decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso where he is on his very first loan.

As a result, Mr. Mamoudou sees his capacities strengthened, and expects average monthly profits of 140,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Teodosa

texts.es:
Teodosa de 65 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pues la situación económica no era favorable, está casada y su esposo trabaja en una finca de café realizando actividades de poda, fertilización y corta de café. Tiene tres hijos los cuales trabajan en diferentes lugares y solo uno de ellos vive con ella.


  Teodosa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus ingresos dependen de su esposo y la ayuda de sus tres hijos, toda su vida ha realizado esta actividad y está siempre pendiente de atender a sus hijos y esposo.

   El crédito que ella está solicitando lo necesita para comprar parte de los insumos agrícolas para empezar a  trabajar en la milpa, pues por la mala situación climática y la escases de lluvia no se desarrolló bien la cosecha anterior, además pagará un cerdo de su esposo.
	

   Ella pretende obtener una buena producción, salir adelante con las deudas, también quiere sacar un nuevo crédito para ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
Teodosa is 65 years old, she didn't have the opportunity to go to school as her family's economic situation wasn't prosperous, she is married and her husband works on a coffee plantation doing the work of pruning, fertilizing and trimming the coffee shrubs. She has three children who work in different places and only one of these lives with her.

Teodosa does the household chores, for income she is dependent on her husband and the help of her three children. All her life she has done this, and she is always waiting to take care of her children and husband.

The loan she is requesting she needs to buy some of the farming supplies to start to work in the cornfield, as due to the bad climate situation and the lack of rain the last harvest did not go well, also she will pay for a pig for her husband.

She hopes to get a good production, make progress on the loans, also she wants to take out a new loan to extend her house.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her cornfield and pay for a pig for her husband.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNONTALA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne40 ans et 6enfants.Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Beleda, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro(deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, condiments, de l’habillement et de chaussure en plastique.
Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNONTALA sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FATOUMATA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice.Elle compte acheter du riz, du cube Maggi et des condiments chez les grossistes à Massigui. 
La vente des plats se fait en espèce dans sa gargote à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de65000Fcfa,qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Kotognontala group consists of married women, who on average are 40 years old with six children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Beleda in the Dioïla prefecture, which is part of the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They run eateries, trade grain cereals, sell condiments, clothing and plastic shoes. The Kotognontala group of women are on their tenth group loan. To meet their customers' huge demands, they call upon Soro Yiriwaso. 

Fatoumata is the first person sitting from right to left. She is illiterate, and currently runs an eatery. She will buy rice, Maggi cubes and condiments from wholesalers in Massigui. 

Food preparations are sold for cash in her eatery to a mixed clientele. She expects to achieve monthly profits of 65,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients for restaurant business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bundles of american apparel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy four packs of coffee still in the fruit to process and start his own coffee business

loans.name: Ingry Paola

texts.es:
Ingry una mujer joven de 25 años de edad muy soñadora y creyente que está en el mundo para lograr grandes cosas.

Se dedica a la venta de mercancía como bolsos, manillas, pulseras, collares, actividad que realiza vendiendo sus productos puerta a puerta, pero hoy en día se le presento una gran oportunidad de montar un negocio en un centro comercial por ello y gracias a la corporación que le va a facilitar una importante suma de dinero quiere montar su negocio y se para al lado de uno semejando que el suyo será igual o mejor. 

El crédito lo invertirá en pagar unos meses de renta del local, vitrinas, mercancía, adecuaciones, pintura y todo lo necesario para comenzar en grande con su negocio.

Este crédito a pesar de ser tan elevado es de gran necesidad para ingry para iniciar su negocio pues quiere tener un local elegante pero con precios asequibles al público y lo más importante quiere ser la vendedora número uno en el centro comercial. 
	
Su gran sueño es ver su local crecer y vender mucho lo que, dándole buena estabilidad económica a su familia y poder asegurar a su hijo de 2 años de edad oportunidades de estudio.
texts.en:
Ingry is a young woman of 25 years of age, very visionary and a believer that she is in this world to achieve great things.

She works selling merchandise such as bags, armlets, bracelets and necklaces; an enterprise she does selling products door to door, but today she has a great opportunity to launch a business in a shopping centre. For this and thanks to the organization which is going to facilitate an important amount of money she wants to launch her business and [in the photo] she stands next to a similar one to hers, which will be the same or better.

The loan will be used to pay a few months of rent for the premises, showcases merchandise, adjustments, painting and all that is necessary to start big with her business.

The loan, despite being so high is a great need for Ingry to start her business, as she wants to have a stylish store but with prices that make it accessible to the public, but most importantly she wants to be the top seller in the shopping mall. 

Her big dream is to see her store grow and sell a lot that, giving good financial stability to her family and being able to insure her two year old child has the opportunity of going to school.

loans.use: to make a strong start in her own business selling accessories.

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro tiene 28 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer año de bachillerato y luego se casó pero su esposo está en los Estados Unidos laborando como mecánico y aún no tienen hijos.


Milagro se dedica al negocio de engorde de cerdos, ella se ha dedicado durante 5 años al engorde y  venta de cerdos, la cliente manifiesta que el oficio lo aprendió de su madre y que decidió dedicarse a él porque observó que generaba buenas ganancias.


El crédito lo solicita para comprar 10 sacos de concentrado para engordar los cerdos y seguidamente venderlos, con ello mejorará su negocio y podrá obtener mejores ingresos para su hogar.


Su sueño es que el negocio crezca y que le genere mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Milagro is 28 years old, studied up to the 3rd year of her bachillerato [high school diploma] and then she got married but her husband is in the United States working as a mechanic and they don't have children yet.

Milagro works in a business fattening pigs, she has been in the business for 5 years fattening and selling the pigs, the borrower says that she learnt this job from her mother and she decided to do this kind of work because she noticed that it generated a good income.
