The loan she is requesting is to buy 10 sacks of feed to fatten her pigs and continue to sell them, with which she will improve her business and will be able to get better earnings for her home.

Her dream is that her business will grow and will generate better profits.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of feed to fatten her pigs to later sell them.

loans.name: Salimatou Djidere's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois est l’un des plus anciens du programme et compte à ses actifs 22 cycles soit plus de 10 années d’expérience. Les membres sont très solidaires entre elles, vivent en parfaite harmonie. Ces femmes sont très actives dans le secteur du petit commerce dans leur localité, elles font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Salimatou Djidèré (debout à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants de 02 à 12 ans.  Elle gère un salon de coiffure dans sa localité, elle a une bonne maîtrise des coiffures qui sont à la vogue et fais ce métier depuis plus de 05 ans.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle désire acheter un carton de 120 paquets de mèche (cheveux artificiels) pour les utiliser lors des prestations.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte soutenir son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales (éducation des enfants, prise en charge sanitaire, …).
texts.en: This "banc villageois" is one of the oldest in the program and has completed 22 loan cycles over 10 years.  The members are very supportive of one another and live in perfect harmony.  These women are very active in small business in their area.  They also farm during the rainy season.  Ms. Salimatou Djidere (standing at the right with one hand raised) is the representative of this group. She is 36 years old, married, and mother of five children ages 2 to 12.  She runs a beauty salon in her neighborhood. She has mastered hairstyling that is in fashion and has been in this profession for over five years.  With her new loan, she wants to buy a box of 120 packets of hair extensions.  With the profits, she plans to support her husband in the management of their family expenses (children's school fees, healthcare, etc.)

loans.use: to buy a box of 120 packets of hair extensions.

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2011.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus de la même zone,elles ont comme activité la vente de légumes et de l'arachide.

Aida qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est l'emprunteuse vedette,elle est âgée de 27 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 02 filles.

Son activité est le commerce de légumes tel-que les patates,carottes,et des arachides.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter des légumes patate,poire,carotte pour une valeur de 25000f et de l'arachide pour 50000f.

Son objectif est d'assister son mari dans l'achat de la nourriture,assurer les besoins familiaux tel que la scolarité et la santé des enfants.
texts.en: This group was created in 2011. The members live in the same area and they are in the business of selling vegetables and groundnuts.  Aida, standing at the right of photo with her arm raised, is the representative.  She is 27 years old, married, and mother of two girls.  She sells vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, and groundnuts.  With the loan, she plans to buy vegetables, potatoes, pears, carrots for 25,000 francs and groundnuts for 50,000 francs.  Her goal is to help her husband buy food and take care of their family's needs, such as school fees and children's healthcare.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and groundnuts.

loans.name: Antoinette's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis 2007.il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et sont liées par une garantie solidaire.Leur activité principale est la vente de fruits.

Denise,debout à l'extrême droite et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 49ans,est mariée et mére de 03 enfants ,elle a comme activité la vente de légumes,de fruits et de l'huile.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter  des légumes pour 15000f,un bidon d'huile à 17500f et des fruis oranges et mangues pour 35000f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et de contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa maison.
texts.en: This group was created in 2007.  The members live in the same village and are connected by a joint deposit.  Their main business is the sale of fruit.  Denise, standing at the very right with her arm raised, is the manager of the group. She is 49 years old, married, and mother of three children. She sells vegetables, fruit, and oil.  With the loan, she plans to buy vegetables for 15,000 francs, one can of oil for 17,500 francs, and oranges and mangoes for 35,000 francs.  Her goal is to increase her savings and to contribute to her family's daily expenditures.

loans.use: to buy one can of oil, one box of vegetables, and two bags of fruit.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 46 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of vegetables to sell.

Betty has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the vegetables business for 13 years and also earns an income from direct selling and farming corn.

Betty aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 31 years old and married with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a business selling roasted chicken in the Philippines. Marjorie has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of chicken to sell.

Marjorie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marjorie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of chicken to sell.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en: Emely is 42 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Emely is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling eggs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Edemia

texts.pt:
A Sra. Edemia de 60 anos de idade casada é mae de 9 filhos todos maiores de idade e são independente. Ela è pensionista Militar Junto com o seu esposo.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construção (cimento, barrotes, varões, janelas, prtas e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. seu sonho é ver concluida sua residencia pelo que seu maior desafio é reunir condições financeiras para o efeito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edemia is 60 years old, married and mother of 9 children who are all of age and independent. She is a military pensioner along with her husband.

With this loan she will buy construction material (cement, beams, rods, windows, doors and payment for labour) to continue building her house. Her dream is to finish her home and her biggest challenge is to have the financial means to do so.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement, beams, rods, windows, doors and payment for labour) to continue building her house

loans.name: Ma. Maricel

texts.en:
Ma. Maricel is 36 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, soft drinks, diapers, sanitary pads, detergent soap, shampoo, beers, etc. to sell. She has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Ma. Maricel aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, soft drinks, diapers, sanitary pads, detergent soap, shampoo, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her business. 

Mary Joy has been in this business for 2 years. She earns additional income from a general store. 

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell for her business

loans.name: Denalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Denalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ginger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of ginger to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. 

Denalyn hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of ginger to sell

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 36 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, coffee, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Belinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Consesa

texts.en:
Consesa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Consesa has been in this business for 1 year. Consesa earns more income from a general store.

Consesa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall

loans.name: Evelyn Veronica

texts.en:
Evelyn Veronica is 33 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Evelyn Veronica aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Samuel

texts.pt:
O Sr. Samuel de 38 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos que estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario. Ele è trabalhador da empresa de produção de banana com cargo profisional de Tractorista a mais de 3 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção ( cimento, area, janela e barrotes ) para terminar a construçao da sua casa que constitui seu maior sonho.
texts.en:
Mr. Samuel is 38 years old, married and the father of 2 children who are in primary school. He has worked at a banana production company as a professional tractor driver for more than 3 years.

With this loan he will buy construction material (cement, sand, windows and beams) to finish building his home, which is also his biggest dream.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement, sand, windows and beams) to finish building his home, which is also his biggest dream

loans.name: Girlie Mae Angelie

texts.en:
Girlie Mae Angelie is 25 years old and single.  

She is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her business.

Girlie Mae Angelie has been raising chicken for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Aster

texts.en:
Aster is 56-years-old, married and has seven children, one of whom is in school. 

Aster is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Aster requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aster has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aster would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish selling business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 13 years. She also earns more income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
A Sra. Rosa de 44 anos de idade casada e mãe de 3 filhos todos a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundário. Ela è trabalhadora na empresa de produção de banana com cargo profissional de empacotadora a mais de 6 anos e è tambem negociante informal de produtos da machamba.
Com o presente emprestimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção (cimento e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para reabilitar a sua casa que constiutui o desafio do momento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is 44 years old, married and the mother of 3 children who all go to school (primary and secondary levels). She has worked at the banana production company as a packer for more than 6 years and also works as an informal trader selling farm products.

With this loan she will buy cement and pay for labour to fix her house, which is currently her biggest challenge.

loans.use: buy cement and pay for labour to fix her house

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.en:
Timoteo's previous loan was a big help in his business as he was able to buy additional stocks of mobile phone units and other items. Aside from this, he was also able to send his children to school.

With this, he would like to apply for another loan amounting to 10,000 PHP this time. He will use the new loan to buy additional supplies of products needed in his businesses. His profits from business will definitely help sustain his daily needs and provide for his children’s education. He looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Timoteo hopes to expand his business and open another branch. He dreams for his family to be always sufficient in everything. He meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of mobile and cell phone units to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie settled to earn her living in Misamis Occidental, Philippines together with her family.  Over eight years, Elvie was able to manage her retail business that absolutely met the needs of her family. Until now, the business is doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. With her generated revenue, she was able to save for their future needs. 

Recently, she took a new loan to buy more rice and corn grits to sell to improve sales. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Elvie expects an increase in sales to expand her business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy more rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Cerelyn

texts.en:
Cerelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cerelyn is 33-years-old and has one child who is currently in school.

Cerelyn has a native bag weaving business in the Philippines. Cerelyn requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cerelyn has been in this business for 17 years. Cerelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 47-years-old and married with four children.

Dina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Dina has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns income from vegetable vending.

Dina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 46 years old and has five children who are in school.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, yeast, margarine, etc.

Evelyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, yeast, margarine.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 40-years-old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Marites has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 51-years-old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, juice, coffee, sugar, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

Elena has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, juice, coffee, sugar, toothpaste, etc. 

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, juice, coffee, sugar, toothpaste, etc. to sell

loans.name: Siosen

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Siosen works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ginger in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Siosen is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell for her business buying and selling ginger.

Siosen has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.pt:
A Sra. Raquel de 36 anos de idade solteira e mãe de 2 filhos uma è indepedente vive na sua casa e a outra esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primario. Ela é promotora de venda desde 2007 numa empresa de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade, bebidas e mariscos “ O Peixe da Mamã “
Com o presente emprestimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção (cimento, área, blocos e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Raquel is 36 years old and the single mother of 2 children. One is independent and living in her own home and the other is in primary school. She has been a salesperson for a company named “ O Peixe da Mamã “ ["Mommy's Fish"] selling essential products, drinks and seafood since 2007.

With this loan she will buy construction material (cement, sand, blocks) and pay for the labour to continue building her house.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement, sand, blocks) and pay for the labour to continue building her house.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and other expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eufemia meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and while there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Abdunazar

texts.en:
Abdunazar is a hardworking man from a rural area. He was born in the year 1959. He is married and has 3 children. 

Abdunazar has been busy with growing agriculture products for more than 10 years. He grows vegetables and crops. Abdunazar has a great experience in growing agriculture products and knows his business well. His wife helps him with managing the business. 

Abdunazar is repeated client of IMON. He has a good credit history. Abdunazar used his previous loans to develop his agricultural business. He is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new sowing season. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new sowing season.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a 26-year-old hardworking woman. She is married to Geoffrey who adds additional income to support their family and they are blessed with one child.

Vivian has been operating a motorcycle transport business and a retail shop as a secondary business for four years. They provide her with an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Vivian is now servicing her 2nd loan of KES 15,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends use the entire amount to add to her personal savings so as to buy an additional motorcycle.

Vivian plans to use the anticipated income to educate her child and buy a piece of land for the family. She hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to add to her personal savings so as to buy an extra motorcycle.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 46-years-old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Rachel has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more coconut meat to sell for her business buying and selling dried coconut meat.

Felisa has been in this business for seven years. Felisa earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa works hard to support her family. Rosa is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing net.

Rosa has been in this business for 37 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 46-year-old man married to Jane who adds additional income to their family. They are blessed with three children. Lawrence is a charcoal sales man and has been operating the business for three years earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Lawrence is now servicing his second loan of KES 105,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy some additional sacks of charcoal to sell to his customers. 

Lawrence plans to use the anticipated income to educate his children and build a permanent business shop. He hopes to become a successful business man.

loans.use: To buy some sacks of charcoal to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba is an entrepreneur. She sells women’s clothes in a local market. Nasiba works and lives in the north part of Tajikistan. She began her business 6 years ago. She sells a variety of women's clothes. She manages the business alone and little by little is developing her business. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. 

Nasiba is a careful mother of 3 children. She uses the profit of her business to provide her children with all necessary things. Nasiba is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy women’s clothes for the new season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy women’s clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta owns and operates a jeepney unit. She has been successful in this business for eight years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income to provide for their everyday needs and necessities.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for the vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 10,000 for the maintenance of the jeepney unit and to buy other materials needed in her business.

In the future, Mamerta hopes to buy another jeepney unit for her transportation business. She only dreams of a simple yet a happy life with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 23-year-old married woman. She lives with her infant daughter and father-in-law in Telavi, Kakheti region, East Georgia. Her husband is abroad. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, Salome's father-in-law cultivates a small area of family-owned agricultural land and grows maize. In addition, they have a cow and a small vineyard. Salome produces cheese to sell locally. 

As the income is only seasonal and not enough to cover everyday costs for the family, Salome decided to start a trading business. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1,500 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase clothes at wholesale prices and then will resell them in Telavi at higher prices. This will give her a chance to have stable income and improve living conditions for her daughter. 

Salome awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade clothes.

loans.name: Ibrahim A.

texts.en: Ibrahim A. is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ibrahim A. joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Farisa, Jerry and Mashan. Ibrahim A. is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ibrahim A. will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ibrahim A. can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Ibrahim A. said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Ibrahim A. is not thinking about just this year.  In 5 years, he  wants to become the most profitable farmer in his community.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics, needles, threads, zippers, buttons and maintain her machines.

loans.name: Ana Ismaelita

texts.es:
Ana tiene 30 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica, ella es madre soltera de 2 hijos que viven en casa los cuales se encuentran estudiando y son los únicos que dependen de ella.

Ana actualmente se dedica al trabajo de cocina en un restaurante de un centro turístico, ella aprendió este trabajo por su mamá que tenía en negocio parecido, también se dedica a la venta de antojitos en el tiempo que le queda libre, ella viaja 15 minutos a pie hasta su lugar de trabajo.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar más mercadería para surtir su negocio, ya que ella tiene una venta de antojitos en la cual invertirá el crédito, ademas invertirá en la agricultura, comprará 6 sacos de abono, 2 bolsas de semillas, 3 cajas de insecticidas y pagará el alquiler de la tierra.

Ella a futuro desea tener un negocio que le permita generar ingresos para apoyar a sus 2 hijos en el estudio, además tener alimentación para toda su familia durante un tiempo con lo que saque de su cosecha.
texts.en:
Ana is 30 years old, she studied up to the 9th grade of primary education, she is a single mother to two children who live at home and go to school, and are the only ones who are dependent on her.

Ana currently works in the kitchen of a restaurant in a tourist resort, she learnt this trade from her mom who had a similar business, she also works selling snacks in her free time, she travels 15 minutes on foot to her place of work.

She needs the loan to buy more merchandise to stock up her business, as she has a snack selling business for which she will use the loan, furthermore she will use the loan for farming, she will buy 6 sacks of fertilizer, 2 sacks of seeds and 3 cases of insecticide and pay the rent on the land.

Her desire for the future is to have a business that will permit her to generate income to support her 2 children in their studies, also she will have food for all of her family during the time that they make the harvest.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business such as snacks and also fertilizer, seeds, etc. for a plot of land that she rents.

loans.name: Umar Danjuma

texts.en: Umar Danjuma is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Umar Danjuma joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: . Umar Danjuma is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Umar Danjuma will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Umar Danjuma can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Umar Danjuma is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
Claudio lives in Misamis Occidental. He earns income through providing transportation services to support the needs of his family. He has been doing this for three years. He gets good income from this business. There’s nothing more that can make him happy, except to see his children successful in their studies. 

Without hesitation, Claudio borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to repair the transport vehicle used in his business and provide his children with a better education. He joined GDMPC recently and improving his business becomes easier with access to GDMPC microfinance loans.

His plan in the future is to become successful.

loans.use: to repair the transport vehicle.

loans.name: Ulugbuhan

texts.ru: Улугбухан 62 года, вдова, мать героиня, у Улугбухан 7 детей. У нее среднее образование, с детства занимается животноводством и полеводством. Все дети взрослые и живут отдельно, но они активно помогают матери.  В хозяйстве Улугбухан на сегодняшний день есть: 2 коровы и 3 овцы, а также земельный надел мерою 0,45 ГА, где Улугбухан выращивает картошку, кукурузу и капусту. Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, младший сын Улугбухан, который работает в России, пересылает деньги в помощь матери. Однако, Улугбухан хочет сама вести бизнес, быть независимой и наоборот помогать своим детям. Поэтому, в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Улугбухан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота с целью дальнейшей его перепродажи, часть средств будет потрачена на полеводство. Доходы от бизнеса помогут улучшить благосостояние Улугбухан, а также провести давно запланированный ремонт дома.
texts.en: Ulugbuhan is 62 years old, a widow and a heroine-mother: she has 7 children. She has a secondary education. She has practiced livestock breeding and crop farming since childhood. All of her children are grown up and live separately, but they still actively help their mother. Ulugbuhan currently has 2 cows and 3 sheep on her farm, as well as a 0.45 hectare plot of land on which she grows potatoes, corn and cabbage. Her average monthly income is 4,000 som (KGS). As this amount of money is not enough to live on, Ulugbuhan's youngest son, who works in Russia, sends money home to help his mother. However, Ulugbuhan wants to run her business herself, be independent and, conversely, help her children. This is why Ulugbuhan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" to further develop her farm. She is requesting a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to increase the size of her herd with the goal of later reselling the livestock. She will also spend a portion of the loan on crop farming. The earnings from her business will improve Ulugbuhan's quality of life and also allow her to carryout a long-planned renovation of her house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for resale.

loans.name: José Efraín

texts.es:
José tiene 53 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de poder realizar estudios y prepararse, solamente estudió hasta cuarto y se dedicó a trabajar para apoyar a su familia, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, es padre de tres hijos entre 10 y 15 años de edad, que actualmente están estudiando en la escuela y nadie más depende de José	

José se dedica  a la agricultura desde que estaba pequeño, él cultiva la tierra debido a que su padre lo instruyó para que aprendiera este trabajo, además se dedica a la ganadería. Los cultivos los tiene cerca de su casa y no tiene horario de trabajo debido a que sus siembras necesitan de mucho cuido, de igual forma sus vacas necesitan de cuidados especiales y tiene que estar pendiente de los dos trabajos.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar abono para la milpa y preparación de la tierra, también pagará la mano de obra, gracias al préstamo también podrá recolectar su semilla a tiempo y tener alimento para el resto del año. 

José planea para un futuro poder mejorar sus cultivos y comercializarlos con algunas tiendas, además desea  reparar su casa y ampliarla para vivir cómodamente con su familia, y que sus hijos se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old. He wasn't able to get an education and only went to school through the fourth grade, when he started working to help his family. He is married and his wife takes care of the home. He is the father of three children, between 10 and 15 years old. They are in school and he has no other other dependents.  

José has worked in agriculture since he was young. He cultivates the land because his father taught him this work. He also works with livestock. He has his crops close to his home and has no set schedule because they need a lot of care. His cows also need special care and he has to be on top of both jobs.  

He needs the loan to buy fertilizer for the corn and to prepare the soil. He will also pay for labor costs. Thanks to the loan, he will also be able to collect his seeds on time and to have food for the rest of the year.   

In the future, José plans to be able to improve his crops and market them in some stores. He also wants to repair his house and enlarge it so his family can live their comfortably, and for his children to get an education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for corn and to prepare the soil. He will also pay for labor costs.

loans.name: José Pedro

texts.es:
José tiene 54 años de edad, está casado y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo dos estudian..

Él se dedica a la agricultura y carpintería, uno de sus hijos también es carpintero. José aprendió el trabajo por medio de su papá que se lo inculcó desde pequeño. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar semilla e insumos agrícolas y realizar el rastreado de tierras. 

José sueña con que su cultivo se desarrolle en buen estado y que tenga un buen rendimiento al final de su cosecha para que tenga más ingresos.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Only two of them are in school. He works in agriculture and carpentry. José learned the work through his father who taught it to him since he was very young.   

He will use the loan to buy seeds and agricultural materials and to prepare the soil for planting. 

José's dream is for his crop to grow well and to have a good yield at the end of the harvest so he can have more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural materials and to prepare the soil for planting.

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.ru: Женщина с прекрасной душой и прекрасными мыслями, которая живет в сельской местности, нуждается финансовой поддержке. Ее зовут Шодигул. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Она занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур уже более 7 лет. Она выращивает кукурузу на 1 га земле, рис на 0.30 га и морковь на 0.20 га земле. Шодигул работает упорно с раннего утра в поле и довольно своей работой. Ее муж помогает ей выращиванию сельхоз культур. Она должна сделать второй посев сельхоз культур, но не имеет денег. Шодигул запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки семена, минерального удобрения и оплатить наемным рабочим. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: This is a woman with a wonderful spirit and wonderful thoughts. She lives in the countryside and needs financial assistance. Her name is Shodigul. She is married and is raising four children. She has been crop farming for more than 7 years. She grows corn on 1 hectare of land, rice on 0.30 hectares of land and carrots on 0.20 hectares of land. Shodigul works hard from early in the morning and is satisfied with her work. Her husband helps her with her crop farming. She needs to do a second sowing of crops, but she does not have the money for it. Shodigul is requesting a loan for 6000 somoni to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and to pay hired workers. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and to pay hired workers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Ángela Eunice

texts.es:
Ángela de 33 años de edad, estudió hasta 8º grado, está casada y su pareja es gerente de ventas, tiene dos hijos y solo uno está estudiando. 

Ella tiene una tienda desde hace un año, el negocio lo aprendió por su esposo que tiene experiencia en ventas y la tienda la tiene en su casa. 

El crédito lo invertirá para mejorar su tienda y su casa, mejorará su vida ya que tendrá más ingresos por la tienda. 

Sus planes en un futuro son que su tienda crezca, atraer más clientes y tener mejores condiciones de vivienda.
texts.en:
Ángela is 33 years old. She went to school up to the 8th grade. She is married and her spouse is a sales manager. She has two children and only one is in school.  

She has had a store for a year. She learned he business through her husband, who has experience in sales and her store is in her house. She will invest the loan in improving her store and her house. It will improve her life because she will have more income from the store. 

Her plans for the future are for her store to grow, to attract more customers, and to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to improve her store and her house.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer de 45 años de edad casada, madre de un hijo y su negocio es el comercio de cd’s en blanco.
Ella es una mujer de carácter fuerte, luchadora y emprendedora, su negocio lo realiza de lunes a sábado durante todo el día en la populosa zona ’16 de Julio’ (El Alto) situada al oeste de Bolivia, en la meseta altiplánica a una altura de cuatro mil metros sobre el nivel del mar, lo que la hace una de las ciudades más altas del mundo.
Virginia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, su rutina diaria comienza muy temprano por la mañana, cuando se dirige a un depósito dónde guarda su mercadería y recoge sus cajas para transportarlas hasta su puesto de venta y acomodarlas para que se vean a la venta, esta labora la realiza junto a su hijo que la acompaña y se encarga del transporte para dejar a su madre con todo listo y luego continuar con sus estudios.
El sueño de Virginia es ver a su hijo profesional, ella quiere que su hijo estudie y logré terminar su carrera, para que él tenga un futuro mejor, ella lo ayuda con los gastos universitarios y es por eso que busca la manera de incrementar sus ingresos ampliando el stock de su negocio.
Es por esos motivos que Virginia solicita un préstamo para la ampliación de su stock y con los beneficios ayudar a su hijo a terminar la universidad.
texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of one son. Her business is selling blank CDs. She is a woman of strong character who is enterprising and a fighter. She works at her business Monday through Saturday all day long in the populated area of  ’16 de Julio’ (El Alto), located in western Bolivia in the high plateau, four thousand feet above sea level, making it one of the highest cities in the world.  

Virginia has dark skin, long black hair, and medium height. Her daily routine starts very early in the morning when she goes to the warehouse where she keeps her merchandise. She picks up her boxes to transport them to her sales spot and arrange them to be seen for sale. She does this work with her son who accompanies her. He is in charge of the transportation and he leaves his mother with everything ready and then he goes to his classes.  

Virginia's dream is to see her son graduate from college. She wants hi to go to school and finish his major so that he can have a better future. She helps him with his college expenses and that is why she seeks a way to increase her income, expanding her business' inventory.   

That is why Virginia is asking for a loan to increase her inventory and with the profits help her son finish college.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and with the profits help her son finish college.

loans.name: Soro

texts.ru: Соро ответственная мать 5 детей. Она родилась в 1952 году. Она вдова и сама воспитывает своих детей. Соро занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Она в основном выращивает овощи. Она имеет 1 га земли. Ее дети помогают ей введению бизнеса. Соро и ее дети живут бедно, так как земледелие является основным источником семейного дохода. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки семена и минерального удобрения, так как она должна сделать второй посев. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Soro is a responsible mother of 5 children. She was born in 1952. She is a widow and is raising her children by herself. Soro practices crop farming. She primarily grows vegetables. She has 1 hectare of land. Her children help her run her business. Soro and her children live in poverty, as crop farming is their primary source of income for the family budget. She is requesting a loan for 4000 somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers as she needs to do a second sowing. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El señor David, viven en Cochabamba provincia chapare,  tienen 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, económicamente es independiente, su principal actividad es la agricultura cultiva los productos de papa y papaliza, siembra en una superficie  de 3 hectáreas herencia de su padres. Para la venta de sus productos agrícolas cuenta con un mercado consolidado, ahora requiere un crédito para la compra de ganado vacuno de engorde y semilla de papa, porque sus ahorros lo invirtió en la compra de abono orgánico y otro insumos agrícolas. De esta forma podrá mejorar su trabajo y tendrá un mayor ingreso para mejorar su nivel de vida en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en: David lives in Cochabamba, Chapare province. He is 20 years old and single. Financially, he is independent. His main activity is agriculture. He grows potatoes and ullucus. He grows in an area of 3 hectares that he inherited from his parents. To sell his farm products he uses a consolidated market. Right now, he needs a loan to buy cattle to fatten up, as well as potato seeds. He invested his savings in buying organic fertilizer and other agricultural materials. This way, he can improve his work and have more income to improve his quality of life to benefit his family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, and potato seeds to grow organically, on his smallholder land

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 42 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She sells household goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Merlita has borrowed and paid for five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been selling goods for two years and also earns income from a general store.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Hello, wonderful lenders! Meet Jeremiah, a young, hardworking and full of energy man who is only 29 years of age. He hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya, an area that was blessed with good rainfall and weather patterns that favor crop and dairy farming. Jeremiah has been doing farming for the past seven years, and through those years, he has gathered so much experience. Through the profits he has been getting, he has been able to earn a decent income.

Jeremiah loves dairy farming a lot, and he has even nicknamed his dairy cow “Kamwana,” which means "my baby," and that’s what the cow means to him.
 
Although Jeremiah has been making profits, he has been experiencing challenges of crop diseases; that is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy pesticides. Through the loan, Jeremiah is sure that he will have a bumper harvest, and the profits from selling the farm produce will permanently change his life, and he will be able to secure the future of his child.

Jeremiah intends to not only increase his farming, but also through the loan, he will be able to buy more land and start practicing large-scale farming

loans.use: To buy pesticides

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es: Doña Blanca de 46 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos, vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos en una aldea del municipio del Progreso, Yoro. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Hace 14 años decidió por hacer viveros de arboles frutales, actualmente tiene vivero de aguacate injerto ya que tiene mucha demanda. Ha obtenido varios prestamos en la institución para  mantener esta actividad, actualmente solicita otro de 5,000 lempiras para comprar abonos, formula y otros insumos para el vivero y hacer injertos. Su propósito es ampliar el negocio para poder mejorar su vivienda con las ganancias.
texts.en: Blanca is 46 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives with her husband and two children in a town in the town of Progreso, Yoro. She has always been a merchant. Fourteen years ago, she decided to have a nursery for fruit trees. Right now, she has an avocado grafting greenhouse, because there is a lot of demand. She has obtained several loans in the institution to maintain this activity. Right now, she is asking for another 5,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer, formula and other materials for the nursery and to do grafting. Her goal is to expand her business and improve her home with the profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, formula and other materials for her nursery and to do grafting.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагуль 57 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Айнагуль - среднее образование, работает мед сестрой в местной больнице, так же в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Айнагуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова с теленком, а также 1,45 ГА земельного надела, где Айнагуль в основном выращивает многолетние травы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, а также необходимости срочного сбора урожая, Айнагуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на оплату услуг трактора, тюкование и перевозку сена, на остальные средства Айнагуль планирует приобрести теленка. Доходы от кредита Айнагуль хочет вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Ainagul is 57 years old, married and the mother to 5 children.  Ainagul has a secondary education. She works as a nurse in a local hospital. As an additional source of income for her family, she practices crop farming and livestock breeding. She started this business 10 years ago. Thanks to Ainagul's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow and a calf on her farm, as well as a 1.45 hectare plot of land on which she primarily grows perennial grasses. Her average monthly income is 6,500 som (KGS). For the further development of her farm, and for the necessity of the imminent harvest gathering, Ainagul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 25,000 som (KGS) to pay for tractor services, baling and hay transportation. Ainagul plans to use the remaining funds to buy a calf. Ainagul wants to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to repair her house.

loans.use: to pay for tractor services, baling and hay transportation.

loans.name: Estrella Marie

texts.en:
Estrella Marie has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her doormat business. She has also been operating her own direct selling business for years, and she earns well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She has to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide her child with a better education.

*Estrella Marie appears here in a photo at her doormat business.

To improve her profit, Estrella Marie would like to apply for a new loan. With 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), she could already purchase more quantities of items and products needed for her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Estrella Marie hopes to grow her business as well as improve the living conditions of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more items needed in her direct selling business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 50 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Lydia has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Bonnabil

texts.en:
Bonnabil is 32 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming ginger in the Philippines. Bonnabil is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase ginger seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Bonnabil has been farming ginger for five years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ginger seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rigina

texts.ru: Ригине 21 год, не замужем, детей нет. У Ригины - среднее образование, в данное время работает парикмахером в салоне красоты, живет с родителями. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Ригина занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 3 года назад, благодаря упорному труду Ригины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 10 овец, 1 лошадь с жеребенком. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ригина обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы, теленка, сена для скота, а также часть кредита, а именно 15,000 сом (KGS) будет направлена на ремонт сарая. Доходы от кредита Ригина планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины. Также Ригина мечтает накопить средства на свою свадьбу и открыть собственный салон красоты.
texts.en: Rigina is 21 years old, single and does not have any children. Rigina has a second education. She currently works as a hairstylist in a beauty salon. She lives with her parents. In the search for an additional source of income for her family, Rigina practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 3 years ago. Thanks to Rigina's hard work, she currently has 3 dairy cows, 1 calf, 10 sheep, and 1 horse with a foal. Her average monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, Regina turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow, calf, and hay for the cattle. A portion of the loan, specifically 15,000 som (KGS) will be put toward renovating her barn. Rigina plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. Rigina also dreams of saving money for her wedding and to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy a cow, a calf, and hay for the cattle.

loans.name: Dolores Guadalupe

texts.es:
Dolores tiene 28 años de edad, solo estudió primer grado, ella es madre soltera de dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 2 años los cuales están estudiando y son los únicos que dependen de ella.


Dolores se dedica a la venta de tortillas, y tiene que  movilizarse desde su hogar  a un puesto de la ciudad, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 10 años,  el trabajo lo aprendió de su madre  que también se dedicaba a este rubro.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar maíz y leña para la elaboración de tortillas, de esta forma podrá seguir adelante con su negocio y cubrir los gastos del hogar.



Su sueño es que el negocio crezca y le genere mejores ingresos para darle una mejor calidad de vida  a sus hijos, que ellos puedan estudiar y en un futuro sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Dolores is 28 years old. She only finished the first grade. She is a single mother of two children, ages 8 and 2, who are in school. She has no other dependents.

Dolores has a stand in the city where she sells tortillas. She has made a living this way for 10 years. She learned the business from her mother, who also sold tortillas.

She needs the loan to buy corn and firewood for making tortillas so she can keep up her business and cover her household expenses.

Her dream is to see her business grow and earn greater profits so she can offer her children a better quality of life, and for her children to complete their studies and have good careers in the future.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for making tortillas so she can keep up her business and cover her household expenses.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Зухре 34 года, не замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Семья очень сплоченная и дружная. Образование-среднее. С 2006 года Зухра занимается торговлей товаров широкого назначения. У нее очень широкий ассортимент продукции, от продуктов питания до одежды и предметов интерьера. Всю продукцию Зухра приобретает на крупных рынках страны и перепродает в своем магазине местным жителям.  Благодаря упорному труду и терпеливому характеру Зухры, на сегодняшний день она имеет прибыль в размере до 28,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях расширения товарооборота и разнообразия ассортимента в магазине, Зухра обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 38,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от кредита Зухра планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, а также на будущее обучение детей в университете.
texts.en: Zuhra is 34 years old, unmarried and is raising 3 children. Her family is very united and close-knit. She has a secondary education. Since 2006, Zuhra has been in the multi-variety retail business. She has a wide assortment of products, from groceries to clothing to home goods. All of Zuhra's merchandise is bought at the biggest markets in the country and resold in her store to local residents. Thanks to Zuhra's hard work and patient character, she currently make a profit of up to 28,000 som (KGS) per month. For the expansion of her sales turnover and variety of assortment in her store, Zuhra turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 38,000 som (KGS). Zuhra plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her business. She also wants to save for the future university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy products for retail sale in her shop in order to increase her variety of assortment and be more competitive.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
El señor Arnaldo tiene 34 años de edad, está casado, tiene dos hijos varones, ambos están estudiando,  comenta que es macatero, es decir  vendedor ambulante, se dedica a la compra y venta de todo tipo de electrodomésticos, ropas, calzados y muebles para el hogar. Posee buena cantidad de productos, además tiene una clientela bien formada. Sus ventas lo realiza al contado y a crédito.
Pide este préstamo para poder seguir teniendo productos variados para la venta, como ropas, calzados y muebles para el hogar, ya que de esa forma seguirá luchando por su familia,
texts.en:
Arnaldo, age 34, is married and has two sons.  Both of them go to school.  He states that he is a street vendor.  He buys and sells all types of domestic appliances, clothes, shoes, and household furniture.  He has a good quantity of production.  He also has a well-established clientele.  He makes his sales for cash and on credit.

He is requesting this loan to be able to continue having varied products such as clothes, shoes and household furniture to sell.  This way he will continue struggling for his family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and household furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products to stock the store and thus make more income.

loans.name: Virgen De Los Dolores Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de los Dolores; está en su ciclo número 4, cada una de las 22 integrantes está luchando por poder salir adelante e ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.  
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Antonia, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día. Ella quiere poder ir ampliando poco a poco su local para poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes un buen servicio como lo viene haciendo. Esta luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, huevo, verduras, pan, gaseosas, entre otros, para poder continuar con sus ventas, y ofreciendo a sus clientes la variedad a la que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
The Virgen de los Dolores group is in its fourth cycle.  Each one of the 22 members is struggling to be able to get ahead and improve their living conditions and those of their families.

Antonia is one of the members.  She has a well-stocked store in which she works every day starting in the very early hours of the day.  She wants to be able to expand her place little by little in order to be able to continue offering her customers the good service she has been providing.  She is struggling to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy meat, eggs, vegetables, bread, and soft drinks, among others.  She will do this to be able to continue with her sales and to continue offering her customers the variety to which they are accustomed.

loans.use: to buy meat, eggs, vegetables, bread, and soft drinks, among others.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
Alba está estudiando la carrera de Ciencias de la Educación, ella es madre soltera de dos hijos, por quienes esta luchando para poder crecer y mejorar.
Sus metas son la de trabajar y ser una profesional  preparada que pueda ayudar a las demás personas por medio de sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar los gastos de su tesis, ya que de esa forma podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Alba is studying for a degree in education sciences.  She is the single mother of two children for whom she is struggling to be able to grow and improve.

Her goals are to work and to be a well-prepared profession who is able to help other people through her knowledge.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay for her thesis expenses.  This way she will be able to cover this expense that she has.

loans.use: to pay for her thesis expenses.

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es:
María es una mujer muy emprendedora con más de 30 años de experiencia en el mundo de las confecciones trabaja junto con sus dos hermanas sosteniendo la familia y apoyándolas en crecer y obtener recursos para subsistir, madre de 2 hijos ya mayores de edad. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de tela en grandes cantidades para iniciar su propia línea de ropa y no depender de lo que tenga las otras campañas para confeccionar.

Su sueño es poder crecer cada día más y tener un negocio con mayor número de empleados y una exitosa línea que se distribuya en todo el país
texts.en: Maria is a very enterprising woman with more than 30 years of experience in the world of sewing. She works together with her two sisters supporting her family and helping them to grow and obtain resources. She is the mother of 2 children who are already adults. She is requesting a loan to buy fabric in great quantities in order to start her own line of clothing and not be limited by what other fashion lines have to offer in a given season. Her dream is to be able to grow day by day, have a business with more employees and a successful line of clothing that can be distributed in the whole country.

loans.use: To buy fabric to start her own line of clothing.

loans.name: Narsulu

texts.ru: Нарсулу 57 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Нарсулу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, благодаря упорному труду Нарсулу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, а также земельный надел мерою 1,10 ГА, где она выращивает экологически чистые помидоры и кукурузу с дальнейшей реализацией местным жителям. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Супруг и младший сын активно помогают по хозяйству. Накопленные средства стараются вкладывать в развитие и расширение бизнеса. Так как обе коровы Нарсулу вскоре отелятся, ей необходимо в срочном порядке построить большой сарай для скота. Поэтому Нарсулу и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку шифера, кирпичей, железа. Когда коровы отелятся, Нарсулу будет продавать молоко и молоко содержащие продукты местным жителям. Таким образом, она увеличит доходы от ее экологичного бизнеса и направит прибыль на покупку земельного участка для своего сына под строительство дома.
texts.en: Narsulu is 57 years old, married and together with her husband, is raising 5 children. Narsulu has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practice livestock breeding and crop farming. Thanks to Narsulu's hard work, she currently has 2 cows on her farm, as well as a 1.10 hectare plot of land on which she grows eco-friendly tomatoes and corn for future sale to local residents. Her average monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). Her husband and her youngest son actively help her with her farm. They try to save money to use for the development and expansion of the business. As both of Narsulu's cows will soon give birth, she needs to quickly build a large barn for her cattle. This is why Narsulu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." for a 50,000 loan to buy slate, bricks and iron. When the cows give birth, Narsulu will sell milk and dairy products to local residents. In this way, she will increase her earnings from this "green" business and put her profits towards buying a plot of land for her son to build a house on.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to construct a barn for her cattle.

loans.name: Ibrahim Dan'asabe

texts.en: Ibrahim Dan'Asabe is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ibrahim Dan'Asabe joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Shedrak, Nasara,  and  Hikima. Ibrahim Dan'Asabe is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ibrahim Dan'Asabe will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would  be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ibrahim Dan'Asabe can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Ibrahim Dan'Asabe said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Ibrahim Dan'Asabe is not thinking about just this year; he said, “in 5 years, I want to become the  most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Mamman Zaka

texts.en: Mamman Zaka is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Mamman Zaka joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her  children: Zakka, Yusuf, and  Hajara.. Mamman Zaka is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Mamman Zaka will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Mamman Zaka can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, her said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Mamman Zaka is not thinking about this year alone; she expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Uwani

texts.en: Uwani remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Uwani, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Uwani  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Uwani   With this loan, Uwani is well on her way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en: Mathew is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Mathew joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Deborah, Helen and Ruben. Mathew is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Mathew will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Mathew can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Mathew said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Mathew is not thinking about just this.  In 5 years, he wants to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es:
Cindy trabaja en una empresa en la parte de administración, vive con sus padres y hermanos.
Estudia la carrera de Contabilidad y dice que sus metas futuras son la de  recibirse y trabajar por su cuenta,seguir estudiando  para obtener mejores ingresos  para   ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de universidad, y también para poder comprar libros y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Cindy works in administration for a company.  She lives with her parents and siblings.  She is studying for an accounting degree.  She says that her goals for the future are to graduate and work independently and to continue studying in order to get better income to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to make her university payments.  She will also be able to buy books.  This way she will be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to make her university payments and to buy books.

loans.name: Zacharia

texts.en: Zacharia is a 20 year old farmer from Bako. As a Babban Gona member, Zacharia, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Zacharia can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Zacharia is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Zacharia said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland, in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, Zacharia is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Agashakaliyamman Shg - Thiruvalampolil Group

texts.en:
The Agashakaliyamman Self-Help Group is managed by the local NGO, People’s Action for Transformation (PAT). The group consists of six industrious women who have been receiving loans from PAT for the last two years. These loans have been extremely helpful in shaping their livelihood and helping them to earn more.
 
Thiruvalampolil is a village in the Trichy district of Tamil Nadu, India. Periyakka (sitting, hand raised) is the leader of the Agashakaliyamman Self-Help Group. She lives with her husband and has three children. Her spouse is a mason by profession and her children are studying in school.
 
Like all the group members, she is seeking a loan to purchase a smokeless stove manufactured by Grameen Infra. These stoves would result in long-term savings because they require less spending on fuel and would be less hazardous to their health because they emit less smoke.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Omsakthi Self Help Group - Parukkal

texts.en:
Manjula is 38 years old, and she is the leader of the Omsakthi Self-Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu. Manjula lives in Parukkal village, Ariyalur district with her children and husband in her own house. Her husband is a farmer who works on a daily wage basis.
 
Manjula needs a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which is efficient, clean, and easy for daily use for cooking. The traditional stove leads to environmental hazards such as deforestation. A smokeless stove also reduces the risk of respiratory illness as it emits much less smoke. 

Other members of the group are also requesting loans to purchase smokeless stoves.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: G.s Jesus Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es:
La señora Bilma es un persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio que es venta de abarrotería en general desde hace 24 años, esto lo realiza en su casa de habitación sus principales clientes son personas que viven en la comunidad.
Doña Bilma su negocio está ubicado en un punto estratégico donde transitan muchas personas, vende todos los días de la semana y se levanta muy temprano para atender este negocio, también se dedica a la venta de charamuscas y solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas producto como azúcar, café, manteca, arroz, refrescos, aguas, frijoles, pan, mantequilla, leche, huevos, etc. y así surtir mas su negocio.
Doña Bilma está solicitando el préstamo en grupo y al igual que sus compañeras esperan que esta inversión les sea de mucha ayuda y les genere los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con sus negocios y poder seguir apoyando a sus familias e hijos. 
Sandra se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general desde hace 1 año.
Kenia se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa de segunda desde hace 2 años.


Danlí, Honduras - Julio 2014
texts.en:
Bilma is a hardworking person who has been selling groceries out of her home for 24 years. Most of her customers are other people who live in her community.
Bilma's business is located in a strategic spot that gets a lot of foot traffic. She works seven days a week and gets up very early to open her business. She also sells kindling. She is requesting this loan so she can buy sugar, coffee, lard, rice, soft drinks, bottled water, beans, bread, butter, milk, eggs, and other products to stock her business.
Bilma's loan is part of a group loan. All the other group members hope that this investment will aid them greatly in earning enough to keep building their businesses and supporting their families.
Sandra has been selling groceries for one year. Kenia has been selling secondhand shoes and clothing for two years. 

Danlí, Honduras - July 2014

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, lard, rice, soft drinks, bottled water, beans, bread, butter, milk, eggs, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.pt:
O Sr. Patricio de 27 anos de idade casado e pai de um filho que esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primario. Ele è funcionario do Ministerio de Saude a mais de 5 anos junto com a sua esposa.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (pedra, area, cimento, barratos e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
