No futuro pretende terminar com a construcao da sua casa e terminar com a formacao na area de administracao hospitalar para abrir uma clinica e tem como desafio fechar o credito em tempo recorde para possuir mais financiamento na Hluvuku-Adsema.
texts.en:
Mr. Patricio is 27 years old, married and the father of one son who goes to primary school. He has worked at the Ministry of Health along with his wife for more than 5 years.

With this loan he will buy construction material (stone, sand, cement, beams) and pay for labour to continue the building work on his house.

In future he plans to finish building his home, complete his studies in hospital administration and open a clinic. His challenge is to pay back the loan in record time so he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku-Adsema.

loans.use: buy construction material (stone, sand, cement, beams) and pay for labour to continue the building work on his house

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
A Sra. Maria de 39 anos de idade solteira e mãe de 4 filho todos estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primário e secundário. Ela é trabalha no governo exercendo as funções de auxiliar a mais de 9 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção (cimento, janelas, porta e pedra) para terminar com a construção da sua casa, que constitui a prioridade.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old. She is unmarried and has four children, all of whom are in primary and secondary school. She has been a civil servant for more than nine years.
She will use this loan to buy construction materials (cement, windows, doors, and stone) to finish building her house, which is her priority.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, windows, doors, and stone) to finish building her house.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.pt:
O Sr. Orlando de 31 anos de idade casado e  pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primário e secundário e 1 e menor de idade para frequentar a escola. Ele é trabalhador da empresa de produção de banana com cargo profissional de Tractorista a mais de 5 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, area, pedra e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Orlando is 31 years old, married and the father of 3 children, 2 of whom go to primary and secondary school and 1 who's still too young to go to school. He has worked at the banana production company as a professional tractor driver for more than 5 years.

With this loan he will buy construction material (bricks, cement, sand, stone) and pay for labour to continue building his house.

loans.use: buy construction material (bricks, cement, sand, stone) and pay for labour to continue building his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy yarn in greater volume and to buy construction materials to raise a wall at her house.

loans.name: Rhada Yohanna Tambaya

texts.en: Rhada Yohanna  is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Rhada Yohanna Tambaya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children Sirous, Happy and Iliya. Rhada Yohanna Tambaya is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Rhada Yohanna Tambaya will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Rhada Yohanna Tambaya can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Rhada Yohanna Tambaya said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Rhada Yohanna Tambaya is not thinking about just this year. In 5 years, she  wants to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Sarathi

texts.en:
Sarathi is a very young woman of 23 years.  She is married and a housewife, who lives in the remote village Khagrabari in the district of Jalpaiguri. She has a fundamental education, having studied until grade 8. She is the mother of a toddler.

For the last few years, Sarathi's husband, Monoranjan, age 28, has been in a business of making houses.  He is a mason by profession. His primary customers are local people who want to build their houses. He is hardworking, ambitious and determined to establish himself in this business as he is the main breadwinner for the family. Sarathi helps her husband in his work. Sarathi's biggest challenge is the high cost of products, which makes it difficult to expand the business.

Sarathi came to know from her neighbors that Kiva’s partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) gives out business loans, so she took a loan from them to help her husband grow the business. She will purchase additional stock of materials used in her husband's business, such as trowels, hammers, chisels, big cauldrons for mixing up raw materials, etc. She hopes this will enable her to generate more income to support the family financially. She wants to get ahead with the business for a secure future and to give good education to her children.

She gives her hearty thanks to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase necessary tools for their masonry business.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 53 years old and married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Herminia has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 31,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle for transport.

Herminia has been in this business for 27 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle for transport.

loans.name: Maniyammai Self Help Group - Parukkal

texts.en:
Sangeetha is a member of the Maniyammai Self-Help Group, which is formed by local NGO, People's Action for Transformation (PAT), in Tamil Nadu, India. 

Sangeetha lives in Parukkal village in her own house with her two children and husband. Sangeetha’s husband is a farmer and he works on daily wages. Sangeetha has repaid all her previous loans on time.

Sangeetha, like the other members of the group, needs a loan to purchase a smokeless stove manufactured by the Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt Ltd. The price of the smokeless stove is 1,400 INR. 

Traditional stoves are like killers in the kitchen. They produce a lot of smoke, causing health issues. The smokeless stove evacuates all smoke without decreasing thermal efficiency and without employing external power. It consumes less wood, leaves a smokeless room, saves time and labor, reduces carbon emissions and decreases respiratory disease of the residents.

They all hope to have healthier families.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Romila

texts.en:
Romila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell ginger business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy ginger to sell for her buy and sell ginger business.

Romila has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from ambulant vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ginger to sell for her business

loans.name: Dhanam Self-Help Group - Manavalanallur

texts.en:
Jothi is 45 years old and resides in Manavalanallur, a small village in Tamil Nadu, India. She has two children.
  
Jothi is the leader of the Dhanam Self-Help Group (SHG). The group consists of seven members.

Jothi, like the other members of her group, is requesting a loan to purchase a Greenway smart smokeless stove. The stove is a single burner, highly-efficient cook-stove designed for long-term, everyday use. The stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel including wood, cow dung and agricultural waste. It also produces 70% less smoke while using 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook-stoves. 

Jothi and her group have the opportunity to save time and cut a recurring fuel expense all while being able to cook in a healthier environment. This stove has also been tested and certified by the Ministry of New & Renewable Energy (MNRE), Government of India.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Ibrahim, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ibrahim  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty” expressed Ibrahim   With this loan, Ibrahim is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Joayu Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Kuña Aty Joayu está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo dentro del grupo.
La Sra. Isabel es una de ellas, tiene un copetín donde vende todo tipo de productos como ser comestibles, jugos, golosinas y demás, por medio de su trabajo lucha para poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones. Solicita  este préstamo para la compra de golosinas, jugos y comestibles, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Kuña Aty Joayu group is in its first cycle with the women’s committee program.  All of them are working and helping each other get ahead through their effort and continuous work within the group.

Isabel is a member.  She has a snack bar where she sells all types of products like food, games, candy, and the rest.  Through her work she struggles to be able to give her family what it needs in order to have a life without deprivations.

She is requesting this loan to buy candy, games, and food.  This way she will be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy candy, games, and food.

loans.name: Ninzole

texts.en:
Ninzole is a married woman with two kids, both of whom are too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Ninzole operates a grocery vegetables selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is 40. She is married to Sanatan, who is a 41-year-old farmer. Together they are raising two sons. Sabita is illiterate, but she can sign her name. Her husband has a primary education. 

They live in Mouyamari, a small village of Jalpaiguri. Her two minor children, one of whom is in grade 9 and the other too young for school, have motivated Sabita to strive harder to make a living. So she is also engaged in agricultural activities with her husband. They work hard in agricultural pursuits: growing potatoes, beans, gourds and eggplants.

They work hard together in the field. With the profits obtained from their farming, they managed to build their modest little house. It is made of earth and planks, but in the future, she plans to build it of concrete. First, they will harvest the land, continuing to save up other earnings little by little to manage to cover one part. Later, with another loan, they will complete the improvements.

For now, the need that has arisen is the maintenance of the vegetables and to cultivate another crop that is jute. It is a profitable crop in West Bengal.  Rainy season is the perfect season for cultivation of this crop.

So Sabita is requesting this loan from BJS to buy jute seeds, fertilizers, chemicals, and herbicides. They want to start cultivation as early as possible and take advantage of the rainy weather to obtain a good harvest with all the care and management possible to achieve their intended future earnings.

Sabita dreams of seeing their sons get proper education and become successful. She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs to grow jute.

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti is 39 years old and from Maynaguri. She is married, and together with her husband, Ratan, 44 years, is rearing their only son. Shanti has a primary education and her husband is illiterate. He can sign his name only. Due to poverty, they could not provide education to their only son, who is now grown up and is a cycle-rickshaw puller by profession. 

Shanti is a homemaker. Her husband operates a business where he sells clothing, specially ladies' garments (sarees, frocks, etc.).  He purchases clothing from wholesale markets and sells them in the market. He is a hardworking entrepreneur who is very focused. He sells his goods to the local market and to neighbours. He has fine taste and he selects goods that are in high demand. His effectiveness helps him to be successful in the business. Shanti also actively helps her husband to sell the goods to her neighbors. Despite all his advantages, there is intense competition in the business world, which forces him to be careful and change his goods in every season.

Now they need to purchase goods for the new season, and for this Shanti is seeking the loan from BJS, a partner of Kiva. She hopes the new inventory in their stock will enable her to cover all the necessary household expenses and to get over the financial hurdles.

She wants to enhance her business with the profits and she will be ever grateful to her lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for their existing business.

loans.name: Selca

texts.en:
Selca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a hardware business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of hardware to sell to customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Selca's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of hardware

loans.name: Olga Marleny

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Olga es que ahora su hogar podrá tener unos ingresos extra.
Ella prepara y vende comidas como empanadas y churros en el municipio de Rionegro, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Su esposo e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.
Ella espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra del carrito de comidas con el que trabaja ya que este es prestado, adicionalmente comprara insumos y materia prima para continuar con su trabajo.

Con este préstamo estará impactando la vida de una mujer luchadora y muy amante de sus hijos.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en: Thanks to the perseverance and courage of  Olga her house now has some extra income. She prepares and sells meals like empanadas and churros in the Municipality of Rionegro. She started this activity in her eagerness to find new income to sustain her family. Her husband and her children are her main motivation to work daily and make an effort to be better every day. She hopes to give a boost to her business by buying a food cart as the one she works with is borrowed. also she will buy supplies and raw materials to continue with her work. This loan will impact the life of this fighter who loves her children so. Her dream is to have a restaurant in the same area so as not to lose her clients.

loans.use: to buy a cart for her food and buy work supplies.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Samaila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: . Samaila is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Samaila will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Samaila can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Samaila is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra, who hails from Maynaguri, is a rural woman of 34 years. She is married and blessed with one son and one daughter. She is married to Renu, who is 41 years old and has a primary education. Sumitra studied only up to grade 3 due to the poor economic resources of her parents. They live in a small village of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district in their own kachha house (made of straw mud and wood). Both of their children attend school.

Sumitra's husband is a cultivator who tills his small plot of land and grows seasonable vegetables. They find it hard to depend on his income, as it depends on the demand of the customers. So to earn an additional income, Sumitra has been engaged in selling milk to her neighbors for years. Now to develop her business she wants to purchase a dairy cow to rear and sell milk. She thinks it will earn more profit as cow milk has a great demand in her locality. She runs the household efficiently and manages to save a small amount each week.

Now she is seeking the loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase the cow so that she can develop her milk-selling business. Her main clients will be her neighbors. Buying a cow will increase their financial security in the long run by giving them an asset they can sell during hard times. Her main challenge is to provide her children with proper education, which she hopes will be possible through this loan.

She gives her heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Mitya

texts.en:
Mitya is a hardworking woman from Maynaguri. She is 44 years old, married and has one daughter who is currently in college, perusing her degree courses. She is married to Sajal and both are Arts graduates. They live in the small village Bongkandi in Jalpaiguri district.

Mitya’s husband works as a drinking water distributor, and his income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

He purifies water and sells it. They have installed a water purifier machine in their house. They collect water from local taps and, after purification, the water is bottled and sold to his customers with a profit. Since there is a scarcity of pure drinking water in the area, it is a profitable business. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.

Mitya is taking out a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) as assistance to improve her husband's profit and revenue. She will be using the loan to buy more stocks of bottles and other necessary things to expand their business. She expects a boost in her business income through this loan, which will in turn improve her family's living conditions.

She dreams of a better future for her children and an expanded business to serve more customers. She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase bottles and other necessary things for their water supply business.

loans.name: Bethel

texts.en:
Bethel is from Misamis Occidental. She is married and has been helping her husband working in their own farm for a living. She also raises pigs for sale and she earns additional income from that.  

She has been operating a cafeteria in their village for more than a year. This year,  Bethel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and it helped improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Recently, she took a new loan to buy raw ingredients to prepare food to sell. She wants to have a better living in the near future with her family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Isiyaku Maza

texts.en: Isiyaku Maza is a Babban Gona farmer from Bazai. Isiyaku Maza is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Isiyaku Maza to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Isiyaku Maza can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Isiyaku Maza is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Isiyaku Maza is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family.  Ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Isiyaku Maza will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield,

loans.name: Ernita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ernita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. 

Ernita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Ernita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maikudi

texts.en: Maikudi remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Maikudi, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Maikudi  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Maikudi   With this loan, Maikudi is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замире 49 лет, замужем, есть сын. У Замиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки 10 овец. Благодаря упорному труду Замиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 лошадь, 4 коровы, 4 телят, 20 овец, 15 коз. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Замира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма и реализации. Замира является лидером группы "Замира", в которой кроме нее состоят еще два человека. Доходы от кредита Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Zamira is 49 years old, married and has a son. Zamira has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 10 years ago with a purchase of 10 sheep. Thanks to Zamira's hard work, she currently has 1 horse, 4 cows, 4 calves, 20 sheep and 15 goats on her farm. For the further development of her farm, Zamira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 40,000 som (KGS) to buy calves to fatten up and resell. Zamira is a leader of the group "Zamira," in which there are two other members. Zamira plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also wants to save money for make repairs on her house.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en: Sani remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Sani, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Sani  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Sani   With this loan, Sani is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos  es casado y tiene 1 hijo Carlos vive en la comunidad de Isla Suriqui en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a sus suegros Carlos es pescador y se concentra en atrapar pejerrey y carachi en la región de Huatajata Carlos se sacrifica pescando desde las dos de la madrugada y necesita un credito para  la adquisición de un motor y redes de pesca para su actividad Carlos es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar
texts.en:
Carlos is married and has one son.  Carlos lives in the Isla Suriqui community.  He lives in his mother and father-in-laws’ brick and cement house.  

Carlos is a fisherman, and he concentrates on fishing for 'pejerrey' and 'carachi' [types of fish] in the Huatajata area.  Carlos is selfless as he starts fishing at two in the morning.

He needs a loan to get a motor and fishing nets for his business activity.  Carlos is the only source of income in his household.

loans.use: to get a motor and fishing nets.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Victor es casado y tiene dos hijos Victor vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Victor se gana la vida como transportista publico y  su esposa vende quinua Victor tiene molestias en la columna por estar sentado todo el dia  pero necesita un prestamo para hacer mantenimiento general de su vehiculo Victor y su esposa tienen muchos gastos con respecto a sus hijos por eso requieren su ayuda
texts.en:
Victor is married and has two children.  Victor lives in El Alto in a brick and cement house that is his property.  Victor earns a living as a driver in public transportation.  His wife sells quinoa.  

Victor has problems with his spine from being seated all day.  However, he needs a loan to perform general maintenance on his vehicle.  Victor and his wife have a lot of expenses from the children, and that is why they need your help.

loans.use: to perform general maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Kumushai

texts.ru: Кумушай, 55 лет, замужем, есть дочь. С 1997 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 2,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и целеустремленности Кумушай, она достигла хороших результатов и на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется: 2 коровы, 1 теленок, 20 овец. Дети помогают по хозяйству. Семья очень трудолюбивая и дружная. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях увеличения поголовья скота Кумушай обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку ягнят. Кумушай является членом группы "Замира", в которой кроме нее состоят еще два человека. На доходы от кредита Кумушай планирует и дальше развивать свое хозяйство.
texts.en: Kumushai is 55 years old, married and has a daughter. Since 1997, she has been practicing livestock breeding. She started this business with 2,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kumushai's hard work and determination, she achieved great results and currently has 2 cows, 1 calf and 20 sheep on her farm. Her daughter helps her with her farm. Her family is very hardworking and close-knit. Her average monthly income is 8,000 som (KGS). In order to increase the size of her herd, Kumushai turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy lambs. Kumushai is a member of the group "Zamira," in which there are two other members. Kumushai plans to use the earnings from the loan to further develop her farm.

loans.use: to buy lambs.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 35 años de edad soltero, padre de un hijo y se dedica al servicio de fotografía, filmación y sonido de eventos sociales.
Él es una persona responsable, puntual, detallista, atento, trabajador y muy cariñoso con su hijo, su oficina está ubicada en la zona de ‘Villa Fátima’ de la ciudad de La Paz, este lugar se caracteriza por las estaciones informales de buses con salidas interdepartamentales a: los yungas, Beni y Pando.
Miguel es de tez morena, cabello rapado y estatura mediana, sus días laborales son más frecuentes los fines de semana, cuando existen todo tipo de acontecimientos sociales como; bodas, fiestas de quince años, cumpleaños infantiles, etc. En su trabajo él utiliza todo tipo de equipos digitales para la captura y edición de imágenes y sonido como; cámara fotográfica, cámara de video, micrófonos, luces, etc.
Miguel no tiene todos los equipos que necesita para trabajar, por lo que subalquila gran parte de ellos reduciendo así sus beneficios económicos, el desea invertir en la compra de dos parlantes para su actividad de sonido. Su sueño es tener una empresa de eventos y realizar grandes acontecimientos.
Es por esos motivos que Miguel solicita un préstamo para la compra de dos parlantes de sonido y con los beneficios pagar los gastos de su hijo.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 35 year old, single man who is the father of one child. He works in photography, filming and making sound tracks at social events. He is a responsible person, punctual, attentive, meticulous, hard-working and very caring for his son. His office is located in the ‘Villa Fátima’ area of the city of La Paz. This area is known for the informal bus stations that go to other departments like Los Yungas, Beni and Pando.

Miguel is dark-skinned, close-cropped hair and medium stature. His working days are most usually on week-ends when all types of social events are held: weddings, fifteenth birthdays, children's birthday parties, etc. In his work he uses all types of digital equipment to capture and edit the images and sound like cameras, video, microphones, lights etc.

Miguel does not have all the equipment he needs for this work so he has to rent a good part of them which reduces his economic gains. He wants to invest in the purchase of two sound speakers for his sound work. His dream is to have an events business and undertake large events. For these reasons Miguel is requesting a loan to buy two speakers and with the benefits he can pay the expenses of his son.

loans.use: to buy two  sound speakers and with the profits pay for his son's expenses.

loans.name: La'azarus

texts.en: La'azarus is a 27-year-old farmer from Bako.  As a Babban Gona member, La'azarus is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, La'azarus can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, La'azarus is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, La'azarus said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Zion and Ketra, and in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Sololá se caracteriza ser una ciudad bien poblada con casas muy bien estructuradas y modernas,  construidas con materiales muy sofisticadas.  

El desarrollo socioeconómico ha sido un factor principal pero también la mano de obra por albañiles y constructores calificados como es el caso de Miguel albañil desde hace 10 años de 46 años de edad con una familia de 3 hijos.

Uno de sus sueños mientras corre el tiempo es convertirse en un maestro de obras y enseñarles a sus hijos el mismo oficio.

El crédito que ha solicitado lo quiere utilizar para la compra de un terreno para poder trabajar y heredar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Sololá is a well populated city with well structured and modern housing, built from sophisticated materials. Social economic development is a principal factor but also the handicraft of the bricklayers and qualified builders is another. As in the case of Miguel who has worked as a bricklayer for the past ten years. At 46 years old he has a family of three children. One of his dreams, as time rolls by, is to become a master builder and to teach his children the same trade. The loan he is requesting is to buy a plot of land to work on and be an inheritance for his children.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to build a chicken coop and sodas to sell out of the window of her home.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, John, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, John is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty”, expressed John. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Isiyaku Mamman

texts.en: Isiyaku Mamman remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Isiyaku Mamman, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Isiyaku Mamman is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty”, expressed Isiyaku Mamman. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 66 years. He is married and supports six people in his family.Together with his wife, they have been blessed with five children between the ages of 26 and 11 years.

John is a livestock farmer. He buys and sells cattle for a living. John has done this business for the last five years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 7,000.

John has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 30,000, which he will use to buy cows to sell.
 
With the anticipated profits, John will be able to purchase a plot of land and build.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en:
Barbra is 27 years old, a single mother of two children, aged four and seven years old. She has been running an M-PESA, which is a local money transfer business. She has been in this business for two years now and earns a monthly income of KES 7,000 (Kenyan shillings).
	 
Barbra has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to add more working float to the business.                                                                                           

She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to add more working float to the money transfer business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts and supplies, and to maintain her shop.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Teresa works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  

Teresa is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an addition stock of groceries

loans.name: Evelita

texts.en:
Evelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood and paints, and to pay for the labourers' salaries for her furniture-making business.

Evelita has been in this business for three years. Evelita earns more income from a buy and sell vegetables business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood and paints, and to pay for the labourers' salaries

loans.name: Jorge Iván

texts.es:
El señor Jorge es un hombre muy experimentado en el área de la mecánica, la latonería y pintura.

Ha adquirido muchas habilidades a través de pequeños estudios en diferentes academias y otra parte la ha aprendido empíricamente.

Con su duro trabajo ha podido sacar adelante a su esposa y sus hijos, es un hombre responsable, trabajador y siempre hace lo que este a su alcance para ofrecerle a su familia lo mejor.

En su taller realiza distintos tipos de trabajos y ya tiene un buen reconocimiento en el sector donde vive por su buena labor y servicio.

Es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado que siempre trata de ofrecer un excelente servicio, de buena calidad y de una manera eficiente.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de pinturas, disolventes, soldadura, macilla, cintas, entre otros, elementos con los que podrá continuar con su labor y podrá seguir sosteniendo a su familia que para él es lo mas importante.
texts.en:
Jorge is a man with lots of experience in the fields of mechanics, metal work and painting. He has gained a lot of ability taking short courses in different academies and by learning hands-on. Through his hard work he has been able to get his wife and children ahead. He is a responsible and hard-working person who always does what he can to provide his family with the best.

He does different types of work in his shop and is well-known in the area he lives in for his good work and service. He is hard-working and honest and always tries to provide excellent service, of high quality and in an efficient manner. He is requesting a loan to buy paint, solvent, putty and tape amongst other things so he can continue his work and continue to sustain his family which is the most important thing for him.

loans.use: to buy paint, solvents, solder, putty, tape, etc.

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en: Yohanna is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Yohanna joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Timothy, Mercy and Philibus. Yohanna is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Yohanna will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Yohanna can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Yohanna said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Yohanna is not thinking about just this year. In 5 years, he wants to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: José Rene

texts.es:
José tiene 39 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado en la escuela, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la elaboración de pan artesanal, tiene 2 hijos y son los únicos que dependen de él.

José se dedica a la albañilería desde hace seis años, lo aprendió por un amigo suyo y por un tío, el trabajo de carpintero y panadería lo aprendió desde muy joven en unos cursos que impartieron en la comunidad, y además trabaja en la agricultura y crianza de especies menores.
Él trabaja todos los días desde las cinco y media de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde que vuelve a su hogar.

José solicita este crédito para comprar herramientas que necesita para los trabajos que realiza en la  carpintería y otras herramientas para el trabajo de albañil, además invertirá en las actividades agrícolas que realiza, ya que actualmente están preparando las milpas y es necesario comprar con anticipación los insumos.

Su sueño es construir su propia casa y tener terreno propio para cultivar.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old and studied through the third grade. He is married and his wife does the household work and makes artisan bread. He has two sons who are his only dependents.

For the last six years, José has worked in masonry, which he learned through a friend and an uncle. He learned carpentry and bakery work when he was very young through courses that were offered in the community. He also works in farming and small animal breeding. He works every day from 5:30 in the morning until two in the afternoon when he returns to his home.

José is requesting this loan to buy tools he needs for his carpentry work and other tools for his masonry work. He will also invest in his agricultural activities since they are currently preparing the fields and it's necessary to buy inputs in advance.

His dream is to build his own house and have his own land to cultivate.

loans.use: to buy tools he needs for his carpentry work and other tools for his masonry work. He will also invest in his agricultural activities.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: Don José, tiene 57 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 5 hijos, reside en una aldea de Gracias Lempira con su familia. Toda su vida ha realizado actividades agrícolas. Cultiva maíz, frijoles y caña. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos. Solicita un cuarto préstamo por 22,000 Lempiras para comprar foliar, abonos para fertilizar el cultivo y pagar mano de obra por limpieza del cultivo de maíz y frijol y aumentar la cosecha. Tiene como meta mantener la producción y lograr que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Jose is 57 years old and is in a civil union with his wife, with whom he has five children. He lives in the village of Gracias Lempira with his family. All his life he has been engaged in agricultural work. He cultivates corn, beans and sugar cane. This work is his source of income. 

He is requesting a fourth loan for 22,000 Lempiras to buy spray fertilizer and manure to fertilizer his crops and to cover labor costs for clearing the land and cultivating the corn and beans. This will increase his harvest. He has the goal of maintaining production and allowing his children to go to school.

loans.use: to buy spray fertilizer and manure to fertilize his crops and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Samuel, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Samuel is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Samuel. With this loan, Samuel is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Garba Dantine

texts.en: Garba Dantine is a 32 year old farmer from Ang/Bazai. As a Babban Gona member, Garba Dantine is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Garba Dantine can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Garba Dantine, is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Garba Dantine said “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family, in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, Garba Dantine is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Camino Al Cielo Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por cuatro socias emprendedoras, es coordinado por la señora Marlene de 34 años de edad y acompañada, quien se dedica a la compra de cosechas de frutas para luego comercializarlas, sus principales acreedores son pobladores del país vecino Costa Rica, se ha dedicado a esta actividad, desde hace doce años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de tamarindo, pues es el producto que más demanda está teniendo en el mercadeo nacional como internacional. Las otras socias son las señoras Dina de 54 años de edad, su negocio es la compra-venta de cosechas en el mercado de la municipalidad y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de tamarindo y mango, Tania de 24 años de edad, elabora y vende buñuelos, cosa de horno, atol, etc., y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de quintal de maíz, yuca, aceite, azúcar, flete de leña, etc., y Rosa de 21 años de edad, comerciante de ropa de segunda y pan en el mercado de Granada, el crédito lo invertirá en pacas de calidad y variedad de pan.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of four enterprising members and is coordinated by Marlene, who is 34 years old and married and who purchases fruit harvests and later sells them. Her principal creditors live in the neighboring country of Costa Rica. She has been engaged in this work for 12 years. She is requesting this loan to buy a crop of tamarind since it is the product with the highest demand, both in the national and international market. 

The other members are Dina, who is 54 years old and has a business buying and selling crops in the marketplace of the city. She is requesting a loan to buy tamarind and mango crops. Tania, who is 24 years old, bakes and sells bunelos, oven baked goods, atol, etc. and she is requesting a loan to buy 46 kilos of corn, yucca, oil, sugar, a pallet of firewood, etc. Rosa, who is 21 years old, sells second hand clothing and bread in the market of Granada and she will invest the loan in quality flour and a variety of breads.

loans.use: to buy tamarind.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: Mathew is a Babban Gona farmer from Ung/Chino. Mathew expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Mathew to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Mathew can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Mathew, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 60 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Mathew will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Mathew will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Gloria Estela

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 59 años de edad, estudió hasta primer grado debido a que tuvo que trabajar en las actividades que realizan sus padres como crianza de aves de corral y agricultura, es madre soltera de tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad, Gloria solamente apoya a 4 de sus nietos en sus estudios.


Ella ha trabajado por muchos en oficios del hogar, también se dedica a la venta de tamales y pan en la comunidad, antes por mucho tiempo estuvo trabajando en la capital del país en una tienda la cual administraba. Hoy en día se ha dedicado a la venta de tortillas en la comunidad donde reside, en esta actividad le ayuda una amiga, trabaja desde muy temprano en las mañanas de lunes a sábados.


Gloria necesita mucho este crédito para comprar medicinas y pagar un tratamiento al cual se someterá para mejorar sus problemas de salud, además invertirá en la reparación de su vivienda.

Ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda poco a poco, esperar recuperarse lo mas pronto posible para cumplirlo, además está dispuesta a seguir apoyando en los estudios a sus nietos que tiene a su cargo.
texts.en:
Gloria is 59 years old and completed only first grade at school as she had to help her parents at their work raising poultry and growing crops. Gloria is a single mother to three adult children. Gloria supports only four of her grandchildren's education.

For many years Gloria has been a housewife and sold bread and tamales in the community. Previously she spent many years working in El Salvador's capital city, San Salvador, at a shop that she managed. Gloria now also makes a living selling tortillas in the local area. She receives help from a friend in this work. Gloria works from very early in the morning, from Monday to Saturday.

Gloria really needs this loan in order to buy medicines and pay for treatment for health problems; she will also make repairs to her home.

Gloria dreams of gradually improving her house. She wants to get better as quickly as possible in order to do this. Gloria is also willing to continue support the education of her grandchildren who are under her care.

loans.use: to buy medicines and pay for treatment for health problems; Gloria will also make repairs to her home.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en: Aminu is a Babban Gona farmer from Chino. Aminu expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Aminu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Aminu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Aminu, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Aminu will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Aminu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Wonderful Lenders! Margaret is a very honest, hardworking and dedicated farmer who is 56 years of age and hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya, an area known to have the best weather patterns that favor crops and animal farming. Margaret has so much experience in farming, and having done farming for the past 23 years, she is considered as one of the best farmers in her village. Margaret's primary source of income is milk selling, egg selling, and crop farming.

Margaret is a very dedicated dairy farmer, and she has nicknamed her cows “Osama and Ndune” (name of a person). Margaret has space on her farm that is unused, and she wants to use the space through keeping more dairy cows.  That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. Through the loan, Margaret is going to improve her living conditions and also improve the conditions of her six children by providing them with a solid education because education is the “key to success”.

Kerugoya has a ready market for milk, and also the population is high. Hence, Margaret will not have a problem selling the milk and increasing her income level. 

Margaret is very disciplined with finances and she is sure that through accumulated profits, she will open a large dairy shop and be able to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Dauda, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. Dauda  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 30 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty” expressed Dauda   With this loan, Dauda is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan de 30 años de edad, con dos hijos menores de edad, es originario del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligado a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con  los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a  su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos, actividad que la realiza en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo el producto.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y compra un lote de cerdos en pie para la crianza y venta. Juan agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juan is 30 years old and has two children. He is a native of el Sauce, a community located in the north of the country. He is hard-working, responsible with the desire to grow as a person. Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources he could not study for a career as he had to work from an early age to help with the household expenses. Thanks to his effort and desire to get ahead he works raising and selling pigs a business he does at his house. He works at his business 8 hours a day, offering his product.

The objective of the loan is to increase his working capital buying a group of pigs to raise and sell. Juan is grateful for the support that the lenders at Kiva provide to people of meager resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can enjoy dignified work.

loans.use: to stock his business buying a group of pigs.

loans.name: Balbina

texts.en:
Balbina owns and operates a food stall. She has been successful in this business for years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She was also able to improve her income and the living condition of her family.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her profit. She is requesting an amount of 25,000 PHP to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, in larger quantities. She looks forward to this financial assistance with thankfulness and gladness in her heart.

Balbina hopes for her business to grow bigger and better. She dreams of giving her children a good life in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients needed to continue the operation of her eatery

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en:
Ma. Nancy is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing. Ma. Nancy is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Ma. Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anchita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Anchita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a buy and sell young coconut business. Anchita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall for her buy and sell vegetable business.

Anchita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Kuvuna

texts.en:
Kuvuna is a married woman, who lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water. 

For the past three years, she has operated an agricultural selling business, selling farm produce from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak, which leads to losses. She dreams of expanding her business to generate more income. 

With the 20,000 KEs loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase more seedlings and pesticides. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Carmenza Pastora

texts.es:
Carmenza una madre de 32 años de edad con 5 hijos a su cuidado de 4, 4, 8, 10, 12, es madre cabeza de hogar y ha podido sostener a su numerosa familia gracias a que trabaja como productora agropecuaria en la finca de sus padres. 

Solicita un crédito para iniciar su propio negocio, una pequeña empresa que iniciaría con dos terneros pequeños los cuales criara y alimentara en los campos de sus padres, la iniciativa la tomo básicamente por sus hijos porque quiere disfrutar con ellos de una mejor vida, que estudien y que todos los días tengan un motivo para sonreír.

Apoyen a esta empresaria que quiere demostrar que el papel de madre y padre no le queda pequeño solo necesita tu voto de confianza
texts.en:
Carmenza is a mother of 32 years with five children who are 4, 4, 8, 10, and 12 years old. She is a female head of household and has been able to support her numerous family thanks to her work in agriculture on her parent's ranch. She is requesting a loan to begin her own business, a small enterprise that will begin with two young calves which she will raise and feed in her parent's fields. 

She has taken this initiative for her children because she wants to a enjoy a better life with them. She wants them to go to school and hopes that every day they will have a reason to smile. Support this business that demonstrates how being both a mother and father is no small feat. She only needs your vote of confidence.

loans.use: to buy two calves to start her business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with four children of whom all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Asha has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour and maize flour from her home to neighbours. Asha dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 40,000 Asha wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
El abrir y dedicarse a un negocio por muy sencillo que sea, se necesita tener mucho tacto para que pueda desarrollarse bien y se pueda prosperar.  Muchas veces por no tener este tacto  el negocio se estanca y llega a fracasar.

Uno de estos ejemplos de este tacto de mercado se puede ver en Pascual de 31 años y padre de dos hijos.  El tiene un negocio de abarrotería o tienda de insumos diarios y buscó un lugar donde la competencia era menos.  Por supuesto que su clientela es mucho mayor que si él hubiera tenido un negocio de mucha competencia comercial.

Ya que esta estrategia le ha servido de mucho Pascual ha solicitado un préstamo para comprar más mercadería y así ampliar más su negocio.  

Aparte de esto brindar una mejor educación para sus hijos y llevarlos adelante hacia un futuro esperanzador.
texts.en:
As simple as it can be to open and run a business in Guatemala, one needs to be very careful so that it develops well and can become prosperous. Without this care, the business can become stagnant and fail.

One example of a careful business-owner is 31-year-old Pascual, a father to two children. Pascual has a grocery store, which he set up in an area with less competition. Of course, he now has many more customers than if he had opened his business in a very commercial area.

This strategy has been great for Pascual and so he is now applying for a loan in order to buy more merchandise and expand his business.

As well as providing his children with an education, Pascual wants to help to give them a promising future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Buhari

texts.en: Buhari remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before  became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Buhari, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. Buhari  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 15 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Buhari   With this loan, Buhari is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Usman Luka

texts.en: Usman Luka is a Babban Gona farmer from Madaki Dutse. Usman Luka is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Usman Luka to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Usman Luka can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Usman Luka is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Usman Luka is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family.  Ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Usman Luka will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio tiene 71 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela debido a que vivía lejos de la ciudad, además su padre murió cuando él estaba pequeño y por lo tanto tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar, ahora está casado y tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya todos son mayores de edad y viven con sus propias familias.


Rogelio actualmente está trabajando en sus cultivos de maíz y frijol, con los cuales asegura la alimentación de se familia y en ocasiones vende una parte para obtener ingresos para el hogar anteriormente trabajó en construcción y fue así como adquirió conocimientos de albañilería.

El crédito que él está solicitando lo necesita para comprar dos novillas y el resto del dinero lo invertirá en la preparación de la siembra y compra de insumos agrícolas, como abonos y fertilizantes.

Él sueña con ponerle piso a su vivienda y seguir ayudando a sus nietos para que se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
Rogelio is 71 years old. He never had the opportunity to go to school since he lived too far from the city. Plus, his parents died when he was young, causing him to have to start working. Now he is married and has six children, all of whom are older and live with their own families. Rogelio currently is working on his crops of corn and beans, with which he will secure the food he needs for his family and, occasionally, sell a part to obtain income for the household. 

Previously, he worked in construction and it was through this that he learned to lay bricks. He needs the loan he is requesting to buy two cows. He will invest the rest of the money to prepare for sowing the land and to buy agricultural supplies, such as manure and fertilizer. His dream in to install a floor in his home and to continue helping his grandchildren so they are able to prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to buy two cows. The rest of the money will be invested in preparing to sow the land and to buy agricultural supplies, such as manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ibrahim Dan-Danso

texts.en: Ibrahim Dan-Danso is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ibrahim Dan-Danso joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Nashan,Gideon, and Rejoice. Ibrahim Dan-Danso is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ibrahim Dan-Danso will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ibrahim Dan-Danso can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Ibrahim Dan-Danso is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Na'omi

texts.en:
Member ID R14-IK000257-02
Na'omi is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Na'omi joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children Nuhu, Salome, and Habiba. Na'omi is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Na'omi will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Na'omi can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Na'omi said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family. Na'omi is not thinking about just this year, she said: “In 5 years, she wants to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Than Bo Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Taung Thar township, this community currently has 84 village customers, including 7 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. This village is located in Myanmar's dry zone, where insufficient rainfall is very common. Most villagers are Buddhist and struggle finding access to affordable credit, as the state-owned agricultural bank is not active in the area.

A new loan would enable this community to buy crop inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for crops such as bean, betel, and onion. As the Than Bo community has no access to electricity and therefore relies on candles and batteries for light, they aim to generate enough income from crop sales to purchase a solar light. The light would help their children to study and the villagers do other business, such as rolling cigars, at night.

Pictured above are U Ko, U Mg, Ma Thin, U Bo, U Thar, U Kyaw, and U Phoe Toe, who are committee members from the Than Bo Village CBO. Included in the photo is 54-year-old U Bo, the father of two children. He grows peanuts and beans and owns five cows and eighteen sheep to supplement this income. He bought fertilizer and insecticides to enrich and protect his crops with his previous loan. He will invest the new loan to purchase higher quality inputs such as groundnut seeds to grow on his farm.

loans.use: to help 84 villagers buy high quality inputs to boost bean, betel, and onion yields

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en: Hauwa remembers the extreme poverty that her family faced during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Hauwa, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Hauwa is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty”, expressed Hauwa. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 39 years old and married with two children.

Cecilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Cecilia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Cecilia aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en: Iliya is a 50-year-old farmer from Madaki Dutse.  As a Babban Gona member, Iliya, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Iliya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Iliya is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Iliya said “I plan to use the money I make to Educate my children: Amos, Grace,and Laraba, and in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Yahaya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for hischildren: Hosea, Blessing,  and  Shem. Yahaya is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Yahaya will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would  be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Yahaya can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Yahaya said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland”. Yahaya is not thinking about just this year; he said, In 5 years, he wants to make more money for myself and my family.”

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 38 years old. She is married to Joshua and together they have been blessed with four children between the ages of 4 and 17 years old. Joshua provides additional income for his family.

Eunice sells fish, a business she has done for the last 4 years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES. Eunice has requested her first loan of 30,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to buy fish for resale.

With the anticipated profits, Eunice will be able to educate her children as well as expand her current business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to live a prosperous life.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en: Iliya remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Iliya, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Iliya is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty”, expressed Iliya. With this loan, Iliya is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Ishaku Ibrahim

texts.en: Ishaku Ibrahim is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ishaku Ibrahim joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for hischildren: Ayuba, Maryamu,  and  Le'Atu. Ishaku Ibrahim is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ishaku Ibrahim will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would  be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ishaku Ibrahim can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Ishaku Ibrahim said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family. Ishaku Ibrahim is not thinking about just this year; he said, “in 5 years, I want to become the  most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en: Inusa is a Babban Gona farmer from Makada. Inusa is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Inusa to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.
