Like all Babban Gona members, Inusa can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Inusa, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Inusa is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.  Ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Inusa will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Nereyda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Jugar al salón de belleza era uno de los juegos favoritos de Nereyda cuando era una niña, ahora es la actividad que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. Una sonrisa calida y un ambiente agradable es lo que reciben los clientes al entrar al pequeño salón de belleza, al mismo tiempo gozan de los mejores tratamientos y cortes de cabello. Tiene 47 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Hace tres años, con el objetivo de apoyar en la economía familiar, inició su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado incrementar sus productos y su clientela. 
Ella solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar productos para el salón tales como cremas, tratamientos y tintes para el cabello, pintura de uñas, maquillaje, perfumes, cepillos, tijeras, entre otros. Nereyda deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que  su meta es comprar todo el equipo necesario para tener un salón de belleza completo y así poder atender la demanda de su clientela, de manera que logre obtener buenos ingresos. Es una mujer amable, trabajadora y emprendedora, que luchara hasta cumplir todos sus ideales.
texts.en:
Playing beauty shop was one of Nereyda’s favorite games when she was a girl.  Now it is the business activity that has become her main source of income.  A warm smile and a pleasant atmosphere is what the customers receive upon entering her small beauty salon.  At the same time they enjoy the best treatments and haircuts.  

She is 47 years old, married, and has two children.  Three years ago, with help from her husband, she started her business.  Her objective was to help the family financially.  With great effort and dedication she has managed to increase her products and her clientele.

She is requesting the loan to increase capital production.  She needs to buy products like creams, treatments and hair dyes, nail polish, make-up, perfume, brushes, and scissors, among others, for her salon.  Nereyda places her trust in the loan given that her goal is to buy all types of equipment needed to have a complete beauty salon.  This way she will be able to tend to her customer demand and manage to get good income.  She is a kind, hard-working, and enterprising woman who will struggle until she fulfills all of her plans.

loans.use: to buy products like creams, treatments and hair dyes, nail polish, make-up, perfume, brushes, and scissors, among others.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married, with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a goat meat business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, Halima wants to purchase seven goats to expand her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven goats to expand her business.

loans.name: José Rene

texts.es:
José de 40 años de edad, logró cursar hasta  6º grado ya que sus padres no pudieron darle el estudio por los escasos recursos económicos en que vivían, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a la comercialización de pescado fresco, tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad, José vive en casa de su padre quien le ayuda en los trabajos agrícolas.

José se dedica a cultivar maíz, el lugar donde trabaja se encuentra a dos kilómetros de su casa, en época de invierno tiene que madrugar para poder llegar muy temprano a trabajar, esta actividad se la enseñó su padre quien también es agricultor, además José se dedica a trabajar en una cantera de quiebra de piedra, esto lo ha hecho desde varios años, y por las noches se dedica a la pesca.


Él necesita este crédito para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y otros productos necesarios para la agricultura, invertirá para cultivar una hectárea de maíz y  además para comprar aperos pesqueros.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando, darles el estudio a sus hijos para que puedan tener un mejor trabajo y mejores oportunidades, comprar una casa para que puedan vivir él y su familia.
texts.en:
José, age 40, managed to go to school through the sixth grade.  His parents were not able to give him an education because of their scarce financial resources at the time.  He is in a relationship, and his life partner sells fresh fish.  He has three children who attend the community school.  José lives in his father’s house, and he helps him with the agricultural work.

José grows corn.  The place where he works is two kilometers from his house.  In the wintertime he has to get up at dawn to be able to get to work very early.  His father taught him this business activity; he is also a farmer.  José also works in a quarry breaking rocks.  He has done this for several years, and in the evenings he fishes.

He needs this loan to buy fertilizers, compost, and other products he needs for agriculture.  He will use the loan to cultivate a hectare of corn and to buy fishing equipment.

His dreams are to continue working, to give his children an education so that they can have better work and better opportunities, and to buy a house where he and his family can live.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fishing equipment.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 36 years old. She is married to Jonathan and, together, they have been blessed with two children, ages 15 and 10 years old. Jonathan provides additional income for the family.

Lilian sells construction supplies, a business she has done for the last one year, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. However, Lilian has asked for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 30,000, not for her business, but to provide basic needs for her family.

Lilian will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. Her dream and hope for the family is to live a lovely, good life.

loans.use: to provide basic needs for her family.

loans.name: João

texts.pt:
O Sr. Joao de 54 anos de idade casado pai de 6 filhos  dos quais 2 maior de idade e indepedentes, 3 estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario 1 è menor de idade. Ele é trabalhador da empresa de produção de banana com cargo profissional de Tractorista e é deficiente fisico.
O presente emprestimo ser aplicado para comprar material de construção (cimento, blocos, janelas, e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para terminar com a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
João is 54 years old and married. He has six children, two of whom are adults living on their own, three of whom are in primary and secondary school, and one of whom is not yet of school age. He works for a banana company driving a tractor, and he is physically disabled.
He will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, windows) and to pay labor costs to finish building his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, windows) and to pay labor costs to finish building his house.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.pt:
A Sra. Lidia de 40 anos de idade casada e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 4 estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario e 1 sem idade para frequentar a escola. Ela dedica-se ao comércio informal de frutas e loiças usadas, actividade que esta a explorar no seu estabelicimento comercial na sua casa.
Com o presente empréstimo será aplicado para comprar frutas (frutas e loiça usada) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio para garantir a sua reforma.
No futuro pretende abrir um estabelecimento de venda de material de construção para garantir o sustento da sua familia.
texts.en:
Lidia, 40 years old, is married and has five children, four of whom are still in school and one of whom is not yet old enough to attend school. She has an informal business selling fruit and used dishware out of her home.
She will use this loan to buy fruit and used dishware to increase her stock and ensure the growth of her business. In the future she hopes to open a business selling construction material so she can support her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit and used dishware to increase her stock and ensure the growth of her business.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata, a 48 year old woman, runs a grocery and stationary shop with her husband Krishnachandra. They live in the remote village of Mouyamari in Jalpaiguri district. Both are uneducated, and can sign their names only. They have only one son, for whom they could not provide education due to poverty and now he is grown up and works as a barber in a hair-cutting salon.

Their monthly income from this grocery business just covers their living expenses. Mamata tries hard to save some money from their income for the future, but in vain. On their current income, it's getting difficult to manage household expenses and save adequately for the future. They want to increase their inventory and cater to more customers, but they lack capital.

Thus, Mamata has taken a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner), with which she will be able to purchase stocks of rice, oil, salt, sugar, lentils, chips, biscuits, etc. in bulk at lower rates from the wholesale market. This will help them steadily grow their small grocery store and they expect an increase in their monthly profits in the immediate future. This loan will help her family to take the first step towards a financially secure and stable future.

She is grateful to her generous lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of groceries for her grocery store.

loans.name: Eliab

texts.en:
Eliab is a 40-year-old married man with 6 children from the Kagaramira cell in the Kiruhura district of Uganda.  All of his children attend school.  Eliab operates a cattle fattening business as his main source of income.  

He has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to help him buy more cattle for fattening, more farmland to graze his cattle, as well as pay school fees for his children.  His major challenge is limited grazing land for his cows, and poor means of transport to take his milk to the market.  He hopes to buy a motorcycle to help him transport his milk to the market and also build a permanent home for his children.

Eliab is a very honest and hard working man who thanks the Kiva lenders for the financial muscle they have lent to him.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.en: Bertha Alicia lives in a community in the Department of Colón Honduras. Her family depends on incomes of her small grocery store. She is 43 years old, lives with her husband and six children. Her husband is a farmer. It is clear that Bertha Alicia works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. She has two kids that attend school and, she thinks the education is very important for their future. She wishes her children have better illumination to complete homework once the sun has set. The family wishes to spend more time together, extending the light hours to spend quality time. Bertha Alicia is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system to substitute the use of kerosenae lamps and firewood, reducing expenses and improving the health of her family

loans.name: Fritz

texts.en:
This loan will help Fritz introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community.

Fritz wanted to become a doctor but due to financial difficulties in his family only completed high school. He became a construction worker at a young age. He is married with three children and now he holds a role as a leader of the neighbourhood units in the area.

When he heard about Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk program, he immediately jumped on board; not only for its obvious business opportunities but he sees the technologies are simple, much needed and affordable. Clean water, safe methods of cooking, and affordable solar lighting are perfect solutions to a lot of the social and economic issues in his community.   

Fritz will use the loan to buy stock and increase his income to make improvements to his home. 

Photo description: Fritz is the one on the left. On the right sight is his wife who also helps him managing the kiosk.

loans.use: To pay for green technologies to sell to his customers

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 24 years old and married to Gerald, and blessed with two school attending children.  She has operated a general shop, where she sells a variety of goods to her customers, for the last eight years, earning a monthly income of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
She has applied for her second loan of 45,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to add additional stock of flour, sugar, soft drinks, washing detergents, and biscuits to sell.                                                                                           

The anticipated profit will be used to provide for basic family needs.  She hopes to grow her business and to be stable financially.

loans.use: to add additional stock of flour, sugar, soft drinks, washing detergents, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Mahira

texts.en:
Mahira is  54 years old, divorced,  and the mother of one child. She is trying to raise her  son  without feeling the absence of his father too much. 

She earns a living by running a small café in her city. Mahira has dedicated her life to this business for more than 34 years. Usually her clients are workers from the construction companies in her  town. 

Every morning she goes to the market to buy products for her  employees to use to prepare meals to sell.  Her son helps her mother in this business. Mahira ’s café is open from 8 AM to 12 PM. 

She is satisfied with her  business and her profits come to 150 AZN a month. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN to repair her café and buy new furniture. Mahira thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to repair her café and buy new furniture

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
This is Pablita. Her previous loan was a big help for her business since she was able to purchase products for her direct-selling business. The loan is also useful in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another PHP 30,000 loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell should result in greater profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She also now focuses on buying and selling other merchandise products, as shown in the photo.

Pablita hopes to have more customers to purchase or ask for orders of her items. She also dreams that their house will be fully-furnished. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products to sell.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is studying secondary education at the university. She is single and lives with her family. Her parents work as  house helpers and earn goods enough for their needs.  

She was determined and wants to finish her studies to have a bright future of her own.  She is thankful to GDMPC that gives every student a chance to continue studying with their services specialized for students. She took a new loan recently,to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester for this current year.  She hopes to be successful and be able to have nice work that she gains from her untiring effort.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Elza

texts.en:
Elza is a 45-year-old married woman. She lives in a small village in the Akhaltsikhe district with her husband, two children, and a pensioner mother-in-law. 

Elza's husband works hard on the family-owned agricultural land, where he grows haricots to sell locally. This is the only source of income for the family and it is very hard to cover family costs. 

Elza decided to restart the business she was involved in years ago. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,500 GEL to start a trading business. With the received credit, she will purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and then will resell them at higher prices. 

This will give her a chance to be involved in her own business and she will gain the profit. Elza awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade in fruits and vegetables in order to increase family income

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 20 years old and single.  For two years she has earned a living raising pigs in the Philippines, as well as earning additional income from vegetable vending.  Lourdes is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Felecitte

texts.en:
Felecitte  is 29 years old. She is married with two children aged between 2 and 5, one of whom goes to school. 

Her business has been selling foodstuffs,  together with her husband, for the past one year.

With the loan, she would like to increase her inventory through buying more lotions, cooking oil, and sugar for sale. Profit from the business will be used to buy reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more lotions, cooking oil, and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en: Phy’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Phy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Pik's Group

texts.en:
Pik’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Pik makes a living cultivating rice 
to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en: Eng’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Eng makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family .

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en: Ny’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Ny makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en: Samnang’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Samnang makes a living cultivating rice, fishing and trading vegetables to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en: Mrs. Hieu  is 50 years old. She is married and has two children.  Husbandry and fishing are her main income. She can cover her family’s daily cost and education from pig raising income. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family.  She has daily income from the crops from her garden such as vegetables, chickens and pigs.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Chheang's Group

texts.en: Chheang’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chheang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa has been operating her own farm for six years, working with her husband to make a living.  The farm earns a good cash inflow for their family, and Marissa always finds many ways to augment their living. 

To improve her farm, Marissa took out a new loan to buy organic fertilizer.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
El señor Wilmer es un hombre muy trabajador dedicado al negocio propio, cuenta con un local de tapicería donde realiza reparaciones de muebles desde hace 18 años contando con los clientes principales del municipio de Moroceli  y otros que vienen de diferentes aldeas.
Don Wilmer su negocio es el único local de la zona donde se raparan todo tipo de muebles  de sala y de carro, solicita el préstamo para comprar tela, pegamento, esponja, esponja molida, patas de caucho, grapas, resorte, cabuya, hilo, etc. 
Don Wilmer los clientes le llevan los muebles para realizar el trabajo de reparación y tiene pendiente varios trabajos pendientes con las ganancias que obtenga sueña con poder seguir dándoles el estudio a sus hijos.

Danlí, Honduras – Julio  2014
texts.en:
Wilmer's a very hardworking man who works in his own business.  He has an upholstery shop where he has repaired furniture for 18 years, mainly for customers from the town of Moroceli and others from different towns.  It's the only business in the area for repairing all types of furniture for the home and for cars.  His customers take their furniture to him for repair, and he has several jobs pending.  

Wilmer's requesting the loan to buy fabric, glue, foam, ground foam, rubber feet, staples, springs, cord, thread, and so on.

He dreams of being able to keep on paying for his children's education with his profits.

Danlí, Honduras–July 2014

loans.use: to buy fabric, glue, foam, ground foam, rubber feet, staples, springs, cord, thread, and other supplies

loans.name: Dzunga

texts.en:
Dzunga is a married woman with four  children, all of whom attend school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años de edad, es madre de 11 hijos de los cuales siete ya tiene sus propias familias, está casada y su esposo trabaja en la  agricultura (siembra de maíz, frijoles y maicillo) y de ayudante de albañil, María no pudo estudiar debido a que sus padres siempre la llevaban a trabajar en los cultivos y a tejer hamacas por las tardes.

Actualmente María se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, lo ha realizado desde pequeña, además elaborar hamacas, cría cerdos y aves de corral para venderlos posteriormente en los mercados de las comunidades. Ella se levanta muy temprano para iniciar sus labores de cocina y luego teje hamacas y cuidar de los cerdos y aves.

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar cuatro cerdos, además comprará 50 libras de hilo de seda para tejer hamacas, lo cual le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos económicos para darle el estudios a sus hijos pequeños que van a la escuela.

María sueña con mejorar su vivienda de adobe, además planea hacer una galera para la crianza de aves.
texts.en:
María is a 54-year old woman, who has 11 children (7 of whom already have their own families) and a husband who works in agriculture, planting corn, beans and millet. He also works as a builder assistant. María was not able to study because her parents always needed her to work in the plantations and to weave hammocks in the afternoons. 

María currently works in agriculture, as she has done since she was a little girl. She makes hammocks and breeds pigs and hens that she then sells in community markets. She wakes up very early to start cooking and then weave the hammocks and take care of the pigs and hens. 

She is requesting this loan to buy 4 pigs and 50 pounds of silk thread for the hammocks. This will allow her to increase her income and to provide her young children with an education. 

María's dream is to make improvements to her house, made of sun-dried brick, and to build a henhouse.

loans.use: to buy 4 pigs and 50 pounds of silk thread to make hammocks, which will allow her to increase her income and provide her young children with an education.

loans.name: Eze

texts.en: Eze is a young business man with a small electronic shop called Global Enterprise, which he's owned since January, 2014. He is married with two children, a girl and a boy. Eze hopes selling sustainable energy products like clean charcoal cookstoves and solar lanterns will improve his business and bring him and his family success.

loans.use: To pay for sustainable energy products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is a mother of two boys and she also has two of her brothers' children living with her. Her shop, Nora's Business Center, carries electronic and office supplies. She hopes selling sustainable energy products like clean cookstoves and small solar homes systems will be very profitable and add to her business success.   Kiva loans will allow Nora to add Sustainable Energy  products to her inventory. With the profit, she will continue to grow her business.

loans.use: To pay for sustainable energy products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Kelechi Ben

texts.en: Kelechi Ben has a small electrinic store. He is very excited about adding a sustainable energy products like clean charcoal stoves and solar to his inventory and to be able to offer these products to his customers. With sales, he will pay back this kiva loan and improve his business with the profit.

loans.use: To pay for sustainable energy products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en: Alhaji runs a general hardware supply store called Sankoh B. Business Center. He hopes selling sustainable energy products like clean charcoal cookstoves and solar products will improve his business.  He'll repay his kiva micro-loan with the profits he is sure to make.

loans.use: To pay for sustainable energy products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Matiakay

texts.en: Matiakay is a mother of four, three girls and one boy. Also, four children from other family members also live with her. She has been doing small business for the past 20 years. Currently she sells kitchen supplies at Massa Business Center.  Matiakay hopes selling products like clean charcoal cookstoves and solar lighting products will improve her business and with the profits she will repay  her kiva loan.

loans.use: To pay for sustainable energy products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed has a small electronic shop called Mr. S. Business Center and he is very excited about adding products like clean charcoal stoves and solar lighting products to his inventory to offer to his customers. With  He hopes selling products like clean charcoal cookstoves and solar lighting products will improve his business and with the profits she will repay the kiva loan.

loans.use: To pay for sustainable energy products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan Manuel (third from the left), along with his partners Daniel (last), Rosaura (second), and Jose Juan (First) own the cheese-making factory “El Triunfo”. They all know each other since Juan Manuel attended middle school with Rosaura. Daniel is married to Juan Manuel’s sister, and Jose Juan is Juan Manuel’s father. They all live in Pijijiapan, Chiapas.

After everyone worked separately in different cheese factories, they decided that they had all the tools and knowledge to start their very own company. Juan Manuel would be in charge of transportation and sales, Daniel and Jose Juan would provide the factory with milk and product supervision. Finally, Rosaura would be in charge of account keeping and management. 

Their vision for their company is to be the first cheese factory to offer cheese made exclusively with milk from the local sustainable silvopastoral farms.

This loan will allow Manuel and his partners buy enough milk to produce a good inventory of Cotija cheese during rainy season, when the price of milk is low, and then sell it during the winter season.

With this loan, Juan Manuel will be able to fund the beginning of their long term vision of making “Queseria El Triunfo” the first the sustainable cheese making factory in Pijijiapan.
texts.en: Juan Manuel (third from the left), along with his partners Daniel (last), Rosaura (second), and Jose Juan (First) own the cheese-making factory “El Triunfo”. They all know each other since Juan Manuel attended middle school with Rosaura. Daniel is married to Juan Manuel’s sister, and Jose Juan is Juan Manuel’s father. They all live in Pijijiapan, Chiapas. After everyone worked separately in different cheese factories, they decided that they had all the tools and knowledge to start their very own company. Juan Manuel would be in charge of transportation and sales, Daniel and Jose Juan would provide the factory with milk and product supervision. Finally, Rosaura would be in charge of account keeping and management. Their vision for their company is to be the first cheese factory to offer cheese made exclusively with milk from the local sustainable silvopastoral farms. This loan will allow Manuel and his partners buy enough milk to produce a good inventory of Cotija cheese during rainy season, when the price of milk is low, and then sell it during the winter season. With this loan, Juan Manuel will be able to fund the beginning of their long term vision of making “Queseria El Triunfo” the first the sustainable cheese making factory in Pijijiapan.

loans.use: to buy milk to make cotija cheese

loans.name: Rose Nekesa

texts.en: This is Rose. Rose is married and has eight children. She hails from Bungoma County(Kenya) where she practices small scale farming. She is involved in rabbit rearing, cultivation of maize and banana and she also keeps dairy cows. Farming generates finances for her family upkeep. Together with her husband, she has changed her way of farming from the traditional subsistence, to a more focused farming geared towards increasing income to cater for her family needs. A loan from Kiva will help Rose purchase one more Dairy cow to increase milk production hence higher income to cater for her 8 children.

loans.use: to purchase one more dairy cow in order to increase Milk production

loans.name: Simon Nganga

texts.en:
This is Simon. He is married and a father of two. He undertakes farming of Broccoli and Tomatoes in Kiambu, Kenya. He has been in farming for the last 6 years and supports his family from the proceeds of his horticulture farming.

His biggest challenge is to raise adequate capital to expand his farming activities to a level where he can run it as a more profitable enterprise. A loan from Kiva will help Simon acquire quality farm inputs to enhance his productivity.

loans.use: to purchase high quality seeds and fertilizer for better yields on his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Nancy Iveth

texts.es: La señora Nancy es una mujer emprendedora de 23 años de edad, soltera y propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, además comercializa cosméticos AVON, este negocio lo impulso hace cuatro años, con ayuda financiera de su papá, con el fin que tuviera su propio negocio. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos como es arroz, azúcar, aceite, chiverías, pan, jabón xtra, detergente, etc., además de cosméticos como es cremas corporales, tratamientos para el cabello, perfumes para damas, perfumes para caballeros, etc., la socia lleva dieciocho ciclo que la institución le brinda financiamiento y asegura que los logros han sido múltiples como es el aumento de su negocio, esto principalmente se debe a que ofrece productos que anteriormente no vendía y que la población demanda.
texts.en:
Nancy, 23, is an enterprising woman.  She's single and runs a grocery store in her home.  She also sells Avon cosmetics, a business she started four years ago with financial help from her father so she could have her own business.

She's requesting the loan to buy staples such as rice, sugar, oil, dairy products, bread, soap, detergent, and so on.  She's also going to buy body lotion, hair treatments, fragrances for women and for men, and other cosmetics.

She has been with the institution for 18 loan cycles and she said she has had many successes, such as expanding her business.  This is mainly because she sells products she didn't sell before that people request.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, dairy products, bread, soap, detergent, and other staples

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.es: Maria, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, vive en San Francisco Yojoa, Cortes. Su actividad de generación de ingresos es la elaboración y venta de tajadas de plátano verde, este negocio lo tiene en su casa desde hace 6 años. Para la distribución y venta le ayuda su hijo quien se moviliza en motocicleta y vende en ristras surtiendo pulperías. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar insumos como ser plátanos, aceite, bolsas, sal para elaborar y vender tajadas. Su plan es hacerle mejoras a su casa y su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a 42-year-old single mother with three children. She lives in San Francisco Yojoa, Cortes. Her income-generating business involves making and selling green plantain chips. Maria has been operating this business out of her house for the past six years. In order to distribute and sell her products, Maria has the help of her son, who travels by motorcycle so that he can deliver the products to grocery store chains.

She is requesting her second loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that she can buy supplies such as plantains, oil, bags, and salt for making and selling chips. Her plans include making improvements to her house and business.

loans.use: to buy plantains, oil, bags, and salt  for making chips.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu appreciates the support of her previous loan. She has operated a food stall business selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Nyevu dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the loan of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina, 22 years old, lives in the village of Singimari with her husband and two daughters. Both Sabina and her husband have primary education and did not get financial help from their parents to go for higher studies. Their daughters are too young for school. Sabina's husband is involved in a business of making incense in his home. It is such a business that it earns a very small profit.

Sabina is an energetic and active lady who does not want to be defeated. She wants to get ahead in life, and so she is involved in the dairy business. She sells milk and milk products (butter, cottage cheese and curd) in the local market. She has been doing this business for the last few years, and now this is the principle source of income for the family. Sabina's husband helps her to sell the products in the market and gets some income, but unfortunately that income isn't enough even to cover the family's basic needs.

So, Sabina has applied for this loan from BJS to purchase a dairy cow. This will help her to get more milk to make more milk products to supply and satisfy her customers. The family hopes that this loan will help them get a higher income, and that they will be able to cover their costs and improve their living conditions.

Sabina wishes to construct a better and concrete-made house for them with the additional income generated through this loan.

She conveys her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
Sabitri is from Maynaguri. She is 36 years old and married to Monoranjan, who is a 49-year-old blacksmith. Sabitri is uneducated, and her husband received education until grade eight. They have four children (two sons and two daughters). Two of their children attend school and are in grade two and grade six. Two of them work as daily laborers. They live in their own kachha house (made of wood, mud and straw) in a village, Annandanagar, in Jalpaiguri district.

Sabitri’s husband is a blacksmith by profession. Her husband has experience in this field. Sabitri's husband prepares different kinds of tools made of iron, such as hammers, nails, scythes, axes, sickles, knives, etc. He has a shop in their locality, where he works from dawn to dusk tirelessly and sells his tools to the local people and in the neighboring villages. Sabitri helps her husband after managing her household work. There is a great demand for their products in the locality.

Sabitri and her husband decided to take this loan from BJS to invest in their existing blacksmith business for purchasing raw materials such as iron etc. for their business. With the profit from this business, Sabitri wants to give her children a good education and a bright future. Sabitri is very much grateful to Kiva and BJS.

Sabitri is grateful to BJS as well as Kiva, who help people with low incomes to have decent jobs.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her husband's blacksmith business.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. School fees are her greatest monthly expense.

For the past three years, Celestine has operated a fuel business, selling petrol to her neighbours and passersby. Seasonality is her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With this Kshs 50,000 loan, Celestine wants to purchase more petrol to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more petrol to resell

loans.name: Celso

texts.en: Celso owns and operates an agricultural farm, growing coconuts, bananas and other crops for a living. Celso has been engaged in this business for many years, helping his family working on it and earning well from these activities. His farm is doing well, yet he needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, he took a new loan to cover weeding maintenance costs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to cover weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Fely Rose

texts.en: Fely Rose has been running a retail business in order to provide the needs of her family. She sells assorted groceries in their village to make a living. Her husband helps operate her business and is also working on their farm. To improve sales, she took another loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. In the future, Fely Rose wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Nueva Ilusión esta formado por 9 integrantes emprendedores, luchadores y muy trabajadores que ganan el pan de cada día con su esfuerzo. Viven en la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar de extensos pastos y fincas ganaderas, tiene modernas construcciones y el encanto de la arquitectura tradicional, su gente es amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, son personas amables y gentiles.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María, es una socia desde hace 9 años, todo este tiempo ha llegado a tener muy buenas amistades ya que son como una familia unida, siempre se apoyan mutuamente.
La Señora. María tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija de 15 años que estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo se dedica a laborar como chofer, presta sus servicios en fletes, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña María se dedica a las tareas del campo, cría pollos, cuyes, borregos y ganado del cual vende la leche, también se dedica a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su casa y para la venta, esta actividad le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia y brindares una mejor calidad de vida. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de una vaca lechera. Su meta es terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
The group Nueva Ilusión has 9 entrepreneur and very hard-working members, who bring home the bacon every day thanks to their hard work. They live in Cumbe, Cuenca, where there are large pastures and fields, modern constructions and the charm of traditional architecture. Local people are kind and keep the culture and traditions of their parents. 

One of the members is María. She has been with the group for 9 years and has made very good friends. They support each other and have become a united family. María is a 35-year old woman who is married and has a 15-year old daughter in school. Her husband works as a driver and they own the house where they live. María works breeding chicken, guinea pigs, sheep and cows, and sells milk. She also works in agriculture for her own consumption and for sale. These activities have allowed her to support her family and provide them with a better quality of life. 

She will use the loan to buy a milky cow. Her goal is to finish the construction of their house.

loans.use: to buy a milky cow.

loans.name: Mahuzar

texts.en:
Mahuzar is 52 years old, married and the mother of five children. She has managed her small farm for almost 27 years. Mahuzar is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.

Her husband works as a driver. They are blessed with five children. Due to a lack of capital for her agricultural business, she would like to access a loan of manat 1500. She will use her loan funds to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides for her farm.

She hopes that her farm will continue to grow and become more productive so that she can earn more income with which to support her family. 

Mahuzar relies on the goodwill of the lenders and she will be thankful to them for supporting her in sustaining and developing her small business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric material for making clothes

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: Elida, tiene 41 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en una comunidad  que pertenece a Taulabe. Hace tres años decidió tener una actividad que le genere ingresos. Ella vende artículos para cocina como ser platos, vasos, ollas, juego de cucharas, y también vende ropa. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y vende por pedidos. El préstamo que solicita es el cuarto ciclo y es por 10,000 lempiras, con el cual va surtir de mercadería como ropa y artículos de cocina. Su objetivo es tener buen inventario para obtener más utilidades. Su plan es tener un local propio para el negocio.
texts.en:
Elida is 41 years old, she is a widow, and she has two children.  They live in a community of Taulabe.  Three years ago she began a business in order to make an income.  She sells kitchen supplies such as plates, cups, pots, pitchers, and she also sells clothing.  She runs this business from her home and sells her goods by foot.

She is in her fourth loan cycle.  This loan is for 10,000 lempiras which she will use to stock up on merchandise such as clothing and kitchen supplies.  Her goal is to have good inventory so that she can gain more customers.  Her plan is to have her own local storefront for her business.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise such as clothing and kitchen supplies - all for sale.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Generalmente cuando las situaciones de la vida se vuelven difíciles principalmente para el padre de familia, hay esposas que motivan al esposo para no rendirse y salir adelante. 

Mario de 33 años y padre de tres hijos, eligió el negocio de ventas de consumo diario, sugerencia por su señora esposa.  Lleva tres años de dedicarse a este negocio.  

El negocio ha prosperado tanto que Mario se ha animado a solicitar un préstamo para ampliarlo y como meta abrir otros tipos de negocios.

Y todo gracias a la sugerencia y tacto de su esposa, y por supuesto de seguir ese consejo.
texts.en:
When life situations become difficult, mainly for the father of a family, there are wives who motivate their husbands to move forward, to not give up.

Mario, 33 years old and the father of three children, chose the grocery store business on his wife's suggestion.  He has been in this business for three years and it has prospered so much that Mario was inspired to request a loan to expand and, as a goal, open other types of businesses.

All this is thanks to his wife's suggestion and tact--and, of course, to following her advice.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Lilian Veronica

texts.es: Doña Lillian es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, de 29 años de edad, acompañada, y se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa nueva en los sectores aledaños a su comunidad y fuera de su comunidad. Ella solicita el crédito invertir en mercadería, como es blusas, camisetas, Jean, shorts, brazier, blúmer, bóxer, camisolas, talladores, etc. La socia lleva dieciocho años que la institución le brinda financiamiento para la compra de sus productos y ha demostrado ser una socia honrada, y ha logrado mayores ganancias que le permite reinvertir en su negocio y aportar a los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Lillian is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman.  She is 29 years old, she is married, and she sells new clothing in her community and the surrounding areas.

She is seeking a loan so that she can invest in merchandise such as blouses, t-shirts, jeans, shorts, bras, underwear, boxers, sweatshirts, etc. She has been a member of the institution for 18 years and has used financing for the purchase of her products.  She has demonstrated that she is an honorable woman and she has increased her income which has enabled her to reinvest in her business and to pay her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy blouses, t-shirts, jeans, shorts, bras, underwear, boxers, sweatshirts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric material for making shirts, trousers and skirts

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a single woman who has no children. She lives in her own house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transportation.

Racheal operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreaks causing losses as a challenge in the business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabrics and zips for making skirts

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is married with six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase seven sacks of coconuts and expand her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of coconuts to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric to sew skirts.

loans.name: Sumita

texts.en:
Sumita is a 39-year-old woman who hails from Maynaguri. She is married and is blessed with three daughters; amongst them two are students. One is in grade ten, and the other is in college. She studied until grade ten, but her husband is illiterate and can sign his name only. They live in their own small house in a village named Khagrabari in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Sumita's husband has an agribusiness. He grows seasonal vegetables. He has no consistent income, and that's why Sumita rears cattle to help her husband to run the family well. She has one cow, and she supplies milk to her neighbors to earn income for her family.  

Now Sumita wants to purchase one more dairy cow so that she can sell the milk in large amounts. She provides vaccine and fodder to her cow when it's required. She sells the milk in her village with the help of her husband. Every morning, she takes the cow to graze in the fields and returns by noon. Then she cooks for her family. She resumes taking care of her cow by feeding it at home. Her husband assists her in selling the milk and maintaining the cow. In this way, she is earning to control her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily activities.

She wants to enlarge her business, so she wants to purchase one more cow. In this way, she can earn a good amount after all the expenditures of her business. She has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that she can earn more and control their family's cash flow.

With the help of the profit earned, she wants to provide higher education to her daughters. She wants to thank her lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Héctor Armando

texts.es:
No puede concebirse una ciudad sin los servicios públicos necesarios como es la salud.  Tampoco no puede concebirse que en esos servicios públicos no haya una vocación especial para ello tratándose de la salud del pueblo.

Suchitepequez es una ciudad con personas muy capacitadas para cada servicio público.  Una de esas personas se llama Héctor, de 30 años con tres hijos.

Héctor trabaja en un laboratorio clínico como enfermero desde hace tres años.  Está consciente de que en su labor se necesita sentido humano y de servicio.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo para la construcción de su casa y darles un mejor ambiente de vida a sus hijos y prepararlos para el futuro.
texts.en:
We cannot conceive of a city without necessary public services such as health services.  Nor can we conceive that there are no people working in these public services.

Suchitepequez is a city in which people are qualified to work in these public services.  One of these people is Hector.  He is 30 years old and has three children.

Hector has worked in a laboratory/clinic as a nurse for the past three years. He is aware that you need meaning in your work and to feel like you're providing a good service.

He is seeking a loan for the construction of his home.  He wants to provide a better living environment for his children and prepare them for the future.

loans.use: to build his house.

loans.name: Malvina

texts.en:
Malvina is 33 years old. She lives in Lagodekhi district, Kakheti region, East Georgia, with her husband and three sons. Malvina purchases milk and produces yogurt to sell locally. Her husband works as a baker and gets a small monthly salary. 

Malvina decided to purchase a cow and use her own milk for yogurt. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,800 Gel. With the received credit, she will purchase a cow and will milk the cow every day to produce fresh yogurt to sell. This will increase her income, and she will be able to improve the living conditions of her sons.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and produce dairy products in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Parvana

texts.en:
Parvana is a 34-year-old young client from the Imisli region. She has two kids and is a very caring mother. Her first goal is to give her kids a good life. For that she is working everyday without rest. This activity provides an important source of income for her family, because through planting and growing fruits, they have been able to succeed and move forwards. Parvana has run a local grocery store for more than seven years. In her store she sells fruits and vegetables. She is the only breadwinner in the family. Her husband and mother help her in organizing her business.

To be able to keep her small business functioning in a sustainable way, Parvana needs to make some investments. A loan of 1000 AZN will be a huge support to this hardworking woman and her family, and will enable her to purchase more fruits to resell in her store. The latter will make Parvana’s store more competitive.

She is relying on the goodwill of the lenders and she will be thankful to them for supporting her in sustaining and developing her small business.

loans.use: to purchase more  fruits to resell in her store

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
Melecio is 52 years old, from the community of Baybay in the province of Leyte. He is married with one child still living with him and his wife. Melecio runs a small farm where he grows bitter gourds, tomatoes, spring onions and peanuts. He also raise goats for additional income. The recent typhoon Yolanda has ravaged his livelihood and has posed a challenge to his family’s daily living. He is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to rebuild his barn for the goats, buy seeds and to cultivate his farm again.

His income will be for his family’s needs like food and home repair.

loans.use: to repair his barn, buy seeds and start farm cultivation

loans.name: Nicat

texts.en:
Nicat is a young client, 25 years of age, who lives with his parents. He works as a laborer on a water project team. They build water channels for their region. He has been working on this project for three years and his monthly income is 70 AZN.

Azerbaijan develops very fast and every year many regions have many changes. One of the most important parts for life in each region is water. Young people take part in water projects in order to build water channels and make life in their region better.

Nicat’s income isn’t enough to cover his family’s demands and the team has to improve the project in order to increase his income. He applied for a 400 AZN loan in order to buy quality tools for work.

loans.use: to buy quality tools for work.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
To make a living, Virgilio has been operating a fishing business and his earnings from this sustain his family's needs. His previous loans were used for fishing and they were successfully repaid with his generated income. 

To gain more, Virgilio took a new loan recently to purchase additional fishing nets.

Virgilio wants to improve the general living situation of his family, and to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 40-year-old single woman who is blessed with three children. She has been operating a school or learning institution, alongside with a retail shop, for a period of eight years. She is earning an income of KES.8,000 at the end of every month.

Annah was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer, and is now servicing her first loan of KES.15,000.  She intends to use this entire amount to buy mathematics, English, science, social studies, and CRE textbooks to add to her school library.

Annah plans to use the anticipated income to finish constructing the upper primary classrooms and hopes to start a secondary school in the near future.

loans.use: To buy additional school text books for upper primary classes.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, aged 35, is a mixed farmer who has been doing farming for the past nine years and really enjoys farming. Her primary sources of income are crop farming, dairy farming and personal business, and through these ventures she has been able to make ends meet. 

Alice is a caring mother of two adorable children whom she really treasures because they are her “apple of the eye”. Alice and her family live in Kerugoya area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile and has good weather patterns that support farming activities.

Alice is very enterprising, and through farming, she has been able to support her family, although she has been facing challenges. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements that will assist her to produce more. With the loan, Alice will be able to completely turn around her life because the production level on her farm will increase, and this means more income. Through the loan, she will be able to assure her family of improved living standards, and she is confident that the new profits will allow her to comfortably repay the loan. 

Alice intends to purchase more land through savings that she would have made, and this will assure her family of a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is married and blessed with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Over the years she has operated a dry fish selling business, selling at the market to town dwellers and passersby. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a rental house in the near future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase prawns and dry fish to sell. She joined Yehu because of favorable loaning policies.

loans.use: to purchase prawns and dry fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as a bag of rice, fish, oil, etc

loans.name: Sahiyali

texts.en:
Sahiyali is 51-years-old, married, and he has three children. He raises seasonal fruits and vegetables, such as corn, cucumbers, tomatoes, apples, pears, peaches, plums, and cherries. But, he has a problem with water because every time he has to borrow water from his neighbor in order to water his land.  

Sahiyali needs your financial support. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in the amount of AZN 600. With this money, he plans to buy tools to build sluiceway. He is thankful to Kiva and the Aqroinvest organization for a loan.

loans.use: to buy tools to build sluiceway.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old. She is married and together with her husband they have been blessed with four children between the ages of 13 and 6 years old.

Mary sells fruits and vegetables, a business she has done for the last 8 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. She has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 20,000 which she will use to buy vegetables for resale.

Mary will use the anticipated profits to pay rent, school fees for her children as well as loan repayment.

Mary's hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her business further.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single woman who owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Jane has operated a tailoring business for the past 5 years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela has been saving for many days to make home improvements, but most of the savings are spent on household expenses. Now she wants to buy additional grocery goods to sell to improve sales and revenue. 

Therefore, Rosela has requested a loan so that she can buy additional grocery goods to sell and repair her house with the contribution of her savings. 

Rosela wants to have a comfortable and a better living with her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy candy, biscuits and soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cardio equipment for his gym.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman who has three children of whom all attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Kwekwe dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 10,000, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough bananas, peanuts, etc. to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man who lives in rural western Uganda with his family. He has been in agriculture all his life, especially cattle rearing. It is this business that him and the household have depended on for their livelihood, paying tuition, and meeting all their basic needs. 

He wishes to buy cows from the neighbours but does not have liquid cash; that is the reason he is coming to UGAFODE, so that he can solve his financial puzzle. 

He is grateful that Kiva lenders, through UGAFODE, are committed to seeing him flourish in business. He will make profits when he has sold the cows at a later time after 3-6 months.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Evas

texts.en:
Evas is a 30-year-old married woman with three children. All her children are in school. She comes from the Kashozi Ibanda district. Evas deals in fish selling as her main source of income. 

She has applied for a loan 800,000 to plaster her house, and will use part of the money to pay tuition for her children.

Her challenge in business is mainly poor storage facilities which end up making her fish go bad, and poor transport means to the market, affecting her income. 

She is thankful to UGAFODE and Kiva lenders because her house will be more habitable when its well finished.

Evas is a very honest and hardworking woman

loans.use: To buy lime, cement, and paint

loans.name: Libertad En Progreso  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Liberad en Progreso está formado por 13 señoras que viven en la comunidad Zhizho en la parroquia La Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, en las pampas de esta parroquia se libró la famosa Batalla del 27 de febrero de 1.829, fecha que es recordada año a año. Su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, las socias se dedican a varias actividades las que les permite mejorar la economía de sus hogares, son personas muy amables, cordiales y alegres que luchan día a día en sus trabajos siempre con una sonrisa.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora María, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 22, 21 y 18 años, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su último hijo estudia en un colegio del sector, su esposo es una persona muy trabajadora y siempre está velando por su familia
Doña María se dedica a la cría de cuyes y gallinas, tiene ganado del cual vende la leche, también se dedica a la agricultura es para el consumo de su casa y si existe algún sobrante lo vende. En su tiempo libre también se dedica al bordado actividad que la aprendió trabajando. El dinero de su crédito es para compra de telas para los bordados y alimento para sus animales. Su meta es tener un taller más grande de costura.
texts.en:
The group Libertad en Progreso has 13 members who live in the community of Zhizho in the parish of La Victoria del Portete, Cuenca. The famous battle of February 27, 1829 took place in this parish and is commemorated every year. Local people work in stockbreeding and agriculture. The group members work in various activities that allow them to improve the financial situation of their households. They are very kind and cheerful, and fight every day in their jobs without losing their smiles. 

One of the members is María, a 45-year old woman who is married and has 3 children, ages 22, 21 and 18. The oldest ones work and contribute to household expenses; the youngest one attends school. Her husband is very hard-working and is always taking care of the family. María works breeding guinea pigs, hens and cows, and sells milk. She also works in agriculture for their own consumption and for sale if they had produce in excess. She likes to embroider in her free time, something that she learned while working. 

She will use the loan to buy fabric for embroidery and food for the animals. Her goal is to have a bigger sewing study.

loans.use: to buy fabric for embroidery and food for the animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as food, slippers, rice and scratch cards to sell.

loans.name: Egda Luz

texts.es: Egda Luz: Es una mujer alegre y sociable, tiene 50 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hijo mayor de edad. Con el objetivo de brindarle a su familia una vivienda segura y con las condiciones necesarias, solicita su segundo financiamiento, para comprar materiales de construcción: zinc, clavo, madera y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Egda Luz is a cheerful and sociable woman. She is 50 years old, married, and has a child who is an adult. In order to provide her family a secure home with the necessary conditions, Egda Luz is requesting her second loan so that she can buy construction materials such as zinc, nails, and wood. She will also cover the cost of labor.

Her dream is to have a decent home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods, such as rice and red oil, to sell.
